36195465.review:
[h1] ШЕДЕВР СОВРЕМЕННЫХ ИНДИ ИГР [/h1]
[b] 2091 год, человечство достигло огромных высот в кибернетике и технологиях, связанных с развлечением; богатые люди играются с бедными, как с куклами; хакеры взламывают чужие мозги. Именно таков мрачный киберпанк RUINER [/b]
С самого начала и до самого конца игра держит тебя в напряжении своей брутальностью, стилем игры и динамичными боями, которые даже на средней сложности сложны.
[u] АТМОСФЕРА [/u]
Она просто мозговзрывательна. Враги, NPC, локации, персонажи, а особенно главный герой (Ооо, эта маска...) просто льют на тебя поток киберпанка.
[u] ГЕМПЛЭЙ [/u]
Как я и говорил выше - игра сильно держит в напряжении. Игра драйвовая и очень увлекательная. Есть побочные миссии, которые интересно выполнять. Но самое главное - игра реально сложная во многих моментах, от чего просто начинает припекать в пятой точке. Вдобавок ко всему, с каждым видом врагов нужна отдельная тактика, в чем и помогает прокача. В любой момент можно просто убрать какие-то перки и добавить вместо них другие. 
[u] ГРАФИКА [/u] 
Очень сочная картинка, от которой нет тоски, но и блевать не хочется. 
[u] ИТОГ [/u] 
Ну и что я могу сказать? Однозначно рекомендую, как сказал один человек: "12 из 10". Ну и не забывайте: [h1] "Если выживешь, увидимся там, где небо встречается с землёй." [/h1]

36192884.review:
Within an hour of playing the game I can mostly speak to the horrid game mechanics which have left me with only regret of spending the $16.99 CAD I did when this game was on sale. The game houses a top down Diablo esc view with a cyberpunk like setting. The visuals and soundtrack leave me stunningly impressed and really set the mood for a game like this. Though looks aren't the entire game as this is an amazing example of. You'll find that most of the time while you play the game that when you die, it'll be out of lack of responsiveness to your input then being bested by the game, which almost seems like a mechanic since there is a system that tracks and rewards you for dying a large amount of times. The skills system allows you to set up a loadout with various equipment and tools to use in each fight but doesn't really allow for any indepth development of a specific playstyle. Your skill points can be placed and refunded so that you can build new kits and try out new things without punishment but unfortunately you are /REQUIRED/ to reorganize to fight each boss or set of enemies. So there is no way to focus purely on a melee build or a run and gun build, there are tools that are absolutely necessary and some which are trivial to even have other then to make the skill page seem more plentiful. Speaking of bosses, they all possess a rinse and repeat styled fight sequence, if I had the time or the interest you could set a macro to run the boss fight for you, and by the time you finish it you'll have lost interest to continue playing besides just wanting to finish that boss and get the next checkpoint. 

I'll still try to beat the game but to any people looking to purchase I'd advise against it. The only thing you'll be doing is slamming your head against the wall.

36181690.review:
[h1] 《荒潮》	[/h1]
无法避开这本小说，虽然小说人物扁平苍白，故事毫无逻辑而可笑，从故事来说还是人物塑造来说，这都是一本失败的小说。但这本小说却有一个无可置疑的优点：小说以丰富的细节和铺垫塑造了一个未来。一个被电子垃圾围绕，四处用燃烧销毁PVC材料，流民把富人遗弃的义体植入自己身体，弥漫着提取贵金属的酸浴池的致癌气体的硅屿。某种意义上极其类似游戏中的世界。
[h1]一个堕落恐怖的未来[/h1]
游戏中，主角没有他自己的名字，对于“她”来说，主角只是个宠物，对于他哥哥来说，他更是个工具，器官储藏器。他所有的目的都是做无意义的杀戮，他是被一次次欺骗带领到天堂总部的。
小说里又一个很荒谬的细节，人沉迷于通过科技互相交换自己身体的控制权，最后酿成超载的事故，尸体燃烧的只剩下灰，躺在棺材里的是神经刺激仪的残骸。数据替代了人的意义。
[h1]现实？[/h1]
美洲是最大的电子垃圾出产地，而亚洲热衷于进口电子垃圾，没有《巴塞尔公约》，环境署不愿意涉足，这类的群体（电子垃圾人）已经随着科技发展数量剧增，越来越多的边缘人成为这群人的一部分，甚至已经成为了庞大的产业。同时生物科技的发展已经开始走到了“人”实验的边缘，试想当基因工程亵渎人本身之后，那么人将会变得怎样的低廉卑微。
[b]科技发展不总会带来光明和进步[/b]，游戏中，“天堂”也只是一个垄断企业。
update
谈谈游戏本身的设计
[h1]物流主宰[/h1]
物流主宰的设计理念毫无疑问起源于《陶威尔教授的头颅》（《童梦失魂夜》《神秘博士》等，最著名的是《星际迷航（？）》），一个象征着人不知节制的贪婪的丑陋的头。虽然实际游戏里效果是挺可爱的。
[h1]“第三胎”[/h1]
灵感可能有两个来源：
其一：亚洲落后地区的贫穷和落后导致的杀死婴儿和遗弃/人口买卖，如今依然猖獗。
其二：罗马尼亚社会主义政府，齐奥塞斯库颁布“770号法令”为“增强国力”采取的强制生育措施，政府全面入侵个人生育权禁止堕胎离婚，派遣警察盘问生理期妇女。仅是开始，在新政后，婴幼儿死亡率增加了140%以上，地下堕胎的恶劣环境导致孕妇死亡率极其高。如今法令虽然已经随着齐的死刑被废除，但影响依然恶劣，大量那时期出生的儿童被遗弃在孤儿院，其父母大多杳无音信。根据00年统计数据，约有57万儿童遭到遗弃。
[h1]“夜店教会”[/h1]
从电视布道开始的比利格雷厄姆，无可置疑，因为媒介的改变，电视布道几乎不可能传递有价值的信息，认为电视这类的完全具象和娱乐化的媒介能传递理性和抽象/思想的内容是痴人说梦的行为。
[b]”一切公众话语日渐以娱乐的方式出现，并成为一种文化精神。我们的政治、宗教、新闻、体育、教育和商业都心甘情愿地成为娱乐的附庸，毫无怨言，甚至无声无息，其结果是我们成了一个娱乐至死的物种。” ——尼尔·波兹曼 《娱乐至死》“[/b]
这是一个绝望，只剩下肉欲和堕落的未来。人人依赖电子毒品，在虚拟世界里辗转余生。母娘和玩家认为是杀戮机器不同，[spoiler]是一对连体双胞胎姐妹包裹在义体里，整个线上虚拟世界是她们的屠宰场，人工智能甚至在她们面前有不少的人性和可爱之处(阿吉们)。[/spoiler]人在自相残杀，对于政府和巨头来说人只是一种随意贩卖的商品，是人自己造成了人的痛苦。

36181656.review: Hotline Miami wannabe, but falls way too short. It does not get fundamentals right - first of all, it clutters the screen with too many flashes and visual garbage. Action games are intense and good when you see what you are doing. Second - the rules are not clear enough. In Hotline Miami, one hit meant one kill. It was simple, fast, and allowed you to plan. Here, enemies take multiple hits, you don't see clearly when they die. Lastly melee hits are accompanied by annoying slowdowns, probably to emphasize some "cinematic effect". Please don't do it - it breaks the flow of the action, throws off timing, and is generally annoying. Hotline Miami nor Dark Souls have these annoying slowdowns, and are better games for it. Well designed games do not need these crutches. And lastly - combat itself is not interesting enough. So, better luck next time!

36126999.review:
This game reminds me  hotline miami 2, great style/aesthetics, great soundtrack but plagued by bad gameplay choices and level design

Levels are just the same linear style corridors, with it being mostly arena style sections where you face of waves of enemies attacks. At first its ok, but later on in the game it really begins to drag on, and starts feeling like busy work.

Skill and Abilities seem diverse at first as you get free will to upgrade and choose whenever you want but in the end most are just fun for experimentation but lose their luster very fast and it the boils down to really only dashing and shielding. 

All the enemies are just the same archetype, one that shoots and one that punches. the only variation is that they just get buffer and use shielding and dashing ability more frequently but thats it. 

most boss fights range from interesting to, too easy , and down right time consuming, with some just ending up being twitch fests, as you hope to god to don't die the 50th time (it also doesnt help that upgrades can spawn out of bounds if the boss dies to close to edge, meaning you wasted your whole time). Many of the mini-boss are just the same only they look different, and get more buffer as the game goes on.

Sountrack is unique, as it fits not the kind of music you listen to actively, but fits into the background as your completely focused on shooting and hacking

As with any cyberpunk setting, you'll get the usual sprawls, slums and industrial enviroments but despite the lack of variety, RUINER still captures that dystopian tecnho-hell hole we all wish we could live and at the same time don't want to. From the pervasive lights of passing hover cars to the burning sparks of steel factories, you can't help but just notice it all.

Story: Unless you go around the game and do the busy-work side missions , the story is sufficient in giving you a reason to push on, but don't expect anything mind-blowing or philosphical. 

I played this on hard (developers recommended), and this game can really turn alot people off if you play on this difficulty, it's like playing those  japanese shoot'em where the fun is being having to go through trial and error while getting no breaks or breathers where ONLY THE CHOSEN ONE can beat this game.

Would I recommend this game....... no unless your really into the cyberpunk genre, "style over substance" games, or enjoy being masochistic.

36076391.review:
RUINER is this really pretty neon pit that a good game almost crawled out of. The whole thing looks like you're playing through concept art. The setting and ~worldbuilding~ are evocative, but you could say the same thing about every other cyberpunk game on Steam.

Where RUINER loses me is the feedback. Enemies and bosses feel like sacks of hit points with no stun frames. The game wants you to get up close and do cool melee moves but punishes you for trying it. The sound is muted and mumbly -- compare it with Nuclear Throne, a game with sound design that lets you absolutely know when you've connected with an enemy.

RUINER commits to a visual aesthetic over relaying useful information to you. Are those red lights setting dressing? Are they objects to interact with? Or are they split-second markers before an enemy deep strikes from above the map, insta-gibbing you? Can you tell these elements apart in a room with several quick-death threats, sometimes with objects in the foreground obscuring the action below?

I'm going to be That Guy who compares anything slightly frustrating to Dark Souls, but I feel like Dark Souls can get away with monsters offering subtle tells because they're so big on the screen. In RUINER, the camera is too high to give you anything to study. I couldn't tell you what the last two or three bosses look like. At that height, they're all faceless dolls with slightly different kinds of weapons.

This game wasn't for me. If you love neon-soaked dystopias so much you'll chew through janky controls and feedback (basically, if you loved Brigador), then you'll get a lot out of this game. As for me, I feel like I was sold a bill of goods.

35974900.review:
I am so torn with this title, but when it comes down to it, I recommend RUINER.

Gameplay:
The bread and butter of the game. The most enjoyable part by far, and what made playing it through a complete blast. I have heard comments of the difficulty being too high, but I played after the changes to Mother. And I can say that even on the hardest difficulty it is an enjoyable, fair experience. I have died on a few parts, but it is quick to jump back in. 

For those who need frames of reference for the gameplay, think titles like Hotline Miami, Hyper Light Drifter, Binding of Issac, Enter the Gungeon, hell, even titles like Dead Ops Arcade have the same feels to it. Of course there are distinct differences that pull it apart from every one of these titles, it feels like it's found it's place and knows it. 

Soundtrack:
Another smack out of the park. Very gutteral, harsh, and broken down mechanical. The soundtrack is up on spotify, and features tracks from artists like  Sidewalks and Skeletons and Zamilska. It is heart pumping but emotionless. Its the type of tracks that give you tunnel vision as you bloody the streets of Rengkok. It is a sweet addition and makes the gameplay even more intense.

Story:
This is what kills me. I [i] want [/i] to believe this has an amazing story, but it really hurts. REALLY hurts. There's so much ambiguity even with a dedicated lore tab. A lot of this ambiguity isnt even plot related, but just aims for a "Mysterious" world vibe, but ends up just pulling me away from Rengkok. I dont feel any connection, hell I only wander the streets as random quotes are thrown at me from NPCs as I try to get to my next objective. As "Puppy", I don't even know his drives, and the only time you get any sense of who he is at the end, and even then it's such a cliche. The biggest twists made me feel nothing except to just go "huh. I guess x is actually y. okay.". For such an awesome title to play through, and such a short game at that, the story isnt bad enough that it hurts the gameplay, but it's the worst part in that there is so much that COULD be there, but isnt. It's a Destiny situation here, but without any lorebuilding at least Destiny had. 

Difficulty:
Found no problems here, in certain sections it's a little tedious but you will progress at a steady rate, just be ready to die a lot :-)

Visuals (Non-technical): 
Ranges from dropdead gorgeous, to meh. I love the character designs. Puppy is probably my favorite looking protagonist in the past 3 years.  Your "Hacker Friend" is such a unique looking ally that I cant help but adore the dynamic duo Reikon Games has delivered. Some levels (Mainly Heaven, and the level before it) are expansive and tuned with the soundtrack are exactly what the game is going for and slam dunks it. However, the other levels are just "Oh, asphault, oh lava, oh metal walkways" and feel mediocre at best.

OVERALL TL;DR:
I recommend this game on what it does best: Kickass combat, kickass tunes, and kickass characters. However, if you're looking for a great story (or anything close), you best look elsewhere.

35955948.review:
Ruiner is an excellent game with tons of action. It's got a nice and dark cyberpunk atmosphere throughout with enough lore and story to support the action. Though the focus is mainly on the action, characters you interact with (violently or otherwise) are also interesting and help you immerse yourself in the world.

There's a nice variety of skills available and you can move your skill points around whenever you want to, which lets players get creative and find their own playstyles. The game has a well paced leveling system. You really do feel your progression from a weakling to a killing machine throughout the game. And the combat overall feels very satisfying. Guns especially are a ton of fun to use.

All in all I'd highly recommend Ruiner and am looking forward to more of it in the future.

35954668.review:
Minha face é um letreiro de palavras de ordem, por minhas veias flui óleo de máquina, bits e sede de matança, meus braços são duas armas que carregam armas, que carregam a morte em cada esquina enquanto o tempo se interrompe para dançar a minha dança, os corpos se empilham e os marcadores de energia cintilam na periferia da visão, interrompidos por novos flashes de inforragia e o inexorável comando de KILL THE BOSS. Sou aquele que traz a ruína. Sou aquele que vaga pelas ruínas do que deveria ser um futuro perfeito.

Eu sou Ruiner.

O título de estreia da Reikon Games é uma injeção de adrenalina com seringa de silício direto no peito, uma cusparada ácida no sonho tecnológico, um dedo do meio estendido com fúria e caos, um liquidificador digital que mistura a estética de animes, fanzines de música, Heavy Metal, Ranxerox, neon, Blade Runner, punk rock e Robocop e regurgita do outro lado um intenso caldo cultural, reciclado, falho em vários pontos, mas com gosto forte.

O ano é 2091 e a cidade fictícia de Rengkok é a nova Miami, castigada por cores cegantes, corrupção, crime, párias sociais e com um assassino à solta. As semelhanças com Hotline Miami não param por aí e vão pontuar essa jornada: o protagonista também utiliza uma máscara e é conduzido quase como uma marionete de cenário em cenário para realizar aquilo que faz de melhor, uma coreografia brutal de assassinato combinando armas e habilidades, morrendo quase tantas vezes quanto mata, até conseguir a vitória. Mas aqui o cartunesco é substituído por um hiper-realismo exacerbado, por um brilhante jogo de sombras e uso de tons, que destacam a decadência desse futuro e a violência de seus habitantes.

KILL THE BOSS

A vida humana tem pouco ou nenhum valor, e mesmo o protagonista é tratado como lixo por todos, inclusive por aqueles que supostamente seriam seus aliados. Não é estragar segredos afirmar que sentimentos bonitos foram deletados de Ruiner e sua narrativa, quando funciona, mergulha em uma espiral de batalhas sem sentido, sobrevivência do mais forte e KILL THE BOSS. Seu enredo não se conta narrando ou apenas em cenas de corte, mas se resolve também na truculência das lutas e até mesmo nas telas de resultado de cada confronto, que avaliam sua performance mas também reforçam que seu "herói" nada mais é que um objeto a ser controlado, uma personagem em um grande jogo, invadindo assim o campo da metalinguagem, ainda que sem atingir o próprio jogador, como em Hotline Miami.

Essa cidade futurista e sem esperanças exala vida nos momentos de respiro entre cada luta e convida a exploração, mas o que ela oferece também é uma máscara para o caldeirão em ebulição em suas ruas, abrigo para rejeitados, fortaleza para os poderosos, laboratório para estranhas combinações de corpo e máquina, púlpito para novas leis, novas religiões, nenhuma delas capaz de suprir a necessidade humana de alento, tudo convergindo para um único ponto de desequilíbrio e o protagonista é aquele que dá o chute final, aquele que provoca a queda, o "arruinador", embora ele também faça parte dessa grande família de refugos.

KILL THE BOSS

É o cyberpunk vivo e ainda pulsante, três décadas depois de sua concepção, ainda agressivo e quase ali em nosso futuro, a lembrança desagradável que nem todos os avanços tecnológicos do mundo serão capazes de mudar a lei da selva urbana, onde os ferrados serão ainda mais ferrados e os poderosos ainda mais poderosos, senhores de corpo e mente de uma massa que rasteja por labirintos de plástico, concreto e sinais digitais. Não há elegância em Ruiner, não há poesia, apenas o rugido dos esquecidos em conflito.

A Reikon Games escolheu a violência como ferramenta de diálogo com esse mundo, mais do que a exploração ou a investigação. Questionamentos não são permitidos e tampouco existe tempo para avaliar esse futuro vermelho e negro quando as balas começam a voar em todas as direções. Em sua superfície, Ruiner é um twin-stick shooter, onde é possível correr para um lado e olhar para outro e a habilidade de se desviar dos ataques é tão importante quanto a habilidade de distribuir dano. Mas, essa é apenas a camada mais superficial, porque o título também agrega um complexo sistema de perícias que exploram todas as possibilidades de ataque e reforçam a velocidade e a letalidade do protagonista: ele pode se se movimentar em saltos entre espaços no meio da luta, ele pode ampliar seus reflexos e reduzir o fluxo do tempo, projetar barreiras cinéticas. Ele é fruto desse futuro, o predador supremo, e cabe a seu condutor empregar esse amplo leque de opções para triunfar em combates impiedosos.

KILL THE BOSS

Em mãos habilidosas, o "herói sem nome" é um bailarino da destruição, um artista da carnificina que se movimenta com a graciosidade de um ninja ciborgue. Em mãos menos habilidosas ele é um furacão de tiros, lâminas e até mesmo um pedaço de cano, atropelando oponentes, sobrevivendo com uma mistura de sorte e recursos. O resultado final é o mesmo e o titulo não esconde: cadáveres, sangue e pedaços humanos e cibernéticos. Inicialmente, Ruiner foi lançado com uma dificuldade exacerbada, mas a Reikon Games reduziu o desafio para quem joga nos níveis mais baixos.

Mas se a desenvolvedora obteve êxito na reprodução do que define o cyberpunk, falhou em adicionar seu toque ao gênero. Não há nada de novo no fronte aqui e sua estrutura se torna bastante repetitiva depois do impacto inicial, com níveis (e inimigos) muito similares entre si e nenhum conceito inédito que dê fôlego extra a essa visão do futuro. Não é pouca coisa o que Ruiner realiza, mas o potencial para ir além é desperdiçado diante do deslumbre.

O próprio combate poderia receber mais polimento. Ainda que o sistema de recarregamento depois de cada morte seja instantâneo (o que se adequa com perfeição ao conceito de que a vida não vale nada), os controles poderiam ser mais precisos e não foram poucas as vezes em que morri justamente porque a resposta do personagem não foi a que eu estava esperando. E volto a comparar Hotline Miami com Ruiner: se aquele exigia precisão do jogador, ele também oferecia isso em seus controles; enquanto aqui a liberdade de ação tática concedida disfarça (mas nem sempre) que os controles não são tão precisos. A abordagem linear dos níveis também depõe contra Ruiner, enquanto Hotline Miami, similar em termo de ritmo de combate, apresentava níveis com múltiplas rotas e formas de executar o combate.

Finalizando os aspectos negativos, é impossível não apontar para uma falha crucial do sistema de habilidades: elas são permutáveis. O jogador pode ajustar as perícias adquiridas de acordo com a necessidade, inclusive durante as batalhas. Se, por um lado isso permite que o jogador se adeque a esse ou aquele oponente que exige o uso de perícias específicas, por outro lado abre caminho para abusos ou para uma desnecessária quebra de ritmo no fluxo da combate, com a ação pausada para que se possa trocar os pontos investidos de uma habilidade para outra. Batalhas realmente flexíveis, onde diferentes perícias poderiam levar à vitória, resolveriam esse problema.

A Reikon Games é formada por veteranos poloneses oriundos de Dead Island  e The Witcher, mas suas lentes conseguem capturar uma metrópole cosmopolita que poderia estar em qualquer lugar do mundo em qualquer futuro sombrio. Misturando referências de uma forma tão veloz que é impossível identificar todas as obras que a compõem, eles produzem um coquetel que não é para qualquer paladar, seja pela brutalidade de seu combate ou pela brutalidade de sua estética, mas, sem sombra de dúvidas, um coquetel que irá incendiar aqueles que aceitarem seu convite e vestirem essa máscara.

KILL THE BOSS.

Probably the most stylish game set in the cyberpunk genre of the last decade. 

This is a game with a steep learning curve (I died 35 times on the first level, on hard), but rewards players with aestheticly pleasing, fast gameplay. It only took about 8 hours to beat the game on the first playthrough, but they were 8 action packed fun-filled hours!

35885677.review:
devolver你膨胀了，竟然有难度选择了。
玩惯D社的游戏的人，请选择困难开局。
那才是真正的D社味道。 ：）~have fun

9小时困难难度通关（也不知道死了多少次了）。
这游戏越玩到最后越简单，因为后面游戏提供的升级点数给了你足够多的玩法和应对办法。
给后面来的、或者卡关的老哥一点小建议。
1、冲刺很重要，冲刺能减少60%的伤害判定在游戏里其实很BUG。如果冲刺一脉全点上，你基本能在一个房间里随便乱冲；躲激光、躲AOE、躲炸弹无所不能！（无脑冲就没必要了啊，狂冲容易被卡住接一顿暴打那就很尴尬了）
2、屏障一周目比护盾好用；屏障防御面大，而且减速的功能也适合刀手们随意切瓜；也适合枪手在屏障内稍停片刻调整身位。风筝boss可以用冲刺反身接屏障减速boss，这样枪手打起来很舒服。
3、BOSS战；我大概分两种boss吧，一种是刀客，一种是枪手。
--1、刀客boss，能用冲刺-屏障风筝打枪一直打到死。
--2、枪手boss，能量枪（光线持续伤害）的，扛刀，绕背身，开屏障，狂砍。
                          步枪、乱丢垃圾的，用屏障格挡伤害大的AOE，加上冲刺躲避弹幕，冲刺过程中能一直开枪不要忘了哦~同时还要时刻留意开屏障格伤害哦~  ：）
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
去他妈的吧，这个游戏肯定是靠密集的弹幕以及高伤害来拖延你的游戏时间而已。：）
面对所有boss你只要学会
1、通用系生命值增幅脉-射击回复技能能力（续航性）
2、空格系技能第三个--热力感应（增加伤害）
3、F系超能感官--（子弹时间）
4、捡把射速高、伤害高的枪
当你发现你正常速率已经打不过boss了，请你默默地同时点开“F”+“空格”，然后就在逐帧逐帧的烟火表演下，优雅地猎杀boss吧~：）
-
-
-
-
什么，能量用完了BOSS没死？苟啊！开枪啊！回能量啊！打能量循环啊！！！╮(╯▽╰)╭
还有，请不要忘了你能随时随地切换技能这个设定，你懂的：）
-------------------------------------------分割线---------------------------------------------------------------
总结：
D社发行
美工精致、氛围到位
粒子效果太过绚烂，影响视线
赛博朋克科幻，美术风格强烈
游戏里面的techno做得也不差，搭配黑暗中血脉喷张的打斗，相得益彰。
场景设计偏单一，重复素材较多，还好优秀的美工和氛围盖住了。
游戏剧情。。。呃。算了，就当是看了一部B级片就行了，D社你不就是游戏届里最大的B级片发行商吗？！！
所以
值得一买，值得尝试，的确算是一个很优秀的独立游戏了~

35862588.review:
[h1]Get up and try again![/h1]

Ruiner é um Bullet Hell de gênero cyberpunk desenvolvido pelo estúdio independente Reikon Games — que conta com alguns desenvolvedores veteranos que trabalharam em jogos como The Witcher (saga), Dying Light, This War of Mine e Shadow Warrior.

O protagonista basicamente não fala e o enredo é bastante superficial, temos a clássica história que diz: O enredo só está aí para justificar nossas ações. O jogo se inicia quando a voz de um homem dentro da nossa cabeça nos dá instruções para cair pro pau contra uma penca de inimigos a fim de executar O Boss (O Chefão). Mas antes de rodarmos a baiana, uma hacker apresentada somente como ''Her'' (''Ela'' em Português) nos liberta e informa que o homem havia hackeado nossa mente, e para acabar de completar, Ela também diz que uma corporação chamada de Heaven raptou nosso irmão. Nosso objetivo, além de salvar nosso irmão, é acabar com essa corporação.

O desenrolar da trama é contado em forma de pequenas e simples cutscenes seguidas de diálogos que lembram um pouquinho os quadrinhos de inFAMOUS. Infelizmente algumas cutscenes são apresentadas em forma de videos e a qualidade de alguns deles é um pouco baixa, acredito que fizeram isso para que o tamanho do jogo fosse diminuído, mas não tenho certeza.

Felizmente RUINER tem sua própria maneira de cativar o jogador, pois apresenta um combate e jogabilidade extremamente satisfatórios... A árvore de habilidades te dá liberdade para escolher a melhor forma de jogar, você deve adaptar-se para cada situação e cada chefe. Jogos desse gênero são conhecidos por apostarem muito na dificuldade, aqui não é diferente, o jogo te pune por qualquer errinho bobo, mas a sensação e a satisfação depois que você derrota um chefe são indescritíveis. A jogabilidade se assemelha bastante com e [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/corvinho/recommended/423230/]Furi[/url], afinal ambos são jogos do gênero Bullet Hell, porém, os níveis de RUINER são mais dinâmicos e interativos, podemos explorar os locais em busca de segredos, buscar experiência para melhorar nossas habilidades, existe um mini game semelhante ao sistema de pods do jogo HELLDIVERS, etc. Tudo isso torna o jogo muito mais agradável de se jogar, sem contar que não há aquela chatice na hora da troca de cenários e chefes.

Inicialmente o jogo se apresenta como um RPG isométrico, logo após o prologo nós podemos andar livremente pela cidade, conversar com NPC's, explorar o mundo, e até mesmo melhorar nossa árvore de habilidades, mas rapidamente você percebe que o jogo não é bem assim. Temos um objetivo e temos que cumpri-lo, por mais que você possa explorar os cenários, o caminho é linear, ou seja, você não poderá perambular por aí como em um RPG isométrico de mundo aberto (Victor Vran, Wolcen, The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing, entre outros). Fiquei um pouco triste na hora que percebi isso, pois não era bem o que eu estava esperando de RUINER, mas no final acabei adorando o jogo (aconteceu a mesma coisa com [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/corvinho/recommended/414340]Hellblade[/url]).

Mesmo com um protagonista que basicamente não fala, o jogo conta com uma quantidade razoável diálogos, e todos eles são muito bem elaborados e humorados. Ruiner também conta com uma excelente tradução para Português do Brasil, a forma que o jogo usa a linguagem informal combina perfeitamente com o gênero Cyberpunk, além disso, cada personagem tem sua forma única de conversar, Ela, por exemplo, usa muitos emojis (emoticons) no final das falas para expressar emoções (>__<). Infelizmente o jogo quase não possui voice acting (assim como Cuphead), fora que, algumas linhas de diálogo não tem seguimento, por exemplo, Ela pergunta se você se lembra de um determinado local da cidade e duas opções são exibidas: Sim ou não; responder negativamente não fará diferença, pois ela não lhe dará uma explicação clara sobre o local e o diálogo seguirá como se você tivesse respondido positivamente. — É um problema? — Definitivamente sim, porém não é algo tão prejudicial, pois como eu disse, RUINER não é um RPG complexo, o jogo é linear.

Apesar dos gráficos não serem grande coisa, o visual é incrível. Sou um pouco suspeito para falar, pois sou amante de tudo que está relacionado a cultura Cyberpunk, mas vamos lá... Na minha opinião, a ambientação é um dos pontos mais importantes de toda obra Cyberpunk, aqui não é diferente... Passeando pelas ruas estreitas da cybermetrópole Rengkok fica evidente a forte influência que o jogo teve em relação a Blade Runner, o neon e a poluição pra todo lado não irão te impedir de observar o colapso da civilização humana, volta e meia você verá pessoas reclamando e sofrendo por algo, é aí que você descobre que o futuro não é um lindo arco-íris. Rengkok é a personificação da corrupção humana.

Os desenvolvedores não pouparam referências e Easter-eggs, estão por toda parte, é até divertido buscar referências e ver se você reconhece alguma, inclusive existem diversas referências a cantores, bandas, filmes e outras obras nas conquistas, como por exemplo: Die Hard (Duro de Matar), It's over 9000! (Dragon Ball), Ashes to ashes (David Bowie), Wanted Dead Or Alive (Bon Jovi), Kill 'Em All (Metallica), Blaze it (420), Mickey Mantle (O jogador de Baseball), etc.

Outro diferencial de RUINER é sua excelente trilha sonora. Sem exagero, eu cheguei a abrir o jogo diversas vezes somente para escutar a trilha sonora, nem me lembro qual foi o último jogo fiz isso, mas provavelmente foi [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/corvinho/recommended/379720]DOOM (2016)[/url]. Enfim, a trilha também [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/721620/RUINER_Official_Soundtrack/]está disponível para compra no Steam[/url], recomendo dar uma conferida.

Diferente de [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/corvinho/recommended/423230/]Furi[/url], RUINER é melhor experienciado usando teclado e mouse, pois assim como [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/corvinho/recommended/379720]DOOM[/url], ele é frenético demais para ser jogado usando um controle (que geralmente oferece menos precisão). Inicialmente eu havia reclamando que o jogo não possuía um sistema para remapear as teclas, tenho pessoas canhotas na família e eles vivem reclamando dessa opção nos jogos, então sei o quanto é frustrante não existir esta opção in-game, mas felizmente no segundo update foi adicionado uma opção para remapear as teclas, então se você é canhoto não se preocupe. Também após o segundo update, o jogo começou a apresentar muitos crashes em determinadas partes, mas graças ao trabalho árduo dos desenvolvedores o problema foi resolvido em menos de 24 horas, este foi o único problema grave que tive em relação ao jogo.

Sobre o preço... Sinceramente, pelo conteúdo apresentado e pela experiência que RUINER me proporcionou, achei o preço  justíssimo. Porém, todos sabemos que cada um é cada um, então talvez uma promoção seja ideal (dependendo da pessoa).

[b]Dicas:[/b]
[list]
[*] Jogue no Difícil: Dificuldade recomendada pelos desenvolvedores e por mim, o desafio será intenso, mas é o ideal para jogos desse gênero;
[*] Aos platinadores de plantão: Existem várias conquistas que podem serem feitas após [spoiler]o último chefe, na área em que você é quase obliterado por centenas de inimigos[/spoiler].
[/list]

[h1]Análise fortalecida através do Curador do grupo [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/magnaway]Magnaway.[/url][/h1]
[h1]Apoie-nos seguindo nosso [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/26745635/]Curador[/url] para futuras análises.[/h1]

35837768.review:
I really enjoyed RUINER, the whole tone and art style felt pretty distinct, and combined well with the challenging twin stick shooting gameplay. There were a lot of sequences that gave me trouble, but it was always very satisfying to overcome them as I felt like I was getting better at the game.

The boss strategies weren't always as obvious as they could have been, which caused some frustration and in my case opted to check online for strategies. I thought the story was actually really cool, but it was weakened by the fact that the cutscenes are delivered with text, and not VO. There is some VO in the game, but it appears to have only been used for flavour, but the actors all sound great, so would have loved to hear them deliver more of the story lines.

+ Unique and distinct cyberpunk theme
+ Rewarding and challenging combat
+ Great music and tone
+ Ability upgrades really felt like they made a difference

- Boss strategies aren't always obvious
- It felt difficult to understand how or where to do the side quests
- No voice overs during cutscenes

Side Note: If you're on a gamepad with the default mapping you have to use the bumpers quite a bit, so I would suggest the 360 controller over the Xbox One controller, which has much less responsive bumpers.

35824595.review:
First off, take this review with a bit of salt. I'm kind of biased towards Devolver and their previously published titles such as Hotline Miami and Absolver, both of which I enjoyed very much. So when I heard that they were coming out with a CYBERPUNK top down kill 'em all (yes, that is what I call this genre), I was quite excited.

And I was not disappointed in the slightest.

PROS
- Kickass main character
- Cyberpunk setting feels very alive and believable
- A variety of enemy types
- Creative abilities that can completely change your fighting style
- Balanced iFrames. (Invincibility Frames)
- A whole slew of unique weapons
- A real challenge (complete with grading system)
- Soundtrack.

CONS
- A simple story. I won't spoil the ending, but there is a twist, albeit an easily foreseeable one.
- Meh optimization. 

Easy recommend for those who loved Hotline Miami, and to those who want a game they can sit down and get absorbed into, but still be challenged by.

35814274.review:
Pros:
-Great General Movement and Shooting Mechanics.
-Awesome art-style and graphics (I've got a mid level rig and it ran on Max 1440p 60fps constant)
-Solid progression mechanics - Large varied skill try that allows you to reasign your skill points on the fly, dependant on the enemies you are facing.
-The soundtrack and sound effects are spot on.
-Large array of arsenal at your disposal, in a Hotline Miami "1 clip then throw away" style. Unlike Hotline Miami, you have a permenent melee and ranged weapon, which do the job most of the time.

Cons:
-The story isn't brilliant, but honestly the gameplay makes up for it.
-There is very little voice acting at all, mostly one liners each time you die or complete a section. All the story is done through text, including the cutscenes. Characters just stand there and subtitles appear below them. I didn't find it engaging in the slightest.
-The quest system is really pointless imo. There are side-quests and such that you can pick up from the "hub" zone, but the game puts little emphasis on them.
-Might be a bit too challenging for some (However, the devs have dumbed down the difficulty a bit in a recent update). If you like a difficult game then this shouldn't be a concern.

If you're looking for a good top down action game, similar to Hotline Miami, and aren't fussed about story, this one is for you.

7/10

35781628.review:
Абсолютно точно не рекомендую тратить время и деньги на эту игру.
Безумная куча хвалебных отзывов в стиле: "хардкор, ура! Ультранасилие, ряя!" при этом, судя по статистике достижений steam, до конца, на момент написания этого отзыва, прошли 10% игроков, причем скорее всего большая часть этих людей проходило игру на стриме для зрителей.
Чем же игра плоха? Она не приносит удовольствия от геймплея! Ради сюжета в ней тоже делать нечего. Стилистика - прикольно первые 15 минут + хаб локация. если более подробно, то:
Отвратительное управление: с геймпада целиться не удобно, с клава/мыши камеры скачет, как безумная, плюс нажатия кнопок переключения оружия срабатывают не всегда.
В игре нет тактики: камера находиться сликшком близко к персонажу, для того чтоб играть в игру, как в шутан с видом сверху: целиться неудобно. Плюс враги - губки для пуль. Урон оружия дальнего боя слишком слаб. 
Иногда враги появляются в любом месте карты, спрыгивая сверху экрана, т.е. как то контролировать арену не в импровизации особо не получится.
ИИ врагов тоже никакущий: если на карте есть пара контейнеров и один моб или босс он легко в них заблудиться, что выглядит супер нелепо. Мобцы в хаосе говна могу убивать друг друга, во всяком случаи до патча я такое точно видел.
Одинаковые боссы: несколько раз за игру придеться убивать прыгающего мужика с огнестрелом, щитом, кучей здоровья и молотовыми. У него меняется текстурка, но в целом это все тот же босс. Еще несколько раз убиваем "Ангелов", несколько раз убиваем "Мамку", несколько раз убиваем "Киборга". В игре, если так посчитать, только один уникальный босс, который "Король трафика", остальные используются по несколько раз, потому что кризис идей и итак сойдет.
Сюжет - скучен. Читать графоманию диалогов действительно уныло, Даже заспойлерить особо нечего: немого глав героя все используют, мир оказыается симуляцией, внутри симуляции. Киберпанка в игре нет - мир не раскрыт от слова вообще. Если заменить "киберпанковые" текстурки на "фентезийный ад" сюжет не пострадает, но технопердеж, который тут вместо музыки станет неуместен.
Дизайн уровней - коридор, арена, коридор. Количество пустых коридоров и покатушек на лифте, во время которых не происходит ничего (даже диалогов не впихнули, серьезно) заставляет вспомнить первый масс эфект и польские шутаны из двухтысячных. Собственно, игра польская, так что не удивительно.
Замедление времени по любому поводу - бесит. Кончились патроны в пушке - время замедляется, подобрал пушку - время замедляется, босс зареспался, ты отнял у него немного здоровья, а игра решила, что надо "презентовать босса" - время замедляется. Забавно, это происходит даже когда активирвоана способность "замедления времени", т.е. замедление внутри замедления.
Визуальный стиль - такое чувство, что игру рисовали разные художники. Механик и японец с квестами промышленого шпионажа нарисованы совсем иначе, чем остальная игра.
Красный фильтр говна - его перебор. В какой то момент его становится так много, что действительно не понятно, что происходит на экране. В купе с низко посаженной камерой и ее безумными скачками на клаво/мыше просто бред.

Из того, что в игре понравилось: шутка про уборщика Йоши повторенная более десятка раз - это смешно. Тема со взломом котов забавная. Последние уровни с пустыми душами чуваков, держащих симуляции стилистически не плохие, но суммарно все это не стоит того, чтобы тратить время и денег на игру.

В сухом остатке игра вызвает чувство раздражения и разочарования, все хорошее, что в ней было в сравнение не идет с унынием и отвращением. Игра скучная. В нее не приятно играть, она не заслуживает внимания.

35740342.review:
Not bad. I mean, not THAT bad. Graphics, atmosphere and music are nice, and you get some amount of fun from playing.

But… this game is ruined with the thing, which, in my opinion, is the main problem of all modern games – awful balance. At the beginning it isn’t visible, since the most imbalanced stuff is locked until you level-up, but when you do… just spam-deploy barrier and spam-call supply drop to get XAAR weapon. And that’s all.  The first slows down enemy guys and deflects their shots, the second gives you infinite amounts of ranged weapons for no cost at all and with good timing – oneshots everybody.

You can get all those stuff in the very middle of game, and from that point – all fights are the same. Game actually becomes easier as you progress. The final boss battle, which is meant to be the hardest part of the game, was really “just stay and shoot” for me. All previous (miniboss) battles was “move in circles and shoot”. And yes, I tried to play differently – and never succeeded. This is not Hotline Miami, there is no room for strategic thinking – just pure reflexes with which I have problems. 

As you can guess – I got bored nearly in the middle and continued played only to uncover the story (which turned to be quiet mediocre). Doesn’t help the fact that devs were spent most of their imagination at this point too, and main challenge from that point was quantity of enemies, not their special abilities or complicated attack patterns. There are only three enemies here – melee guy, ranged weapons guy, suicide guy/thing. Minibosses are all the same – mostly ranged guys with different weapons. Only ability guys as you progress – dash (later teleport) which would be a big problem, if deployable barrier wouldn’t slow them down. Also they sometimes get new 3D models so they look nice – until you stop caring.

So, in the end – Ruiner is a game were good is everything except main – gameplay. And story, but who, except me, cares about that in twin-stick shooters? About story – I expected there will be some kind of twist in the end, but I didn’t expect that it will be boring and uninteresting twist, after which I felt only “what?!” and when it all was explained in encyclopedia entries – only “whatever”. I finished it in nearly 12 hours (some time steam was offline so official statistics a bit different) and I not regret about buying it. But I have no good feelings either so thumbs down.

P.S. This is Polish game, isn’t it? So why does it [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1169723911] sounds sometimes [/url] as a Russian one?

35707979.review:
The aesthetics and the style of the game are undeniable but I just can't get myself to enjoy the gameplay.

Most weapons feel weak, and the throwing away core really hurts the game. You get one magazine, its just barely worth picking up any new weapons but then you have things like the grinder and higher rarity or higher power weapons which feel confused as they give you a glimpse of what the game could be but then dissapoint you right away every time by their instant destruction or inability to hold more than one. 

I am also just missing the depth. Weapons have no skill cap, there is seemingly nothing to look forward to aside of the upgrade system and getting robbed of everything cool you can possibly get in the game 15 seconds in is just destroying any attachment to the game world. Give the player a third weapon slot and let him select a weapon that can be kept forever but with a resource that needs to be recharged, maybe by comboing or something similar to energy. A metal pipe and a terrible pistol is the least I want to own throughout 100% of thegame. If I could keep and switch weapons I can find throughout the world to bring in any new encounters, even if they can only be used for one durability within each encounter, that would add so much value towards the core of the game.

The game having 95% human enemies seems like a big missed opportunity. 
The combat is also very visually confusing, everything is red, in bossfights its extremely difficult to see when you actually get hit without looking directly at the health bar. There needs to be a secondary highlight color. Making everything highlighted makes nothing highlighted.  It just makes combat feel wierd and feedback random as you sometime notice it and sometime you dont, and half of the time you think you got hit but you didnt. It just feels off, same as the very strange directional movement. 

The execution, the aesthetics, the tech it all is well done but the user experience and the core design are confused and robbing the game of any fun that it builds up beforehand right away. 
I think these issues are clearly fixable but as of now, I can not really enjoy the game.

35692479.review:
https://niveloculto.com/analisis-ruiner/

¿Habéis imaginado alguna vez que pudiera hackearse un cerebro? Desde luego es la premisa perfecta para una historia de ciencia ficción. De hecho, quién sabe si en los años venideros esto será posible. Atendiendo a los últimos avances tecnológicos y al deseo irrefrenable del ser humano por alcanzar la inmortalidad, la hibridación con las máquinas parece un camino que acabaremos tomando.

Pero ello puede acarrear consecuencias desastrosas, y si no, que se lo pregunten al protagonista de Ruiner. Tras sufrir un ataque informático, un misterioso individuo se hace con el control de sus acciones. ¿El objetivo? Nada más y nada menos que matar al “jefe”. Si bien muchos de nosotros hemos soñado con esa posibilidad en repetidas ocasiones, tener que pasar sobre el cadáver de numerosos guardias aumentados para ello le quita las ganas a cualquiera. Sin embargo, nuestro personaje no tiene ningún reparo a la hora de hacerlo, ya que cuenta con una fuerza y velocidad sobrehumanas.

Una vez despachado el primer grupo de “tipos malos” una segunda hacker toma el control de su conciencia para ayudarle, comenzando así un viaje en busca de los responsables del ciberataque.

Como podemos observar desde el primer contacto, el juego cuenta con una historia y un trasfondo desarrollado. De hecho, nos brinda la posibilidad de investigar más acerca de su lore mediante la implementación de entradas de texto a modo de códice. Pero ha de quedar claro que todo ello no es más que un mero adorno para su principal punto fuerte: la acción.

En este aspecto, la ópera prima de Reikon Games no se anda con chiquitas. Poco después de pulsar el botón de start nos encontraremos luchando despiadadamente por nuestra vida. Y es que hay que dejar claro que Ruiner no es precisamente un camino de rosas.

La propuesta atesora una dificultad bastante elevada, llegando incluso a ser injusta en algunas ocasiones. Para ser completamente honesto, he de reconocer que me he visto obligado a poner el juego en el modo más fácil para poder completarlo a tiempo para el análisis. De otro modo habría tenido que dedicar muchas más horas frente a la pantalla.

Las batallas que viviremos en esta aventura se desarrollan siempre a una velocidad vertiginosa, sin permitirnos ni un mísero segundo para tomar aire. Por ello en repetidas ocasiones nos encontraremos que la supervivencia depende más de la suerte que de nuestra propia habilidad. Sin embargo, el juego nos sumerge en una mecánica de prueba y error tan enfermiza como adictiva.

Una vez que fallecemos, apenas pasan un par de segundos antes de volver al ruedo, lo que genera una espiral de adrenalina que difícilmente nos dejará escapar. También es importante destacar una de las reglas básicas de su jugabilidad: quedarse quieto tiene como consecuencia directa la muerte. Esta premisa nos recuerda irremediablemente a algunos de los mejores exponentes del género, como Doom o Hotline Miami. Además, sus melodías techno encajan a la perfección con el frenetismo de la jugabilidad y nos acompañan mientras machacamos desesperadamente los botones de nuestro ratón. En este aspecto la música cumple un papel capital en la experiencia, ya que nos sumerge aún más en este viaje de distopía cibernética.

Los únicos momentos de liberación los viviremos cuando visitemos la ciudad de Rengkok entre capítulos, llegando incluso a aceptar alguna misión secundaria. Sin embargo, si bien esto se agradece, ninguna de estas misiones plantea una gran profundidad, siendo la mayoría de ellas una recogida de coleccionables. Esto se compensa con la adición de un sistema de mejora de habilidades por niveles que aporta algo de variedad y complejidad a la jugabilidad. Crear escudos cinéticos, paralizar el tiempo o hackear a los enemigos son sólo algunos de los ejemplos de lo que nuestro protagonista podrá llevar a cabo.

La estética es, sin lugar a duda, uno de los puntos más acertados de la propuesta. Sobre el papel la ambientación ciberpunk no es algo especialmente original dada la reciente popularidad de esta temática en la actualidad. Pero su uso del color, el brillo de sus neones, la decadencia de sus entornos y el ambiente retro-futurista que presenta logra impregnar a la obra de un carácter propio, al mismo tiempo que evoca imágenes de Blade Runner o de las cintas de Winding Refn. Por otro lado, los diálogos con los personajes se ilustran mediante detallados dibujos de estilo cómic lo que aporta atractivo y frescura al conjunto.

En definitiva, el primer trabajo de Reikon Games podría no parecer una novedad. Al igual que la mayoría de producciones de Devolver Digital, se siente muy cómodo al recuperar un estilo de juego pasado. También es cierto que su dificultad es algo frustrante en ocasiones. Pero la verdad es que funciona de maravilla. Ruiner es un título adictivo, alocado, exigente y, sobre todo, divertido. Los amantes de la acción más visceral están de enhorabuena, ya que encontrarán en él una perfecta excusa para aporrear los botones de sus controladores favoritos. Lo recomiendo fervientemente, aunque, quién sabe, puede que alguien me haya hackeado el cerebro.

35689535.review:
[h1]GET THIS GAME, PUPPY![/h1]

TL;DR: Great gameplay with some very challenging enemies and bosses. Lacks a bit in terms of variety, especially the leveldesign. Don't expect a great story.

[spoiler]The gameplay, which is the main selling point thb, is [b]great[/b]. There are all kinds of abilities to make yourself feel like a real god damn badass, slaying hordes of brutal and fast enemies: Slowing time, different shields, boosting your weapons or your character. But don't think it'll be easy because of that. You'll have all means to win every level, but you really have to use all your skills and think about how to approach every enemy and every boss. All skill can be changed mid game and even mid fight, which will be necessary. 
And there's a very rewarding feeling when you just outsmarted a boss or just brutally murdered a bunch of a**holes.

Now for the rather disappointing things: (Most) Bosses can be stunlocked with the flash grenade and just slaughtered with the sword (even after they made it cost 50% more in the first patch), which shouldn't be possible in my opinion. Just make bosses immune.
This is where my next point of critique is: The bosses. They often repeat and some ofthem are just bullet sponges with guns and one or two abilities, often improved NPC abilites. Bosses could use some more interesting mechanics in my opinion, to make every boss interesting and thus rewarding to beat.
Onto the next point: the story hints at a few very interesting things and never explores them any further, then out of nowhere the plot twist at the end just smacks you across the face. It was never even hinted at. (Not gonna spoil the end here) But it's completely out of nothing.

I still recommend this game for the gameplay and the low price.[/spoiler]

For a very in depth review (in german) of a friend of mine, click the link:
http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198005261101/recommended/464060/

Have nice day and enjoy mowing down techno-dogs with a lead-pipe.

-Psydator

35656073.review:
From the outset, whether you're going to like RUINER or not looks like a simple choice: do you like twin-stick brawler-shooters that require a bit of skill, and just a little bit of luck?

It's not that simple, though. You can fall in love with the idea of a thing, but the execution may turn you off of it. I love RUINER's idea: cyberpunk misanthropy, the game. All of that's here, in a package that's part-mysterious, all-gorgeous. The execution, though? Well, you can already see I've recommended the game. So here's the thing: it's good. But is it great? Well... it's not a game that's invested in showing you how to be better at it like, say, Dark Souls. You experiment with what you've got, or you die a lot. Well, that's not quite right -- you're still going to die a lot. But the game's never punishing for the sake of it. It's important to remember you can respec your abilities at will, because without that, you're never going to get far. Some of the bosses remain a bit cheap, though they've toned that down a bit (hiya, Mother), but it's also a thrill to just get 'em done in one when you figure out what to do.

Part of that frustration is why this isn't a clear-cut recommended. Do you enjoy ramming yourself against a wall until you figure out which parts of it chip and crack, then keep going at it until the whole thing comes down? Well, then play RUINER on Hard. Else do yourself a favour and play it on normal. Also: don't go in expecting much of a story here, because that's not where this game's priorities are. 

Its priorities remain being a violent, explosive little thing that focuses on tactile combat and chilly cyberpunk aesthetics, and it does those pretty well. Yes, the levels are repetitive, and some of the encounters are too, but it's all painted with a dazzling neon brush, the artists' favourite colour being a bright, lurid red. The animation and controls are silky smooth, somehow responsive yet managing a weighty heft at the same time that makes for an immediately addictive 'let's have just one more go' feel to it. 

Plus, it's got an absolutely banging soundtrack. Sure, there's the legendary Susumu Hirasawa track for its Chiba City-ish hub that everyone talks about, but don't let the grinding pound of Zamilska and Memotone's pieces slip by you. It's all well-gauged and an excellent accompaniment to the bloodbaths on-screen.

In summary: if you're looking for a game with a fantastic sense of style and engaging, if slightly flawed, design and combat, you could do much worse than RUINER.

35654327.review:
О да...очередной хардкорный топ-даун шутер...

[h1]Графика:[/h1]

Для игры такого жанра шикарна...Довольно детальная прорисовка, смачные и сочные эффекты пламени, электричества и т.д....а уж какой начинается хаос красок, когда на экране ты сражаешься с толпой киборгов, летящие заряды плазмы и пули, взрывы гранат и всколохи энергетических щитов. Графическая составляющая уровней тоже великолепна.

[h1]Звук:[/h1]

Было бы странно, если бы отставал от общего качества игры...тут Вам разнообразные темы, идеально вписывающиеся в ритм происходящей резни, создающие мрачное чувство дистопичной клаустрофобии и корпоративных войн. Звуковые эффекты на должном уровне.

[h1]Геймплей:[/h1]

Хорошо сделанный топ-даун шутер с высокой сложностью...Суть проста - берем пушку побольше, качаем подходящие под свой стиль игры скиллы и выносим все живое на уровнях-корридорах. 

Разнообразием стволов игра не обделена...тут Вам и стандартные пистолеты, пулеметы, дробовики и т.д....есть и нечто более экзотическое, вроде звукового дробовика, теслы и т.д..до кучи добавляем набор оружия ближнего боя в виде мечей, молотов и прочих колюще/режуще/дробящих игрушек.

Помимо этого, ГГ обладает скиллами...здесь Вам щиты, дэши, гранаты, дроны, хилки...не заскучаешь. Создать билд под свой стиль игры легче легкого. 

В любом случае, все это создано для уничтожения огромного количества живой силы и защиты своей жалкой жизни...враги жалеть Вас не намерены, поэтому советую сразу приготовиться к частым смертям.

Но это лишь часть...второй кусочек лежит в местных "улочках", где в маленьком мирном квартале...где можно побродить и поговорить с народом, где почти голая "кибер-монашка" просит Вас почаще умирать...где девочка в кошачьем костюме просит взламывать дворовых котов, которые на самом деле машины корпоративного шпионажа...где старуха с кибер-мозгом готова за несколько монеток сделать предсказание...Благодаря общему стилю игры, такое действо не кажется какой-то пыткой, а дает неплохую передышку между резнями и еще больше погружает в такой красивый, но дистопичный мир RUINER'a.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]

Прекрасный хардкорный топ-даун шутер с отлично созданной атмосферой дистопичного киберпанка. Здесь есть буквально все - стильно подающийся сюжет (хоть и с единственной целью), отличный набор оружия, прокачка персонажа и мощный ОСТ.
9 из 10. Любите челендж? Вам сюда!!!

35646196.review:
RUINER has to be my favourite game of 2017 so far. Though it isn't perfect, nor is it extremely innovative; it is an extremely enjoyable game that far. RUINER is a perfect example of "A whole that outweighs the some of its parts". 

Pros:
-The gameplay. The mix of twin-stick shooter and beat'em up is one that works extremely well. While not every weapon or character ability feels powerful on its own, the ability to mix and match on the fly allows for some really interesting combinations. Because of this, there is a lot of oppurtunity for replayability.
-The visuals. The cyberpunk artstyle is one that we don't often see done well in games, but RUINER captures it perfectly. It brought back feelings of Blade Runner with a coat of red neon paint.
-The soundtrack. Ranging from booming EDM to eerie synth to emotional choir vocals. Every track is great in its own way, and really sets the tone for the game world.
-The plot. While a lot of people complain that the story is very linear and the ending being a bit anti-climactic. I find that RUINERs plot works great in context to the game. Because the story is very simple and easy to follow, with only a few twists and reveals, it allows for more world building. Thankfully the devs included a Codex to the game, allowing you to stop at any time and read up on the expansive amount of lore the game world has. Even though the hub world felt small and had limited interaction, there was a lot to look at and learn about, resulting in a very believable game world, and overall a more immersive experience for me.

Cons:
-Playtime. The story is pretty short, I completed it in about 7 hours, including exploration of every level and completing the CATS sidequest in the hub world. This wouldn't be as much of a problem for me if there were a New Game+, but sadly as of right now there isn't one included. (REIKON PLEASE!!!)
-Sound Design. This is a weird one for me, since everything sounds amazing, from the ambient noise of each stage, to the explosive sounds of the firearms. But single most important thing I need to hear in an action game is feedback, which this game lacks almost entirely. Feedback is the effect you hear when your attacks connect with an enemy (ex: hitmarker sounds in fps games) and when an enemy attack connects with you (ex: player character grunts/louder impact sounds). RUINER lacks these effects, which can result in some extremely frustrating fights. In the heat of the moment, especially on later stages, you don't have time to constantly check your health bar to see if you're getting hit. This desperately needs to be added.

OVERALL: 8/10

35644665.review:
Быстро, брутально, в красных тонах, под хорошую музыку.
Представитель киберпанка на ураганных скоростях.
Но насколько все хорошо внутри?
Поехали:

(+/-) Сюжет: он нормальный, но не более. Ничего неожиданного, ничего унылого. Неплохо, но довольно стандартно для жанра. Вас ничего не удивит, но и в разочаровании не оставит.
Кроме того я не понял, влияют ли на концовку выборы действий в диалогах (просто к сведению).
(-) Сайд квесты: они тут есть, аж целых два. Один про поиск монет на уровнях и получение предсказаний, которые бесполезны, до них вы можете додуматься и сами. Второй про взлом котов, которые на самом деле являются шпионскими девайсами. Результат квеста опять же не понятно что дает. Возможно где-то затаилось влияние на концовку, но я в этом искренне сомневаюсь.
(+) Дизайн: он, вообще-то, ничем не удивляет. Уровни нарисованы коридорно и однотипно, хотя красные тона освещения, сопровождающие вас через всю игру, здорово подкрепляются фоновыми треками и создают приятную картинку на экране.
(+) Треки: качают. Тяжелый, мутный, диссонансный, ритмичный звук. Одно из сильных мест игры. То, что нужно, для аннигиляции всего на своем пути.
(-) Боссы: их вроде бы для недлинной игры в достатке, только они мало чем отличаются друг от друга и убиваются фактически по одной тактике. Поумирать заставят, интереса не принесут.
(+/-) Боевка: дерево прокачки скучное, список умений вообще стандартен для жанра - такого же типа скилы есть в том же Deus Ex.
Говоря о самой боевке тут неоднозначность. Она действительно быстрая, она действительно сложная. Хп вы будете терять быстро, умирать вы будете снова и снова, пока не почуствуете ритм скоростной бойни. К сожалению все портится простейшими в реализации имба-комбо вроде бесконечных dash'ей вокруг врагов и пинания их мили оружием. Потрясающе делает врагов беспомощными рывок с предварительно вкачанным станом щитом при ударе. Вы просто врезаетесь в них включив щит и убиваете пока они в стане. На боссах можно эксплойтить бесконечно. Скачете туда-сюда пиная их щитом и они не выходят из состояния куклы для битья. То же самое - бросок флеша и убийство врагов раньше, чем они очнутся. Особенно здорово с абилкой, провоцирующей дроп ХП с каждого врага, когда вы в предсмертном состоянии.

Рекомендую ли я RUINER? Да! Игра дает то, чего вы от нее ждете. Бодрый геймплей на пару вечеров за справедливую цену, а в остатке хорошую музыку.
За 9 часов на максимальной сложности.

7/10.

35639606.review:
RUINER is a great little game! Outstanding style and atmosphere. It's a fast paced, twin stick shooter set in a dystopian future. It's got a little bit of bullet-hell and RPG elements. I enjoyed the character ability building and weapon variety. The fantastic soundtrack deserves praise. It really drives the game forward during levels and is reflective in the breaks between action. 

I wish it was a little bit longer and there was more world to explore. It took me about 4 hours to complete and I'm currently replaying it on hard difficulty. I would recommend this game to anyone that's a fan of the genre (Hotline Miami) or a fan of the cyberpunk style (Blade Runner, Ghost in the Shell).

35639043.review:
冲着赛博朋克风和Devolver Digital（[spoiler]没错我是迈阿密热线受害玩家[/spoiler]）买的，说实话对简单难度玩家如我不是特别友好，因为简单难度下凸显了总时长太短的问题（[spoiler]然而我还是用了6小时，微笑[/spoiler]）。认真地说，即使有变相增长总流程的普通难度，68这个价格还是偏贵了，建议打折购入。
    当然，游戏的优点多多，画风等等，尤其想要一提的是音乐，[u]岭谷南区的BGM似乎蕴藏着这个超载时代无处可归之人灵魂的低语[/u]([spoiler]鬼知道我在说个啥[/spoiler])。
    最后最后，我重点想说的还是这个科幻风格。很有意思啊，果然还是有些彩蛋的。
    1.游戏里的匪帮叫丧心暴徒，他们全是由新时代人口政策所不允许的第三胎组成的，也许有人和我一样想到了一部科幻神作[b]斯科特.卡德的《安德的游戏》(Ender's Game)[/b]，同样的控制了人口，生第二胎就是奢侈行为，主角安德有一个哥哥和一个姐姐，都落选于政府对于未来战争领袖的选拔，但由于他们显示出超凡的天赋，政府秘密许可安德的父母生下安德，安德也因为这个身份而在学院中遭受过歧视。这本书（或者说系列）很好，科幻迷不要错过。
    2.一开始的战五渣（对，在简单难度下的我轻松地说）天堂警卫，画风很明显脱胎于攻壳机动队（不只是电影，至少在TV版中已经可以看出原型），这个就不详述了，[b]攻壳机动队近似圣经一般的存在[/b]（不是说真人电影啊，尴尬）。
    3.游戏中的升级是靠打怪、过关、用武器压缩机榨出以及直接踹箱子得到的“业力”。有没有人想过为什么这个未来世界的类似法定货币一样的东西会取这么一个具有宗教色彩的名字呢？至少我个人怀疑这个业力取材于[b]罗杰.泽拉兹尼的《光明王》[/b]。《光明王》中的星际探险家在新星球开辟了新的世代，新人类几乎都来自第一代的基因重组体，并且老世代不断更换自己的身体以达永生。但部分开拓者利用克隆和意识传输等技术武装起了自己的独裁野心，并选取了印度教作为意识形态外壳。老世代都成了高高在上的神，贱民都需要花钱在祈祷机上祈祷以赚取业报，好保佑下一代转生仍然为人（是真的转生！利用意识传输，梵天和湿婆们可以惩罚业力很低的人，将他们的意识输入动物甚至昆虫之中），而业报越高，可以转生的身体就越强健。[spoiler]想一想似乎比真实的印度教还真呢（笑）[/spoiler]。这本书我也强烈推荐，就三个字：史诗感。

Lumière néons, quartiers crasseux de Rengkok type néo-Tokyo, conspirations, multinationales malveillantes et conspirationnistes, hackers ... On à droit à toutes la panoplie , tout droit sortie des classiques du genre comme Neuromancien ou Bladerunner.

La panoplie d'arme est démente, on en découvre à chaque niveau, avec des effets tels que : Rayon découpeur, sabres japonais, massue explosive, boule congélante, laser, mitrailleuse, etc, etc , etc. 
Les compétences du héros sont variées et permettent plusieurs style de jeux. Si vous aimez le CaC, vous pourrez vous spécialiser avec des sort de Dashes, boucliers, jusqu'à devenir un vrai Raiden. Il est également possible de hacker ses ennemies, ou de balancer des bombes paralysantes /explosives, etc etc. Un seul Walkthrough ne permet pas d'explorer toutes les branches, ce qui devrait permettres de refaire le jeu une fois au minimum sans s'ennuyer.

Les combats sont extrêmement nerveux, et demandent un certain temps d'adaptation. La difficultée est élevée pendant toute l'aventure. Ceci dit, les temps de chargement sont inexistants, le jeu est très bien optimisé, vous pourrez recommencer une bataille littéralement une seconde après votre mort. Utile quand on doit parfois reessayer jusqu'à cinq, dix, voir seize fois certains combats épineux. Le héro monte en puissance, et devient extrêmement mobile/ beaucoups plus résistant, ce qui rend paradoxalement la fin du jeu plus facile que le début. 

Graphiquement c'est beau, très stylizé et assez clean dans les modélisation/textures. Les personnages ont un côté caricaturale lors de certains gros plans qui marche plutôt bien avec l'ambiance du titre (assez outré). Des dessins et des messages radios, parfois rajoutés façon presque image subliminale, ajoutent un côté un peu névrosé qui va tout à fait avec le synospis.

J'ai adoré le gameplay, l'aventure en générale. Je regrette seulement que le jeu ne dure pas plus de huit heure, et que la fin de l'histoire soit légèrement abrupte, laissant certaines zones d'ombres dans le scénario. Peut être pour laisser la place à un Ruiner2. Certaines scènes font un peu cheap à cause du manque de doublage vocale , mais étant habitué à lire des textes, cela ne m'a pas dérangé. Par contre, un soin tout particulier à été apporté aux décors. Le quartier de Rengkok sud, par exemple, fourmille de vie, de détails et de PNJ en actions. Les Fx sont très sympas, la fluidité sans faille.

Je recommanderais le jeu à toute personne aimant la science fiction, notemment le cyberpunk, et les jeux d'action en générale. Ruiner à été pour moi une très bonne surprise.

35622780.review:
While enticing trailers shows a fast paced game with brutal combat, makes the game look awesome. It is broken, simply by the game not being able to keep up with the combat.
My Biggest gripe with the game is that enemies deal damage before their animation starts, this means that you will take damage from things you cant event possibly react to. This means you have to pussy around instead of taking the fight to the enemies. Along with this the controls are quite horrible. Now i played the game relying heavily on the slowdown dash + slash combo, with the dash causing the enemies to get staggered while i could land a hit or 2 before having to dash again.
Having to hold right click (simply clicking make you normal dash), then left click, then left click again as soon as you release right click to then again hold right click and then repeat. This is works well... untill it dosent. Heres is why. First off sometimes the game slows down to let you know you hit the enemy so that you stagger them, except sometimes the enemies arent staggered. This means you take a face full of damage without being able to respond well to it since you are in the state of wanting to deal dmg since they should be staggered.
Othertimes when you left click to put down a dash point and release right click, you dont dash and is then killed, not fun.
Another problem is when placing down a dash point, if you cannot dash to that exact location, no marker will be placed not even one, close to where you are aimning, this again means that you just stand there like a retard taking a shotgun to the face. This could easily be solved by either having the dash point close to where you were aiming or by having the game make it clear, like with a loud sound n stuff that you did NOT place a dash point, so you dont exit bullet time before being able to react and redo the dash marker.
This wouldent be all too bad since you can keep trying to play more and more carefully, constantly overdoing everything so that you dont get fucked by the game. Except a lot of the difficulty comes from arenas where you are just figthing the same enemies over and over again, making more and more likely that you get killed due to the game fucking you over before the encounter ends.

This means that i either get S/S+ after a fight or get c-a if the fight goes on for too long.

The mini-bosses are also super easy and no different from normal enemies except larger health pools and a flashy intro.

The other bosses are rather lame since you are forced to use abilities and weapons that you dont normally use (cause they are boring). And then when you have beaten the boss you have to manually switch back all the skills since there isent even a skill "loadout" that you can return to. (Looking at you Mother (>_>)  )

for the record i played on normal difficulty and wouldent even wanna try hard, since it would just be even more one shots due to the game completely failing to follow the flow of combat.

35620529.review:
[h1]The Good[/h1]
[list]
[*]Pulsating, blistering soundtrack - especially if you happen to be into darker techno/industrial electronic music. Was an instant OST buy for me.
[*]Furious paced and satisfying combat. Melee feels especially meaty along with a couple of the closer range weapons like the shotgun.
[*]Gorgeous oversaturated cyberpunk dystopian world.
[*]Difficulty curve scales up well with options for easier playthroughs as an accessibility option. Developer recommended level of hard feels like the right choice here if you are up to it.
[/list]

[h1]The Bad[/h1]
[list]
[*]Story is simplistic to a fault. [spoiler]KILL BOSS, FIND BROTHER[/spoiler] is basically the entire story TLDR.
[*]Aside from the campaign there is little else to do with this game. A horde-mode arena survival type mode would be a welcome addition to this in post-launch patches.
[*]The controls of the isometric camera angle combined with the fact the character does not instantly turn may be a bit of a challenge for some people to adapt to early on. Can take a few minutes to get the feel of.
[/list]

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
For those who don't mind a thin story as long as you have visceral, frantic combat action combined with a wonderfully crafted cyberpunk world and fantastic music - this one is a buy.

35620296.review:
Yet another outstanding game published by [i]Devolver Digital[/i]. I've been following it for a while, was very excited for it and I now after beating it I was not disappointed. For quite a while Ive not seen a game in which all of its aspects come together so well.[list]
 [*][b]Gameplay[/b] wise its somewhat reminiscent of Hotline Miami (topdown view, brutal combat with stress on positioning and somewhat hard difficulty). But here where the similarities end: In HM you are put in different conditions and environments, in RUINER you move from one arena to another fighting waves of enemies. As you progress enemies become stronger, faster and get more abilities, but so do you. There are skills to chose from all of them are viable options. You get skill points to upgrade the character; not only that, you can [u]relocate[/u] points from one skill to another to fit the situation at hand. 
[*][b]The Design[/b] in this game is just crazy. I cant speak of music, graphics or lvl design separately. Whole game you'll be fighting trough same-ish industrial areas, factorylines and etc. but you wont notice till the end of the game. The music, the lighting and the animation totaly transform the way you perceive the level. And lets not forget those character sprites used in dialogs.
[*][b]The Story[/b] fits games atmosphere. Its dark, gloomy and full of mysteries. You get an ingame encyclopedia that describes the world and if you read it as you progress, in the end all information just clicks together like a jigsaw puzzle and you can see the whole picture.  Really amazing. [spoiler]Though its a bit predictable.[/spoiler][/list]
 Its a very good game for the price asked. This game where everything works together perfectly, each of its aspects compliment each other. Its somewhat short, but it ends just at right time [spoiler](as you start getting bored with it).[/spoiler] Some people found it [b]hard[/b], but its not THAT hard. My advice if you get [i]stuck[/i] [u]analyze the enemy and adapt - relocate skill points to fit the situation.[/u] 
[spoiler]P.S. There is also OST and its amazing, totally recommend buying it too.[/spoiler]

35615333.review:
So what is Ruiner?

As a game designer myself I hope I can give a fair critique of the game:

Pros:
- Impressive visuals. The game looks and feels very polished in its aesthetics ranging from animations, to sound, VFX, gameplay related effects like slow motion and everything in between (especially considering the low price)
- Fast paced top down shooter at its finest
- Large variety of weapons
- Most abilities well integrated with dynamic skill tree. You can change your skill setup at every given moment allowing for quick changes

Cons:
- Mostly reflex-based gameplay
- Rather limited strategical approach (enemies are hardly predictable / very random)
- Difficulty pacing occasionally debatable

In-Depth Analysis:
I am a fairly hardcore player and like most games I started Ruiner on Hard. However, the first boss encounter (10-15 minutes into the game) was already way too hard for me so I picked the medium difficulty. 

In Ruiner you die very quickly. The game is extremely fast paced. Lots of things are going on at the same time so most of the time you will die a couple times out of sheer chance before proceeding to the next area.

While it doesn't take much to kill enemies, staying alive will depend on the players ability to evade enemy bullets using shields, dashes and other tools and once you get the hang of it the game feels extremely satisfying.
Standing on the other side of the battlefield without a scratch having killed a hand full of enemies within a few seconds is super badass, however later on in the game I feel like this "nobody can touch me" feeling slowly fades.

Enemies will flank you using teleports like you do and sometimes even appear right next to you (perhaps with a shotgun). 
Enemies also tend to use more machine guns which spray a lot. Take that and the fact that enemies teleport all over the place, it gets quite chaotic. 
I can't go into a lot of detail, but it feels like the strategical approach falls apart at some point. You mostly spray and pray while trying to react as fast as you possibly can in order to dodge any unexpected surprises. Now, chances are if you die over and over again because you simply can't react that fast the game can be very frustrating. 
I think lowering the overall action on the screen, spamming less enemies and perhaps leaving more room for strategical approaches would highly benefit the game in my opinion. (For example putting a higher cooldown on the dash abilitiy).

In the end though, Ruiner does what it tries to do very magnificently and it's been a long time since I went full try-hard mode on a game like this.

If you are a fan of 'fast-paced topdown shooter action' and don't mind dying a lot, this is a must buy when it goes on sale.

Final verdict: Pretty damn good

Great game! I'm not at games that are meant to be a grind (i.e., Dark Soul type), and Ruiner is a bit of that. However, there is one thing that made me enjoy this game really a lot: you gain skill points and unlock new abilities, etc. and you certainly need to use them, HOWEVER you can roll back any time and disable an ability to unluck other ones. This adds an interesting twist: depending on your enemy, there are some abilities that even at max cant do much for you encountering them, but others can be really effective; so you can try again and again with different abilities and see what works for you.

Other things are also well-done: graphics, environment and the cyberpunk universe. Story is not extra-ordinary, but not too bad either.

I have yet to try the other difficulties, but the recommended "Hard mode" is just totally out of wack. The difficulty curve is steeper than the Grand Canyon, and this boss fight I'm stuck on is just poorly designed.
So I have this temporary melee weapon that lets me use a charged attack that makes me rotate around my axis, dealing lots of hits with good damage. This is useless unless I stun the enemy tho, because if he blocks the first hit all consecutive hits deal no damage. He doesn't have to block them anymore, so he's free to attack me. Wouldn't be much of a hassle if the boss couldn't kill you in 3 or so hits. Even if you ignore this weapon's mechanic, the boss itself is just lazy. If you deal enough damage to end the phase, you will still waste charges of your temp weapons on him because it takes him a while to get out. He is invincible during this. Once he's out, molotov cocktails rain from the sky. WIth the perspective in this game it's nearly impossible to see where they'll land, so I just hit the dodge button in random directions when I see an exclamation mark appear. This is nothing but hoping RNG won't fuck you over. Maybe I'm missing something. Anyway, I think this game could have probably used a lot more time to polish. Maybe I'll try the non-recommended difficulties some other time, but I feel like it will bore me outside of this bad bossfight, considering it wasn't challenging before.

35560952.review: Ruiner is an incredibly hard, fast paced, top down, fuck em up, kind of game. Amazing sound track, amazing art and visuals, with enough story to keep you invested in the outcome. It reminded me why I like the cyberpunk genre, where games like Deus Ex failed to interest me (at least after the first one). While the game play is different, just the setting and characters add so much more without you just being a cop with a gun. After all the reason the word punk is in cyberpunk is to emphasize that we're playing in a world where Corporations and Government are one in the same, and that you could just as easily be a "Third child," or cast out simply for not having enough "Karma"/currency to validate you as a person. Cyberpunk is about challenging the status quo with a metal pipe, and shaking the foundation, just to remind people you're still human. Ruiner certainly lets you do that, but how much of yourself you control is a whole different question.
