35410927.review:
From the start, it stuck out in aesthetics, flow, design, and sound. It all works together in an organic way. I set the difficulty to hard and I got a hard game, nothing I didn't sign up for. But I think it's more fun this way, I really have to learn the systems and mechanics and excell at them to be effective.
So many times I found spamming abilities made it harder for me to survive encounters, and that's great, it teaches you how to position yourself and you have to be clever about it at all times.
Even minor thugs can screw you up if you're not at the top of your game, which adds to the intensity and pacing of the game.

Really loving it so far, would highly recommend!

35410617.review:
[h1]Киберпанковое месиво.[/h1]

Ruiner - проект, который, очевидно, удался. Проект, который понравится люду. В данной игре приятная стилизация, радующий уши саундтрек(хоть и не авторский), потенциал и банальный, но не раздражающий этим, сюжет. Многие отмечают, что "любителям Hotline Miami игра понравится", но я рискну предположить, что нет. В RUINER есть драйв, скорость, но нет той хардкорности. Да, игра сложная, но не такая как HM, она [b]не хардкорная[/b]. В игре вся сложность(на данный момент) в недоработке NPC и неудобной стрельбе. 
По мне так, то в игре нужно было убрать полоску энергии, но сделать героя умирающим с первой тычки. Это было бы еще быстрее и добавляло хардкора[u](естественно, если урезать половину способностей)[/u]. Тогда можно было бы сравнивать с Великой и Ужасной Горячей Линией Майами.
Но это не делает проект плохим. В игре достаточно положительных моментов. Мне жутко нравятся рисунки в диалогах, стилистика и подача игры. Плюсов в игре больше, чем минусов(плюсы, по большей части перекрывают минусы). Пожалуй, перечислю.

[h1]Плюсы[/h1]
+Стилистика старого доброго киберпанка. Она чертовски хороша. Киберпанком вещь не испортишь.
+Качественно подобранный саундтрек. Жаль, конечно, что не авторский как в Горячей Линии, это придавало бы уровням и локациям индивидуальности. Но в любом случае слушать музыку здесь приятно.
+Драйв. Какой бы он ни был, но драйва в видеоиграх стало не хватать. Играть в игру с оружием ближнего боя приятно и возбуждающе. Уровни проходятся быстро и на одном дыхании.
+Город. Город в игре сделан красиво. В перерыве между уровнями, мы имеем относительно открытый мир. Но к сожалению, пустой. Вроде есть жители с диалогами, сайд квесты, но чувствуется, что это не реализовано до конца. Отнесу к плюсам, так как локации выглядят живыми, но исследовать нечего.

[h1]Минусы[/h1]
-Оптимизация. Что можно сказать про игру, когда она работает в 40фпс на ультравысоких, в то время, когда Ведьмак 3 на высоких работает стабильно с локом на 60фпс? Оптимизация в данной игре страдает знатно, но я пишу это спустя 2 днч после выхода игры, так что надежды на фикс вполне реалистичны.
-Туповатый ИИ. Раз уж мы сравниваем с HM, то не могу не упомянуть о туповатеньком ИИ, который вместо того чтоб обходить мусорную машину, за который ты прячешься, начинает стрелять по мусоровозу. И бьет палкой сквозь укрытия. Надеемся на фикс тоже.
-Неприятная стрельба. Стрелять в RUINER некомфортно(для меня точно, не знаю как для других) из-за угла обзора. Уголь обзора мал и, следовательно, невозможность тактически продумать свой ход.

[h1]Итог.[/h1]
Мы имеем неплохой beat-em-up в киберпанке. Но, к сожалению, недоведенный до ума. Надеюсь, что разработчики еще доведут свое детище до конца, у них есть время. Игра определенно неплохая, но может наскучить достаточно быстро. Не стоит приписывать игре хардкорность. Она просто сложная, не более. На хард моде чувствуешь себя расслаблено, не напряженно, так как постоянные чекпоинты спасут твой прогресс.
RUINER не станет вторым Hotline'ом, так как здесь нет такой вариативности уровней и стиля игры. Игру спасет Workshop, тогда она еще просуществует достаточно долго.
Мы имеем приятный киберпанковый экшен с видом сверху и хорошей стилизацией. Игра стоит своих денег и заслуживает внимания любителей инди игр и beat 'em up'ов.

[b]7 щеночков из 10[/b]

35410094.review:
Beautiful, brutal and fast-paced.

Very well done futuristic visuals - ranging from dark underground facilities to densely populated streets of 2091 Rengkok. Neon lights, dimly lit factories, it is a Cyberpunk dream come true, and the visuals are accompanied by top notch soundtrack - it's mostly synthwave, AND it fits just right. RUINER also features a character upgrade system that allows for a very personal playstyle, but still, in the end, everything in this game depends on your positioning. Enemies can and will give you a pretty hard time, and while fighting them might sometimes feel like fending off a zerg rush, the bosses make up for that and are even more challenging. 

Overall this game is unforgiving, memorable and REALLY scratches my Cyberpunk itch.

35408227.review:
Summary: nice game, worth the 20 bucks, but nothing special

At first i thought this game is really good, because of the atmosphere and the soundtrack and everything. Its nice.
I started with "Normal" as difficulty and soon (i think at first boss) i struggled so hard that i changed it to easy after about 70 attempts to kill this bastard. When switched to easy, i could finish him instantly with full hp and no challenge at all.
This is really the worst about this game: the difficulty is not balanced. Easy is much too easy, normal is unbeatable imho. Wouldnt even consider trying "hard"...

Controls sometimes really suck, i cant dash always - sometimes it doesnt work. sometimes you get stuck in corners you dont see. Also it is kinda always the same after some time, walking straight forward, fight creeps, fight boss, next level. Story is ok, but i had much better ones in other games and it was somehow too obvious. (the end)

One other thing to mention is that there are lots of characters in the city that reminds of an open world game, but in fact you dont need them or cant do anything with them. So why implement it then? its a straight-forward game so its not needed. Same with XP and skills. Could be solved easier for such a short game and not really necessary to give it those RPG characteristics. 

All in all it was a nice game, but somehow i felt happy when it was over - after only 3 or 4 hours of playing. As i said it got more of a "always doing the same thing" and it bored me somehow. 

I rate this positive, since i dont have the feeling i wasted my money. But it is definetely no game that will fascinate you completely or will keep you playing it for more than a few hours. But it has great atmosphere and arts - if you are into that.

35398682.review:
I wish I could give RUINER a neutral score, because the parts of it I enjoy are really good, but it's lacking in so many other aspects.

The aesthetic and delivery of the game are fantastic. The setting is interesting, the "glitchy" effect is really good and in general it just oozes style.

RUINER was definitely in need of a design pass, though. It has all the elements necessary to be great, but they needed to be re-arranged and reworked better.

First off, the mid-fight resource management is really damn demanding. Your health and energy are in one corner of the screen. Your ammo/durability are in the other and your dash charges are center-bottom. Keeping track of all of these in a frantic fight is ridiculous, especially because the simple red UI blends with everything else in the game. There definitely should have been a better layout and clearer audio/visual cues so you know when you're hurting for something.

Skills have a lot of unnecessary fluff and you'll quickly learn what the best combo is. There are VERY FEW points where the game expects you to have a specific skill equipped, but other than that, you'll probably stick to shield + stun grenade + dash upgrades. It's along the lines of "Why would I have a wall I can place, when I can just have an insta-shield that negates damage regardless where I am". Or "why would I have a frag grenade that deals damage when I can just disable any number of enemies". 

This carries over to the weapons as well. Melee is always better, unless you are fighting a very specific boss and then you might want to switch to your ranged weapon. Melee stunlocks and deals more damage than almost any firearm in the game, especially in the first few hours.

It also feels like the devs knew this? For example, melee interrupts enemies for the majority of the game, but then you get an enemy category that all of a sudden isn't interrupted by melee. That's fine, you can stun grenade them. Well, now we have a "flaming" enemy type that is immune to the stun grenade specifically. OK, that's fine, you can still ram them with your shield to stun them? It's a weird progression, but the strategy stays the same: disable, damage, disable, damage, avoid until you have enough energy again, repeat. This is enough to get you S+ rank on almost all fights.

There are other weird things, like energy costs being relayed to you as numerical costs, but your UI is actual icons? I assume each of the icons is 10 energy/health, but I never know whether I have enough or not to do my thing, so, combined with it being hard to track your health/energy, I just never bother thinking about it.

The enemy encounters could have been better laid out. Again, all the elements are there, but the waves are uninteresting. You'll have two melee dudes and two gun dudes. OK, that's fine. Now you'll have a wave that's just suicide bombers. Now a wave that's just mines. Now a wave that's a draining device and one big dude. Why not throw in mines/suicide bombers in the mid of more varied waves? Then you can use them as tools against other enemies. There's very little target prioritization going on, because the actual battles aren't mixed up enough.

Probably the two most frustrating moments for me were a boss battle with three health bars for no real reason (and you can just stun-lock him anyway) and that a very late fight has infinite spawns that the game literally teaches you up until then how to disable completely, and then the fight starts and it's like "nope, they're immune now, sorry".

So, yeah, the game is very stylish, I don't regret buying it, but I think it needed one big design and balancing pass to actually capitalize on all its other strong points.

For reference, I beat the game on Hard difficulty, since it was the "recommended" one.

35393386.review:
[h1] Ruiner en Steam [/h1]

[b]Ruiner[/b] es el título debut de [b]Reikon[/b], el estudio independiente polaco. Junto a la editora [b]Devolver Digital[/b], nos traen un juego híbrido entre RPG y Shooter, ambientado en un futuro distopico cyberpunk, donde la tecnología es una parte inseparable de la vida de las personas.

El juego nos pone en la piel de un tipo al que le hackean la cabeza para que cumpla una misión, salvar a su hermano que fue secuestrado. Desde el minuto cero ya nos introduce en este mundo con chaquetas de cuero, luces de neon, humanos modificados tecnologicamente y esta atmosfera de dececpión que rodea al futuro donde las maquinas ganan la guerra, muy Terminator.

La ciudad de Rengkok servirá como el centro donde iremos obteniendo misiones. Estas son bastante lineales, tanto que pueden verse como niveles. Hablamos con un NPC, nos pide X cosa, entramos al lugar, destripamos a los enemigos, recuperamos la gilada que buscaba y volvemos por nuestra recompensa. 

Con una katana y un arma de fuego, vamos a matar a gusto a todo lo que se nos cruce por el camino. Nuestro personaje tiene muchas habilidades que puede utilizar para matar en combo, al estilo Hotline Miami, y ganar mayor puntuación. A medida que vayamos obteniendo Karma para subir de nivel, podremos desbloquear habilidades para ir construyendo un arbol que hace más rico el combate y más divertido el juego.

[b]Para leer el review completo[/b]

35387141.review:
[누구인가? 누가 분위기'만' 좋은 겜이라고 했는가?]

엔딩까지 본 유저로써, 개인적으로는 분위기'도' 좋은 게임이었습니다.
핫라인 마이애미에 다크소울을 짬뽕시켜놓은 것만 같은 난이도, 적절한 특수능력에 타임불릿 연출을 가미한 괜찮은 액션, 매력적인 배경에 등장인물들까지. 갓ㅡ겜입니다.

적잖은 유저들이 아쉬운 스토리 끝맺음을 단점으로 드는데, 확실히 분량이 짧은 감이 있고 막판에 진실이 밝혀질때 너무 훅 전개하는듯한 감이 없지않아 있긴 합니다만...  그래도 차근차근 이해해보면 조금 진부하지만, 그렇다고해서 크게 나쁘지도 않은 스토리였습니다. (개인적인 관점)

이게 진엔딩이 따로 있는 건지는 모르겠지만, 왠지 결말을 보면 진엔딩 충족 조건이 따로 있는 것 같기도.. 2회차 하면서 찾아봐야지.. 하하! (아니면 2편 암시거나...)

아무튼 갓겜이긴 합니다만, 아쉬운 부분들도 존재합니다.

*상술했듯이 아쉬운 분량.
*인터페이스가 살짝 불편하다는 점.
*이렇다 할 서브미션의 부재. (CATS임무나 동전 임무, 현상금 사냥 제외하면 진짜 전무하다고 봐도 무방합니다. 그마저도 현상금은 그냥 스토리 라인 따라가면서 깨는거.)
*사이버펑크를 기반으로 잘 구상된 도시와 등장인물들이지만, 상호작용은 극히 제한적이라는 점.
*이런 류의 게임이 익숙하지 않은 유저들에겐 앙빅 5성급으로 느껴지는 난이도.

정리하자면 대충 이쯤 되겠네요.

그렇지만! 피지컬과 근성만 충만하다면 이 점들을 모두 감수하고도 재밌게 즐길 수 있는 게임이라는거!

사이버펑크 세계관을 좋아하고, 사람을 극한으로 몰아붙이는 피지컬겜을 즐기신다면 아주 재밌게 즐기실 수 있을겁니다.



...아, 사실 다 필요없습니다. [그녀]가 매우엄청아주 매력적이니까 일단 사세요.
어느새 그녀를 보기위해 피지컬을 최대치로 끌어올리며 게임을 진행하는 자신을 볼 수 있을겁니다...

35385323.review:
[h1]УРАГАННЫЙ КИБЕРПАНК[/h1]

[i]Дикий годный яростный стильный пострелун с видом сверху, с адреналином, с персонажами, с пушками, с мечами, с мостом от грузовика в качестве дубины (получи в челюсть, ублюдoк!), с лучшей маской какую я когда-либо видел и восхитительным саундтреком.[/i]

RUINER привлёк меня крaсивыми скринами, музыкой и колоритным главгероем. Покупая игру, не рассчитывал пройти её полностью ибо [strike]стар и дряхл для этого дeрьма[/strike] не очень дружу с такого рода экшенами. Но вот прошло чуть более семи часов - и лёгкая сложность пройдена. Пройдена с потными ладошками, двадцатью+ смертями на особо хитрых боссах и перерывами на "ну его нафиг, отдохну". Пора рекомендовать игру.

[b]- Наш герой[/b] - молчаливый перец в говорящей маске, лихо ломает головы и отрывает ягодицы всему что встречается на пути. Прокачка есть, умения интересные, добавляют элемент тактики той вакханалии, что творится на экране.
[b]- Враги.[/b] В меру разнообразные, в основном делятся на рукопашных и любителей пострелять, плюс комбинации первых и вторых.
[b]- Музыка.[/b] Выше всяких похвал. Серьёзно. Постоянно ловил себя на мысли, что хочу прибавить громкости ещё чуть-чуть. И ещё. И ещё чуть.
[b]- Сеттинг и сюжет.[/b] Киберпанковщина, будущее, корпорации, людей на органы, людей на топливо для виртуальной сети, разруха и нищебродство на нижних уровнях города, сопротивление, банды, якудза, кибернетические охранники, вот это всё. Плюс забавные персонажи, наличие какого-никакого сюжета (у нас экшон, не рпг, так что норм). Ну тут уж либо вы любите киберпанк и будете довольны, либо не любите (но всё равно можете остаться довольны).

35381352.review:
打开游戏2小时了，还没正式开始玩，原因是，上网到处找在没有按键选项的游戏中怎么才能修改游戏按键，找了2小时，一无所获，我想问一下开发者，你们自己的游戏习惯就能代表所有人的习惯吗？加个按键设置应该不会很困难吧？在这里，我要提醒和我一样喜欢修改按键的玩家慎入。
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
用了第三方修改按键的软件，叫键鼠助手，可以勉强改到适合自己的操作方式，客观来说，游戏不错，画面很好，技能很多，打击感不错。

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
玩了几个小时来说一下感受，客观来说，这是一款不错的游戏，可玩性挺高，当然，除了不能自定义操作外。游戏难度不算低，主要体现在boss战中，有些boss战中找不到掩体，将会是一件非常痛苦的事，死亡也就成了常死，一场boss战下来，死个十几次并不算多，有时想摔鼠标，好在有一个时间减缓技能，可以让战胜boss成为可能。。。当然，我虽不是高手，但也不是手残党，后面遇到一个boss实在打不过，只得忍辱将游戏难度调成简单，你要知道，我从未在任何游戏中尝试运用简单模式去过关。。。但是，游戏可玩性不低，所以，死多少次你总会抱有重试最后一次的希望。

Above all, it is a grim cyberpunk game. I has a rather wild difficulty curve and if you have the right build, even the 'hard difficulty" becomes easier. For me, the hardest part of the game was the creeper's parking garage because I didn't have all the cool tools at my disposal. 

The game plays well, everything feels satisfying. Melee is great, shooting takes a little to get used to. Once you learn how to lead and get used to the pace, the game's combat shines.

I have encountered only one bug over my 2 playthoughs 9second one is ongoing atm).

Overall, get it if you're looking for a fun time for a few evenings.

Oh, abd characters in this are just... awesome. Good job on them, Reikon.

35368130.review:
I haven't completed the game yet and I'm about to beat MOTHER and I will say this-This game is absolutely fantastic!
We all know about the OST so we don't need to talk about that right?It has Susumu Hirasawa in it!
So, let's talk about the game itself and how well it performs and stands up to its inspiration, Hotline Miami?
Firstly, let me tell you this-the people who are talking badly about the game are only doing so because they officially suck at the game and not because the game is unfair by any means.
See, maybe they are attacking all the bosses with the same loadout but in this game, it won't work that way.
Each boss has his own abilities and to beat them, you'll need to figure out what abilities and loadout you need for beating it(him/her).
Try to attack the guys on fire head on and see what happens to you-this is the thing why you'll need to think fast and by fast,, I mean in milliseconds fast.Hotline Miami was hard but it also sometimes depended on your luck but in RUINER, forget luck, it's just pure skills you require to beat the bosses as well as the normal enemies.
The range of enemies is big enough and will never feel the same.
The levels look similar but play out completely differently and you'll feel like you've been there before.
Sure, the bosses get a bit challenging when you have no option to beat them directly but to first beat a series of creeps/enemies first.
This game is fast, brutal and requires you to stay focused because it's a real challenge unlike CUPHEAD which is basically not that hard of a game as people make it out to be to get attention from their friends how they beat a "VERY HARD GAME AHAHAHA".
I'm writing this review because I'm pretty pissed off at the people who are reviewing the game badly only because they suck at beating the bosses even on NORMAL.Their attention span is probably of a two year old and those crybabies are ruining the rating here.
I won't ask for upvotes but if you really think that this game is fair, do upvote my review.
P.S.-JUST BUY IT

35364897.review:
Sweet black fucking Sabbath, this is officially the first Devolver game that I have wanted and have actually kind of hated. I realize I wrote a negative review of Hotline Miami 2, and while I eventually came around on that game and should either update my review or (more likely, because that game is, by this point, old) delete it, this is a whole new kind of ire.

Look, I know I'm gonna be spitting in the ocean here, because the Dark Souls Revolution that has made the gaming sphere fuckin' fetishize cheap difficulty, so long as the game is up-front about it being absolute bullshit (by the way, for argument's sake, I've beaten DS 1, 2, and Bloodborne, just out of pure spite, so it isn't about lack of skill; I just really hate the idiotic 'git gud' culture because I feel it licenses developers to make inferior products and have them excused under a preexisting banner), so I'm not going to be overly specific or loquacious here; I'm going to use borderline bullet-points about why I didn't like this game.

The game feel is clunky; I went into this expecting Hotline, but it's much more robotic, with the directions corresponding to slightly-offset directions onscreen; consistent, but rotated about 45 degrees because the display is coopting what we normally call "isometric". That isn't a problem, but your guy feels sluggish when moving.

Running through the general level is fun, but as soon as you hit subbosses (especially) and bosses (less so, but still present), all pretense goes out the window. There is no resistance to when you get hit, there are no I-frames; you go from full health to half health or less in a matter of milliseconds, and the only way you'd know it is to look. You'd better not be looking, though, because boss enemies are harmful whether they're dashing, shooting, slashing, or looking in your general direction. Most of the bosses can fill the space with area-denial (fire or bouncing projectiles or whatever) and also be everywhere at once, with flawless homing ability. Similarly, even basic mooks with guns can cut you from full to nothing in literally less than a second, and the only reason you'll know is because the screen will flash red and white and you're prompted to restart.

Restarting doesn't always work like it does in Hotline. Against subbosses, rather than starting right up front against the SB, you start up against the last crop of dipshits you took down before he showed up. It's annoying, it's repetitive, and since the crop of idiots isn't what killed me, I'd prefer starting against the subboss who did so I can waste him and move on faster.

You take damage incredibly fast; a single bullet does, say, half a heart of damage, but since there are no I-frames, a three-round burst will hit you in the course of about half a second, and will take away a heart and a half in the time it takes you to blink. This is while other enemies are attacking, some of whom do more than that per strike, which means while you're noticing bullets, you may  move to dodge them and then get hit by two guys doing one move which happens to do half your health, so you still die in the space of about one second, regardless.

Add to that, and this is a minor grip, but relevant; everything in this game is fucking red. Like, I get it, guys, motif, but Jesus H. Moses, at a certain point, it gets hard to differentiate what the Hell is on the screen and what the Hell is going on, especially when motherfuckers are throwing firebombs everywhere. The lights are red, the fire is red (and orange), the outlines are red, you dash as a red silhouette, enemies dash red, weapon swipes are red, projectiles are red, the screen flashes red when you're low on health, it all blends together, and I can't BELIEVE the number of times I was prompted to hit "R" and just thought "what the FUCK just happened?  What killed me?" More confused than even irritated, until it happened for the twentieth time.  Even memorizing patterns, it all starts to get so chaotic as the battle goes on that it's incredibly easy to lose track until "YER DED PRESS R KAY". Again, it ceases to be amusing.

It merits saying that maybe you get more skills to mitigate this. It could be a case of Early Game Hell. Fuck, I mean, I love XCOM, so I'm no stranger to it, but this game went from suckering me in during the first 45 minutes to absolutely not fun whatsoever by the second subboss fight. I don't care if there's a special or correct way to do it, I don't care if trial-and-error is supposed to be the way you get things done or figure it out. I don't care if just keeping the entire arena between me and the boss enemy and shooting him with my basic pistol, doing chip damage until he dies and hoping he doesn't whip out some kind of almost-undodgeable or unforeseen, devestating attack works on every boss. It isn't fun. I was not enjoying myself once I past the 45 minute mark. And again, maybe it gets better later, but I doubt it, I don't think that's a valid excuse, and I wasn't interested in putting in more time spent irritated to find out if maybe that were true.

I did not PAY for this game and I want it off my Library list. Christ on sale, what a letdown.

This blows, because I was crazy excited for this game. But I am absolutely done. The rest of y'all can have it; I'm out. I'm gonna fire up Hotline 2 just to fuckin' unwind.

35360474.review:
Киберпанк экшн в стиле DOOM или Painkiller только с видом сверху.
Мне не нравились игры жанра TopDown Shooter из-за вида сверху и неудобного управления, но после Hotline Miami все изменилось, да управление было неудобное, да вид сверху, но все это испарилось когда я увидел "Шизофренический" сюжет, услышал отличнейшую музыку которая дополняла атмосферу данной игры и из-за этих моментов я быстро привык к управлению и прошёл его, 2 часть конечно не так порадовала, но было интересно его пройти.
Так вот RUINER это тот жеть Hotline Miami 2, вроде интересно играть, но что-то порой мешает или надоедает играть

1. Сюжет- банален донельзя, Главного героя взламывают, он идёт в корпорацию "Небеса" и ему дают задание убить Босса, и как обычно ничего не получается и похищают его брата и все вся игра будет про спасение братишки, хоть и сюжетный твист в конце хороший, но непонятный до конца.
2. Музыка - ничего выдающегося, запоминающихся композиций нет, иногда включается настолько монотонная музыка что аж засыпаешь, честно музыка для меня в этой игре полный провал.
3. Геймплей - отличный, зубодробительный, как будто это DOOM или Painkiller с видом сверху, но и тут есть косяки:
         A.Хитбоксы порой странно работают, вроде попал по врагу а хрен не попал, то по тебе урон проносится хотя ты вроде увернулся и не попадал под удар.
         B. Стрейф - этим тут будешь заниматься постоянно, т.к. врагов много и надо будет уворачиваться или наоборот близко к врагу подойти чтобы ударить, как бы хорошо до того момента когда появляются враги и начинают стрейфиться по всей арене и начинается игра в Кошки-Мышки, когда ты тупо бегаешь за противником и попасть по нему не можешь, порой это бесит (если юзать остановку времени то все равно наскучивает)
4. Графика - хорошая и тени и освещение и текстуры, все на высшем уровне.
5. Атмосфера киберпанка чувствуется особенно последняя глава, там полный кошмар творится.
6. Боссы, тут не все так однозначно т.к. боссы есть отличные (их 3), но все остальные похожи друг на друга своими способностями и поведением и с ним сражаешься одной и той же тактикой - остановил время и стреляешь в него, и это как то легко очень, вот 3 основных босса отличаются и тактикой и поведением и вот с ними сражаться весело.
7. Игра не сложная, т.е. да если вы не играли в Dark Souls, Super Meat Boy, Hotline Miami, Shovel Knight и The Witcher 3 на сложности "На Смерть", то да, для вас игра покажется сложной, неудобной и мучительной, но для меня как то слишком легко все было, ну кроме предпоследней локации из-за 3-ех фазового босса (сдох на нем 3 раза и то из-за этих хитбоксов, вроде увернулся а урон получил), как будто у разработчиков фантазия кончилась и они решили усложнить игру путём добавления босса который сдохнет только с 3 раза, и это опять же скучно, т.к. этот босс перед этим встречается 2 раза, никакого челленджа вообще нет.

Итог: Игра спорная вроде и хорошо а вроде бы и нет, да конечно есть и отличный геймплей и неплохие боссы, но всего этого недостаточно, т.к. музыка средняя, сюжет никакой, челленджа игра вообще не даёт, но дозу удовольствия получить можно.
Оценка 6 из 10.

35354451.review:
アートワークがヴィジュアル、サウンド共に最高にイカシテル。サイバーパンクのアラユル作品の雰囲気が包括されていて、控えめに言って最高。主観を交えると狂おしいほど最高！

ブレードランナーやアキラ等が好きなら是非体験してほしい世界観をもったゲームなのですが、難易度の敷居が少し高め。雑魚戦はそれ程でも無いですが、ボス戦が辛い。

難易度に加えて操作法に慣れが必要。ザックリ言うとWASD移動のDiablo3的な操作感で、少し取っ付きが悪い。個人的にゲームパッドの操作方法は早々に諦めました。

ダッシュ操作を的確に行えるようになると、スキルの構成を考えたりで世界が広がります。とりあえずリフレクスブースターを取得して育てとけば割と何とかなるとは思う。振り直しは何時でも何処でもできるので、敵に合わせてその場で組み換えも可能。

35350914.review:
RUINER is a cyberpunk twin stick shooter focused on delivering a first rate visual and audial experience. The art style is gritty and stylish, using comic book style renders to set the pulpy cyberpunk tone, and the soundtrack [i]rocks[/i]... expect a bit more bark than bite, but the game is still fun to play and it doesn't overstay its welcome (expect roughly 7-9 hours on Hard).

[b]Pros:[/b]
+ The art direction is excellent.
+ The soundtrack is excellent.
+ It's fast paced and never really feels like a slog.
+ Some bosses are really satisfying to fight and beat.
+ Once you get past the controls, the mechanics work incredibly well.
+ I personally really liked the story and writing. It's simple, but feels nuanced and [i]definitely[/i] like pulpy cyberpunk goodness.

[b]Cons:[/b]
- While the game has an excellent style, it would have benefited from more environmental variety.
- Some bosses are weaksauce, like Hongshi, which is a shame because I thought he had a very cool design. There were a few like him that turned out underwhelming.
- It lacks endgame content and is short.
- It was easy for me, even on Hard. I would have liked a mode that forced limited retries before full mission restart or something along those lines.

Overall, it's a good game and I recommend it. I look forward to seeing more content for the game.

35339054.review:
简单的介绍这个游戏只需要一句话：当你把游戏难度开高的时候，就是没有队友的超能版地狱老司机。

剧情：我疯起来连自己都杀。
有一天，某个基佬把我搞疯了，正当我马上得逞的时候，一个妹子阻止了我。她告诉我，其实我是一个兄控。
好吧，你说是就是吧，谁叫你是妹子呢，然后她就让我弄死了那个基佬，还顺手弄死了他身边的保镖。然后她又告诉我，你的哥哥被人绑了，我心想：我哪来的哥哥啊。然后我就来到这城里最大的物流公司找我哥。我刚刚前脚踏进物流公司，面前就出现了一群保镖，不分青红皂白的向我开枪。我没办法，只好还击，话说难道就不能好好说话吗，不过我转念一想，我头戴的这个头盔是完全隔音。我喊得再大声，他们也听不见，自己又不懂手语，即使懂，也不知道他们看不看得懂。所以我一路过关斩将，发现哥哥被放进了一个罐头里。我一路追啊追，最后看到了一个只有头的胖子。我这么一看，心头一阵喜悦涌上心来正要伸手去拿，然后他说，我这个头呀，什么都不喜欢就喜欢被电，一天不被电，浑身难受。我心里一惊，马上缩手。然后妹子要我赶紧电他，好让他带我去找哥哥。我点点头，便伸手去电。这不电不知道，一电吓一跳，胖子告诉我，我电得太有节奏感了，他这辈子都跟着我了。
我们回到城市，为胖子安装了遥控开关，他说，这样我就能随时随地的电他了。这样他就可以带我去找哥哥了。一路上，胖子不时的找我索电，我也只好给他。话说我不电你你就不会开门吗，自觉点好吗？可惜我说话他听不见，也只好电他了。不久后，一片火海挡在了我们面前，胖子满心欢喜的说到，这样我们就可以电火俩重天了。我靠，你还上瘾了是吧。好，我满足你。过了火海，胖子说，我麻了。你先走。我便留下胖子先走一步。
我一路跟着信号发现哥哥被俩个妹子抓住。我的哥，你这真不仗义啊。我这一路上，为了找你，带着一个头还有一个不知是男是女的声音指引这来到这里看到的居然是你和俩妹的愉快生活。你说我该怎么办。干！看我不把她们社保。然而，让我惊讶的是，胖子被她们改造了。他，不再是以前的那个他了。他纵身一跃，跳到了我的面前，我急忙展开半透明挡在面前，可是这半透明又怎能挡住他呢。
就在胖子穿过半透膜的那一瞬间，一阵酥麻的感觉直达他的脑髓，唤醒了他在十分钟前的记忆。对，他承诺过这辈子都跟着我了。
我，放半透膜，社保。
胖子，穿过，跟着我跑。
胖子，倒下，又站了起来。俩妹子看着我们打闹，说着还是不打扰我们了，羞答答了离开了。
我心想，这胖子真是纠缠不修，我还有找哥哥，别栏我，一脚把他踹开。往妹子方向追去。
天不负我，最后终于来到了哥哥面前，可是俩妹不愿放人，不仅她俩不肯，后面还有一群说我要先过她们那关。
我的哥，你究竟有多少妹子啊，就不能分我几个？？她们说完便前仆后继的向我冲来。当然了，我要做的，还是一件事，社保。双胞胎也用她们身下的庞然巨物和我对抢，可惜我油腻的身法还有哥哥那钛合金罐头过于英霸，她们最终还是败下阵来。
我终于可以见到我哥了，我打开罐头，发现一切都太晚了。那一刻，我疯了。




1.游戏后期磁悬浮摩托有类3D龙的影子，看得我头晕。不过可以别过头不看。差评X1
2.关卡选择毫无意义，新游戏重置一切进度。差评X2
3.近战判定略迷，近战小怪只要有出手帧，无论你有没有把它杀掉。都会打出伤害，要接近只有在出手之后，也就是挥出白线之后接近，挥出的白线没有伤害判定，敌人的远程穿透性攻击是持续伤害，也就是说只要你和子弹在同一个点上你会持续受到伤害。伤害判定不完善。差评X3

普通难度3.8小时通关。流程短，讲道理，不值20刀。国区不知道是多少钱，无论如何，建议打折入。

35337814.review: Устраиваем локальный экстерминатус под стильный саундтрэк.

35337643.review:
С самого начала игростроения поджанры top-down верно сопровождали игроков. За последние годы представители "экшена с видом сверху" ни раз радовали поклонников жанра. Далеко ходить не надо! В августе, например, вышел Redeemer — приключения сурового дяди Васи, а также X-Morph: Defence - лихо закрученный Tower Defence с элементами бодрой стрелялки.

И вот еще одна top-down поделка — Ruiner.  Как и у вышеперечисленных игр, разработчиками Ruiner является небольшая и молодая студия — Reikon Games. Увидев премьерный трейлер игры (а это было более года назад) мы сразу поняли — надо играть! Тем более, издатель игры — Devolver Digital, а они умело отделяют инди-зерна от инди-плевел.

По трейлеру сразу стало понятно, что глубокого сюжета можно не ждать (хотя его нам, вроде бы, наобещали), но какой-никакой он тут есть — без особых изысков, но вполне вписывающийся и не отвлекающий - подстать настоящему киберпанк боевику.

Вы — киборг в маске из клипа System Of A Down на трек B.Y.O.B, вашего брата (видимо, это — нормальное дело, киборги — братья, все такое) похитили злодеи, вам тайно помогает девушка-хакер и некоторые местные жители, порой не добровольно, порой за какие-то услуги. Ваша цель — спасти брата и наказать злодеев. Классика, можно сказать, а за глубокой историей идите в Hellblade.

В перерывах между миссиями предоставляют возможность побродить по городу и даже пообщаться с некоторыми персонажами. Кардинально это ни на что не влияет, однако, выступает приятным бонусом к общей атмосфере и антуражу. Город небольшой, но очень живой, наполненный кучей деталей и нюансов.

Сами же миссии проходят в любимых киберпанками локациях — тут вам и постапокалиптические трущобы, и заводы, переправляющие киборгов. Сеттинг в целом атмосферен, но следует привычным канонам, что в итоге даже немного угнетает.

Кат-сцены в Ruiner выполненны прямо-таки хорошо, добротно, и эффективно разбавляют бесконечную мясорубку. Внутреигровые диалоги выполнены в виде стильных статичных артов. Ах да, не будем забывать и про чумовейший саундтрек, идеально дополняющий атмосферу и стилистику игры, за который не жалко и отдельно выложить свои кровные.

Собственно, геймплей представляет из себя просто адски динамичное рубилово с огромным количеством противников и широким выбором оружия, как холодного, так и огнестрельного. В бою расслабиться невозможно — чтобы выйти живым, нужно полностью погрузиться в битву. В общем, бои — это проверка вашей реакции. Все нужно делать быстро, но не бездумно. Битвы происходят на сильно ограниченных аренах по однообразному сценарию, и это немного раздосадовало. Вы забегаете на локацию, появлются ограждения, начинают лезть враги, вы их уничтожаете, ограждения убираются, и вы двигаете к следующей арене. Это стало бы серьезным минусом, если продолжительность игры была бы немного больше.

Конечно, нельзя не упомянуть и местных боссов. Если в рядовых битвах нам порой приходилось выстраивать тактику после… эмм… надцатой смерти, то в замесах с боссами вам просто необходимо думать, как же их быстренько нейтрализовать.

Да, по умолчанию игра неприветлива к новичкам и тормозам, для которых в Ruiner предусмотрена возможность переключиться на уровень сложности “легко”. Зато любители хардкора смогут отвести душу и вдоволь пожечь напалмом. 

[u]Вердикт:[/u]
Разработчики из Reikon Games утверждают, что основной упор делали на четыре элемента: геймплей, историю, графику и звук. Пусть не без оплошностей, но в RUINER каждый пункт детально проработан. Это отличный слэшер подвида top-down, с кучей оружия и разнообразных врагов, в потрясающем сеттинге, вдохновлённом киберпанком и sci-fi.

+ Напряженный и разнообразный геймплей
+ Визуальный стиль и музыкальное сопровождение
+ Живой город, который хочется исследовать
+ Способ подачи истории только через диалоги

- Тривиальный сюжет
- Полное отсутствие озвучки
- Скучная система прокачки

Оценка: 7.5/10

35317676.review:
[h1] 用恨意驱动创意的发行商	[/h1]

无论是否愿意，绝大多数的游戏开发/发行商都会告诉你：我们全心全意为了玩家和业界的未来着想。他们卖力地扮演着艺术家和时代领导者的样子，告诉玩家这样玩才对、那样做才好、“听爸爸的话”就有好游戏玩。我们享受着已经成熟的游戏环境，在一个个包装精美、服务周到的商品里流连。而在RUINER这款游戏中，向来就不吝啬展示恶意的发行商Devolver Digital    和它新晋小弟Reikon，再次对玩家露出了无情的嘲笑。

嗜血狂徒、暴力龙头企业、自私的骇客，在这么一个标准的“脏赛博”世界里，暴力便是人类未来文明的通行证。和发行商成名作品《迈阿密热线》类似，这个街机流程风格的双轴射击游戏，围绕着游戏核心的便是各种血肉横飞的厮杀。

这么一个题材，换作脑回路正常点的制作组，多半会强调些关于人性与机械的不可调和性、把玩家塑造成机械之神化身、再来点人文思考什么的就最好了。

而作为一个绰号疯狗社，逮住机会就对着玩家和业界竖中指，即便外人看上去表现得很笨拙，却仍然掩盖不住深深恨意的怪咖公司，它的游戏不会告诉你生活的美好、人性的光辉还是什么狗屁的人性化游戏体验；这里只有嗑了药以后搞出来的美术、绝望的故事和操蛋的主角、在序章就达成50次死亡记录的恶心难度。

我无意揣测发行商的经营理念，也不可能了解Devolver Digital高层用什么样的标准挑选开发组。但是从我对它们的游戏有限的理解里，我看到的是隐藏在其中对主流观念的反抗、是50岁欧美肥佬难以割舍的叛逆、是隐藏在游戏中那些在社会上无处发泄的愤怒。这些混球假装爱着玩家、做出一个个好玩有趣的游戏、尽全力地克制让人们不要看出其中隐藏着的尖酸嘲讽，并把赚到的钱拿来继续支持自己将对这个世界的不满宣泄在游戏开发中去。

而RUINER这一次又再次刷新了我对Devolver Digital这个贱货下限的认知 —— 它变得成熟了、机灵了、懂得在你眼前拴根骨头让你心甘情愿往屎坑里面跳了！

[h1] 与教学提示对着干如此美妙	[/h1]

不知道从什么时候开始，我在游戏中已经习惯了被指引 —— 当我找不到路的时候，希望画面上出现方向指示；当我面对BOSS一筹莫展时，就想依赖系统提示它的弱点。这是现代游戏制作规范化人性化的趋势，也是玩家作为操作者权力遭到侵犯的前兆。

而很多玩家已经开始对这个现状不满了，也有很多开发者明白过来，反其道而行之了。RUINER在游戏中没有给予你什么提示，在对玩家权力的开放性上，做得也十分有勇气。

本作除了运用双摇杆操作的移动/射击外，最核心的系统便是主角的技能 —— 通过升级获取点数、解锁的13项技能是除了武器之外提供给玩家战术变化的基础。本身这些技能没有什么特别创新的，你在绝大多数游戏里都能见到类似的花样：子弹时间、护盾、狂暴或者手雷等等。它们被固定分配到五个按键里，通过消耗能量来发动，以帮助玩家实现各种战斗方式。

通常来说，这类自由配点的游戏会告诉你：每个人都能玩出自己的风格，然后就在多数时间里锁死你选择好的技能树，让你的人物在流程中长期保持一个风格。而本作看似谁都能做到，却没有几款游戏愿意的是，它将技能树的配点完全开放给你。无论在什么时候，玩家都可以打开技能菜单，将你使用过后的技能点回收，随时丢到其它技能里头。正因为如此，唯一限制玩家的便只有等级的因素了，你觉得冲刺回避用腻了，就换成护盾防御；你找到一把趁手的武器，就把手雷和子弹时间的技能回收掉，加到枪械运用上去。

完全放任玩家随意配点，虽然只是一个简单的设计，却恰恰透露出了制作组对于自己游戏设计的自信：

[b] “随你怎么折腾，都能玩出不同的花样、随你怎么规划，你肯定会遇到要更换战术的时候。”	[/b]

我不知道是否有完全不需要技能辅助的高手，但是至少作为一个训练关死了17次的人来说，RUINER的难度让我必须对流程中面对的挑战认真应对。随着游戏中不断出现新的敌人，我在之前配置的技能，经常会出现派不上用场的时候。而反过来的，一些明显需要用固定手法应对的情况，我却经常发现一些奇葩的战术，往往能发挥出惊人的效果。

拿前文提到的“母娘”做例子，无论是游戏宣传片，还是剧情中角色的警告，都告诉玩家开启能量护盾是最安全的做法。然而你也可以考虑强化“冲刺时减少伤害”+“能量恢复加强”+“攻击力爆发”这样的配置。在面对袭来的能量射线时主动用冲刺去承受伤害，通过对方的攻击来不断恢复你的能量，达到无限续航“攻击力爆发”以瞬间击杀BOSS。

或者更容易理解的案例：利用枪械技能附带的“开火回复能量”，配合闪光手雷，就能让所有吃硬直的BOSS毫无还手之力。

一个流程极为线性，内容就是走到一个个战点，清理敌人的“莽夫游戏”，却能让我玩出了些许的CRPG神韵。它的技能系统谈不上多么深奥，但是确实是过了脑子、并与游戏流程合理搭配起来的。在具有挑战性的难度驱使下，玩家面对一次次挫折必须去学习、变通，尝试更灵活地战术配置，最后将原本难以击败的敌人轻松解决。

富有挑战性，给予你极大的自由选择权，能真切地玩出个人风格的游戏，让本作在游戏性上展现了某种程度“开放”。但是，也正因为在游戏过程中，让我体会到了为所欲为的痛快，它的故事才更加显得无比恶毒。

[h1] GO！Puppy	[/h1]

[code] 2091年，科技发展与电脑工程有了长足的进步，然而人类的本性却没有任何改变。

.........玩弄他人的性命，就是如此有趣！！！	[/code]

被人操纵是什么滋味？

很不幸的，这种体会也许恰恰是那些被操纵着的人最难以理解的。无论是多么风光无限的游戏主角，命运始终是被坐在屏幕前的玩家所掌控着；而不管玩家的操纵的权力多大，却没有多少机会超越开发者所赋予的底限。

每个人都是某种程度的线牵着走的。

越是体会到RUINER游戏过程的可变性，越是能感受到在故事中主角的无力 —— 不管你击败了多少人，无论你对于系统的熟悉多么深，始终是一只被骇客牵在手上的猎犬。他们利用你达成目的、指挥你去做你可能并不同意的事、最恶劣的是他们嘲笑一般地给予了你没有任何意义的选择权。

制作组就像是嘲笑着所谓“分支决定故事”的设计一般，在游戏剧情对话里加入了大量“选项”，你可以点头、耸肩甚至是皱眉头哦，当然是没有任何改变故事可能的那种。最扯淡的是他们还给主角做了“面部表情”，暗示性的信息和似乎意有所指的对话，让人在初次游玩时真的以为能有什么所谓分支。

没有，狗主人无论是好是坏，都不会让狗的命运改变。

即便你在过了序章，从欠揍的宅男主人，换成瞎特么用颜文字的漂亮妹子，被人操纵的命运也不会有任何变化。没有反抗的机会、没有人同情、没有反驳的话语权。“她”就这样肆无忌惮地对着可以干掉整个军队的主角说出“GO！Puppy”，明目张胆地说出你不过是个达成目地的工具，顺便还要你感谢她给你换了个主人的机会。

她给了你一个怎么看都是假的目标，让你出生入死，最后这些冒险还可能都是假的。但是，至少你还有面对现实的可能 —— 当你千辛万苦找到哥哥，面对他透露的一切时，你获得了唯一一次，也是最后一次为自己选择的权力。

许多同类题材的故事里我们都会看到类似的发展：主角历经重重磨难，却发现自己是被人利用，只是庞大阴谋里的棋子。多数情况下，好的结局是他们得以脱身离去，糟糕些的也不过一死了之。但像RUINER这样，全程都不断嘲笑着主角身份，在结局也没有什么救赎可言的案例实在是不多。

唯一让我欣慰的，大概就是这不是本小说或是电影，而是在命运之外还有着选择权的电子游戏了。

[h1] KILL YOU	[/h1]

游戏毕竟是程序生成的，无论开发者尽了多么大的努力，它始终是有着看不见的墙、触摸不到的可能性存在的。无论给予多么丰富的选项，为你的选择考虑多少可能的变化，你总归会走到和他人相同的一条线上。但是游戏的魅力往往不在于选择的结果，而是我们在进行选择的时候所倾注的情感，以及享受通往结局之前的期盼。

那么就像游戏中我们常做的那样，换个思路：当我第一次看到这个游戏的宣传片时，迎面扑来的是滔天的戾气。压抑的红色基调与配乐，仿佛宣示着它就是个标榜着杀无赦的游戏。Reikon想要在他们的作品中传达，也许并非只是愤世嫉俗的“选择那么多，最后还不是一模一样”，毕竟我不觉得有人会犯贱到特意用极度开放的游戏性来彰显故事的无力。

如果游戏所透露的恶意是为了激发你的愤怒呢？那种处处被人耍着玩的郁闷是等待着爆发的机会呢？

当你决定不去思考这些内在的问题时，就全身心地去享受主人放开链子那一刻吧 —— 那些雇佣兵们不会给你点头或是耸肩的机会、那些赛博忍者才不管你是否皱眉、你和它们之间唯一可以讨论的就是谁的牙齿更锋利。

当那些躲在幕后的阴谋家面对你的时候，他们在你眼中看到的没有“是与否”，没有“询问和接受任务”。在那些被操纵着命运，随波逐流的人抓住一丝机会时，人们在这些狗狗的眼中只能看到 —— 

[b] KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU ............	[/b]

35317300.review:
I was excited as fuck when this game was first announced, and I'm happy as hell to say that the wait was worth it. Ruiner is in my top 5 for my games of the year no fuckin' doubt, but why is it? I'm glad you [strike] didn't	[/strike] ask!

[h1] Da Story	[/h1]

The story of Ruiner is actually pretty simple, you start off as a cyborg [strike] I think? [/strike] hitman sent out by some unknown man telling you to kill the boss. Then some cute hacker girl gets to you before you can, then tells you someone hacked your brain and you gotta find your brother and kill the people who got you in this mess. But I was just so damn intrigued to read all the dialogue, since the writing is just fun to read. Whether it be a conversation about the next location your brother's at and a boss you gotta kill, or some cat lady on the side of the street telling you about these conspiracies about cats being used to monitor the city. Solid 10/10 for the writing.

[h1] Da Gameplllllllaaayyyyyyy	[/h1]

Ruiner is a twin stick shooter type game so it's fairly simple to control, use a controller or keyboard, either way it's not that hard to control. The combat sections are what take up a good chunk of the game, so as long as they're fun, it's all good, and gladly they are fun, very fun, in-fact. Every combat section is just a huge clusterfuck of bullets, explosions, and blood, the guns feel satisfying and the melee combat is just as good. Crunchy ass sounds for hitting someone with a lead pipe and choppin' people up with a katana is something this game can do well. The guns are also really damn fun to use, not all of them are good, but they're all damn fun. The basic pistol can be upgraded to a machine gun that can hold up against the final boss via upgrades. Also speaking of bosses, yeah this game is hard as nails. Is that a bad thing? No, not really, although I was screaming bloody murder during the later bossfights, they're still beatable [strike] except for shadow which I had to turn the fucking difficulty down to beat but then again I'm pretty shit at video games so [/strike] so they're really nothing to complain about. Strong 9/10 from me.

[h1] Da Soundddddtraaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaack	[/h1]

HOLY FUCK THIS SOUNDTRACK IS GREAT, FUCKING SUSUMU HIRASAWA HOW THE [b] FUCK [/b] DID THEY EVEN MANAGE TO GET HIM I DONT KNOW BUT IM NOT COMPLAINING, BUT I AM COMPLAINING THAT THEY ONLY GOT TWO SONGS IN THERE, THEY'RE DAMN GOOD BUT CMOOOOOOOOOOOOOON MAN

Other than that, the soundtrack is absolutely great and fits in perfectly with the tone of the game, just wish there were more songs in it, cuz it kinda feels like I've been listening to the same songs each level. Strong 8/10 over here

[h1] Overall oppppppppinnnnnnnnnnnnioooooon	[/h1]

Buy Ruiner, I'm basically a walking advertisment for this game ever since I got it because I love this game so damn much, straight up one of the best games I've played since Hotline Miami 2, and I strongly, [b] strongly [/b] recommend it to anyone. 

[h1] Strong 9/10	[/h1]

Also ty to my friend who gifted me this game since I have no money :v
Here's to hoping an expansion comes out in the future

35316150.review:
Pros

+ Right off the bat, the visual aesthetic is fantastic. The artstyle oozes with cyberpunk influence. If you're a fan of this kind of genre, then I'd recommend checking this game out for the visuals alone.

+ The soundtrack is awesome. It really fits the chaotic undertone of the game.

~ Gameplay is extremely fast paced and visceral, but can get repetitive after a while.

Cons 

- Keyboard movement controls are very strange. Your character moves based on the perspective of the environment itself, meaning that pressing W doesn't go directly up, but goes to the top-right instead. There is supposedly going to be a patch for this soon, but in the mean time, controllers have the more convenient movement controls according to my own experience.

- Lack of voice acting. This really takes away a lot of the immersion I have during dialogue scenes. 

- Some of the major boss fights are lacking IMO. Dodging a giant moving beam gets repetitive after a while. Not to mention you'll be having multiple encounters with the same few bosses throughout the game with little to no variation.

---------

Overall, I enjoyed my time with Ruiner. I absolutely adore the aesthetic of the game, and that's the main reason why I'll be giving this game a thumbs up. Chances are, you might enjoy the gameplay aspect a lot more than I do, but I think it could've been better.

35313985.review:
Finished this game the same day I bought it. It was one of those games that I just couldn't put down once I picked it up, which should serve as a pretty good indicator of the game's quality by itself. Although it was not all roses, I had a blast and I very much recommend this game to anyone who likes twin-stick shooters. Let's break down the pros and cons.

Pros:
* The artstyle. While fairly generic cyberpunk by some standards, in my opinion it does just enough to stand out. The main character's holographic mask is a wonderfully weird feature, as are the occasional flashes of "GET EM PUPPY" or "HELLO DARKNESS" when fights begin.

* The combat. Some weapons feel clunky and underpowered, some make you feel like God himself, but on the whole it's all well balanced and engaging. Zipping around like a grasshopper and seamlessly switching between shooting and melee attacks kept me entertained the whole way through.

* The skill system. You won't unlock everything in one playthrough, so making choices and finding your preferences is a must. Fortunately, you can also move points around at any time - even in the middle of fights! - which makes it easy to adapt if a particular strategy isn't working.


The cons:

* The checkpoints. While most are just fine, a couple of them are placed in such a way that you'll have to fight a few mooks or even just wait a while before a miniboss or similar threat appears, which can become very tedious if you're having trouble with that particular section.

* The story. It's a decent "Save your beloved X" story, but it seems rather detached from most things you find out during the course of the game. The world building is great, especially with the in-game database fleshing out details about every single weapon, enemy and location, but it feels somewhat unrelated to your overall goal. The ending is cathartic, but doesn't give a lot of answers, and I felt like it was setting up for a post-credits stinger that never came. It should be mentioned that I have only completed the game on normal difficulty, and thus remain unaware if higher difficulties reward you with extra story details.


Conclusion:

RUINER is a great game with a couple of flaws that, while individually annoying, doesn't RUIN the overall experience. It is a great first showing from Reikon Games, and I'm excited to see what they can achieve in the future.

35313857.review: There's some unexpected difficulty spikes in part of the game, but I don't think they're unpleasant enough to outweigh that absolutely stellar atmosphere this game has going on. Even the easy mode is going to be hard for some people, but it's worth sticking with it.

35311486.review:
There are three good things about this game that stand out: the art style, which is, despite being somewhat generic in terms of the cyberpunk aesthetic, very pretty; the gameplay, which, with a few exceptions, is satisfying, fluid, and fun; and the soundtrack, which is very well done and surpisingly diverse.  

That said, there are also three bad things about this game that stand out: the difficulty, which, on hard, ranges from piss easy to frustrating in a bad way (talking about you, King); the story, which was largely contrived and uninteresting; and the bosses, which were disappointingly static and lacking in memorability.

Overall, the game was, IN MY OPINION, a solid 7.5/10--worth playing, but not worth replaying for any reason except to get called puppy by a hacker girl with a violent streak.

35310813.review:
The Good:
- Soundtrack. Let's get that out of the way asap. Nowadays a good soundtrack for a non-AAA title is almost mandatory, this game has it.
- Gameplay. In general, the combat is fair and satisfying. It is also balanced greatly around wide variety of skills: normally in such a fast paced game melee weapons would rule compeletely, this is not the case here as building a ranged-focused character is absolutely possible.
- Atmosphere. The developers managed to deliver a believable (and likeable) world in a difficult genre as cyberpunk. Strolling around Rengkok was actually enjoyable. 
- Difficulty. Ignore modern "video game journals" that scream about the game being too difficult. It's not. There's a lot of room for abusing abilities to make your game easier. Just play smart and don't be afraid of dying. Don't forget that sometimes brute force is the easiest way out as well. The "Hard" difficulty is recommended for everyone except people who just want to complete the game and move on.

The Bad:
- Story. Honestly, it was lackluster for my liking. However, I've enjoyed most of the characters presented, so this is not an indication that the whole writing in game is bad. The plot is simple and predictable and the game sometimes fails to extract requested emotions from me.
- Restarting at certain arenas/bosses. This grinded on my gears the most in this game. Two or three major battles in the game has to be restarted including the unskippable cutscene beforehand. Sometimes there are cutscenes during boss stages, which you also can't skip and you have to go through them until you defeat the boss. Frustrating, I don't know why it's in the game.

In general: 8/10, a very solid game, must buy for fans of fast paced action, cyberpunk and collectors of dat karma.

*KILLER COMBO*

Edit:
Now the game has two new gamemodes: Speedrun mode and NG+. Aside from some small inconveniences that are already patched/being patched within a couple of days, these game modes are fantastic. The game is now certainly more replayable and a speedrun leaderboard in game certainly motivates you to try and hit it to the top.
New player skins are also good, but I think they are a bit similar, aside from two of them, and one of them is gated behind a pretty heavy 1hr speedrun condition.

In current state of the game, i'd rate it 9/10 easily. 

*BUTCHER COMBO*

Edit #2:
Well, now we also have an Arena mod in the game. This is a fantastic addition, since it combines the new stuff from NG+ and blends it with the original game much smoother than NG+ did by itself.

The score system, however, is a bit unbalanced, since it rewards bonus stages heavily (you can net too many points if you play the stage right + get lucky a bit) and it kinda sucks since all the other stages matter less: just don't die and you're fine with whatever.

What I liked is that Ruiner Kills are actually rewarded in this gamemode, which was the complete opposite in Speedrun mode. New mechanics are really fun (I liked the boss + bodyguard mechanic and upgraded bossfight from regular game at last stage), the progression system is awesome and actually allows you to try out skills you didn't bother with in the original game (which is a shame really, try them all out!). Ghost Break+ seems broken at stage 10 BTW.

The game keeps getting better and better.
9.5/10

*SLAYER COMBO*

35301320.review:
I wish there was a middle ground between thumbs up and down. Because this game has a lot going for it and is worth playing, but it also has a few glaring problems that make it feel...wrong. 

Biggest problem is that Dashing seems to have no i-frames. Now, I'm playing on hard, so this might not have much bearing on lower difficulties, but I find myself CONSTANTLY being hit mid dash by both melee and projectile attacks.  And yes, this doesn't make the game unplayable, it just alters how you have to play. Specifically, it means you can't dodge forward through projectiles like a bad ass. You have to dodge away. Which  sounds fine on paper but in practice it means the game becomes a lot more defensive  as you constantly attack and then pull back rather than neatly dodging through an enemy shot and continuing to fight. 

Half the time you just end up dashing in at an angle, hitting someone with a pipe and stun locking them for 2-3 hits- which often doesn't kill them- and then dashing back out. 

And this is fine. The game works just fine. Everything looks great. Everything sounds great. Everything about the game is great but It just seems antithetical to the brutal, hardcore, ultraviolent presentation to make you have to fight with such a defensive, pokey, constantly retreating style.  There's a lot of similarity between this game and Hotline Miami of course, but in Hotline you always had this sense of forward momentum. Because everything in hotline died in one hit there was this capacity to charge down a hall and, with the right actions, kill everything without slowing down. It was all about that one perfect run where you come in and everything dies within a few seconds. 

Ruiner...you just don't feel that. Every fight is a chaotic melee that requires you to play defensively rather than agressively. If you cut loose and try to weave through bullets and kill with style, you just get beaten down.  So you sigh and you do it how the game is desgined: you move carefully, you wear the enemies down, you switch weapons constantly to make use of a semi-random slowdown effect, and you deal with the fact that enemies have attack animations that make them literally immune to bullets. Yeah. The jumping attacks of pipe weilding thugs make them invincible at the start and end because they are ducking, and thus the bullets go over them. I think they're even immune through part of the jump itself, on the apex of it, but thats hard for me to say for sure. 

I'm rambling. Ruiner is a great game but the actual combat mechanics seem at odds with the style and presentation, at least in hard mode.

35293841.review:
TL;DR: Needs tweaking really, really badly. Probably worth a play but it will take a design patch before it's a truly great game.

Disclaimer: I'm only ~3 hours in and will definitely continue playing if only just to see if the problems mentioned below get any better.

The world, characters, and general aesthetic look and feel GREAT. I love what Reikon have done here. Big shoutout to whoever was responsible for the music, it fits in perfectly and there are some real bangers in there.

I love the ability to swap your ability toolset and experiment with different strategies at any given point.

HOWEVER

RUINER in it's current state feels waaaaay too "spongey". The challenge only really comes from bullet sponges for enemies, and AI that feel less like people within a world and more like omnipresent beings (even accounting for cybernetic implants). Most of the boss fights feel more like an akward grind than anything.

There's so much to like about this game, and it's soooo close to being a really great title. I really wanted to like it, but the combat is just such a let down.

As a player I don't feel rewarded when I successfully execute moves that the games seems to be designed around, like slowing time, dashing to dodge bullets and get up into an enemies face to take them down. Instead of being rewarded with the sound of a dead enemy, I'm met with little more than a smaller red bar at their feet, and them somehow reacting instantly to my new location and blasting me in the face. I'm forced to cancel my next move, go back and finish the enemy off, ruining ANY sense of flow within the combat.

I can progress through the level and the game just fine, but the fights are just mundane. Whenever you die (and you will) you feel like the game cheated you and it's just frustrating.

The enemy health bars are really hard to see btw, and having them present by default only seems to distract from the larger picture, which seems counter to what Reikon are trying to do given the number of enemies within each fight. If you pick up this title I'd recommend turning them off.

A lot of people seem bent on comparing this to Hotline Miami, but it's probably the furthest you can get from it. Where HM felt tight, quick, and immensely satisfying, RUINER leaves me disappointed and frustrated. I'm doing everything it seems to want, with little to no reward.

During my time first playing RUINER, I tried Hard initially, found the bullet sponge situation to be unbearable and assumed I would have a better time on Normal. However even after switching still found the combat just as disappointing.

On the topic of in-game settings, not having the ability to remap buttons is less than ideal, but hey we're on Steam so we can do that ourselves I guess. Also would have appreciated the option to change the shield ability to hold-to-use rather than toggle, found it weird that I couldn't change that.

Last thing I will say is that Capt. Bodgan is the worst boss fight I've ever played that I can remember, hands down. Every time I felt like I was playing well I would be punished by some grenade bouncing off the wall and exploding in my face before I could react to it. The blast radius on everything in that fight feels larger than it should be, the AI seems to know where I was going to be at the end of my dash before I did, then proceed to shoot me in the face with a grenade before I get control of my character back, killing me at half-health.

There doesn't seem to be any identifiable hole in his behaviour pattern, making it hard to formulate any kind of plan. When he finally does stop firing, his shields immediately go up, reflecting any projectiles, and when you do get it down he starts launching grenades at your face again. Grendades that can kill you at half health shouldn't travel *that fast* AND explode on impact. One or the other, not both. All the issues with the AI design are very very apparent in that particular fight, because of the nature of his weapons and the environment.

Exploding a barrel when a boss is next to it feels very underwhelming, doing the same amount of damage it would have if I had just fired those bullets at the boss instead. The barrels feel more like environmental hazards than tools to be taken advantage of.

In summary, maybe I'm getting old at the ripe age of 24 and can't play shooters anymore, but to me RUINER feels more interested in punishing the player than entertaining them. Not in the Dark Souls challenging but fair kind of way either, in a fuck you I'm the computer simulation and you're the lowly human kind of way. If that's your thing then pick it up by all means, but it's not what I'd call a satisfying game.

35291059.review:
Intense, fast-paced, unforgiving gameplay combined with a beautiful cyberpunk atmosphere all underpinned by an [i] incredbile [/i] soundtrack. If any of these intrest you, RUINER will almost certainly be worth the purchase.

Points that I have found worth mentioning during my time with the game:

[list]
[*]With controls that are snappy and quick to respond, it never feels like the game is at fault if you die.

[*]Huge selection of weapons to use, from industrial slegehammers and pipes that set enemies on fire all the way to weaponised high-intensity laser rifles and the classic minigun.

[*]Sounds for weapons, melee hits, skills and environments are fantastic.

[*]Over the course of the game, you aquire upgrade points which you can assign to a wide variety of skills, as well as furthering the abilites of each skill. However, these upgrades are not permanently locked in once used, and can be re-assigned at any time which is handy.

[*]Bosses pose a very real threat and challenge. While they may seem extremely difficult on your first encounter with each one, they usually follow a certain pattern of attacks. Once you get used to each pattern, it can be exploited with use of your skills and upgrades. Don't be fooled though, even if you do find the pattern/rhythm, the difficulty of the boss battle does not go down by much. You will still need to be on point with your attacks and dodges. But once you finally defeat a boss, it is very satisfying.

[*]While there are a few cutscenes, most of the game's story is told via text-based interactions with characters. Usually you will be able to respond to characters with one of two replies, but these do not seem to heavily affect the main path of the story (e.g. Witcher-style). Anyone looking for an in-depth story may be disappointed.
I found the story to be engaging and enjoyed the variety of characters and their designs, especially the design of the character you play as. The whole head-video-mask-vibe thing going on is really cool, and the videos/text that are displayed on the mask to show emotions/mood/intentions during gameplay and interactions are a nice touch which adds to the cyberpunk atmosphere.
[/list]

Overall, a solid 9/10.

Imagine Hotline Miami and Transistor had a very drunken night, courtesy of VA-11 HALL-A, and you get this game. 
Get ready to die if you're not used to fast-paced strategizing - and maybe even if you are. This game is absolutely *punishing* if you don't know how to time yourself and rapidly adapt to the situation.

Fair warning that the writing is a touch trite and cliché, but if you're willing to look past some of the predictable narrative, this should be no issue for you. 

Fantastic ambience, though, and I'm a sucker for a nice aesthetic. Really digging the heavyhanded religious language used in a corporate fashion, too. An interesting choice.

다프트 펑크 헬멧을 쓴 자켓이 사이버펑크한 적들을 모조리 패죽이고 다니는 게임.(?)

1. 강렬한 사이버펑크 분위기와 그래픽은 참 마음에 들었습니다. 그러나 내실이 부족하다고 해야할지,화려하게 구현된 사이버 펑크 도시 풍경은 말 그대로 풍경처럼 느껴졌습니다. 좀 더 상호작용적인 부분이나 서브 퀘스트 같은 부분 등 멋지게 구현된 사이버 펑크 도시에서 플레이어가 좀 더 몰입할만한 무언가가 많이 부족했다고 생각되었습니다.
단순히 다음 미션을 진행하기 전에 쉬어가기 용도로 넘어가기에는 너무 아쉬웠어요. 

2. 독특한 전투 시스템을 활용한 스피디한 게임 플레이는 상당히 즐거웠습니다만 난이도 부분이 상당히 아쉬웠던 점이 많았습니다.
처음 게임을 진행할 때 보통 난이도로 시작하였는데 초반 튜토리얼의 15초 타임어택 구간 때에는 도저히 버티지 못하여 난이도를 쉬움으로 바꾸고 말았을 정도로 초반 난이도가 무자비 하다 생각되었습니다. 
그런데 게임을 진행하면 진행할수록 플레이어 캐릭터가 레벨업 하면서 사용가능한 스킬과 업그레이드 된 스텟 덕분에 후반부 난이도는 정말 표기대로 '쉬움' 이 되버리는 아이러니함 생겼습니다.

3. 스토리 라인과 게임 분량 또한 아쉬웠습니다. 스토리 부분은 더 자세히 말하기에는 스포일러가 되버리기에 생략하겠습니다만 주인공이 스토리를 진행하는 개연성이 많이 부족하다 싶었습니다.오로지 스토리 라인을 따라가는 싱글 플레이 트윈 스틱 슈터 게임 치고는  5시간의 플레이 타임은 적은게 아닌가 생각됩니다.

결론:
멋지게 구현됬지만 배경 이상의 기능을 하지 않는 사이버펑크 도시
멋진 전투 시스템을 가졌지만 초반이 미칠듯이 어렵고 후반이 미칠듯이 쉬워지는 기묘한 난이도
개연성이 부족하다 싶은 스토리 라인과 짧은 플레이타임

개인적으로는 사이버펑크를 좋아해서 5점 만점에 4점 쯤 주고 싶지만 다른 분들에게 추천하자면 3점쯤 주고 싶은 게임이였습니다. 후속작이 나와준다면 좀 더 나아진 모습을 보여줬으면 싶은 아쉬웠던 게임이였습니다.

35276862.review:
"¡Te han hackeado el cerebro!"

Este juego es diferente a la mayoría de videojuegos de acción que conozco. Sus mecánicas no nos serán desconocidas, es más, utiliza loot de armas por colores -como ya se ha visto en multitud de títulos", un avance lineal, mamporros y disparos en una mezcla curiosa entre Alienation y Hotline Miami y el típico árbol de habilidades. Un popurrí de conceptos que en lo jugable funcionan, pero que ya conocemos -insisto- de otros juegos. Eso no es lo que hace distinto a RUINER, es otra cosa...

Creo que es su estupenda ambientación, ese juego malsano de flashbacks, luces desconcertantes, recuerdos intermitentes e imágenes cegadoras. Es ese conseguidísimo Cyberpunk como no había visto en mucho tiempo en el mundo de los videojuegos, con esa "tecnodecadencia" tan característica, más punk que cyber, más violento que lógico. Un baño de sangre con gran música electrónica y una adicción que me han hecho acabarlo en dos tardes. Los colores aunque representan lugares decadentes, son vivos, ricos, super llamativos, no te dejan mirar para otro lado. El ritmo es FRENÉTICO, es bien exigente. RUINER es una mezcla de lo típico con algún ingrediente propio que no acierto a describir... ¿quizá es cómo está contado? ¿Cómo mezcla de forma tan brutal historia y gameplay? ¿O me han enamorado las batallas, en las que hay que pensar antes de aporrear el ratón y teclado?

Sea como fuera, RUINER es algo nuevo. Y encima isométrico, una vista que parecía que no podía ofrecer una acción tan intensa y macabra, pero aquí está para quedarse. Jugado en Difícil desde la primera partida... me ha costado mucho pasar de algunos jefes. Este juego es brutal.

Como única pega siento que en el diseño de fases se podría haber hecho algo más, noto todo demasiado "similar" (que nadie me malinterprete, hay muchísimas encerronas y situaciones únicas). 

¡Jugadlo en cuanto podáis!

35274944.review:
I beat the game in a sleepless 20 hours after launch!

Overall Ruiner was worth it, and while it was an excellent game, it fell a little short in some areas that would've made it perfect.  I recommend buying this game, although perhaps not as wholeheartedly as I would've wished.

Pros:
-combat is exceptionally satisfying and responsive (I love being able to dash, dodge, and shield, get a stun and some sword slashes in)
-aesthetically, the game is gorgeous in every respect (including the gameplay, video cutscenes, and anime-like dialogues)
-character abilities can be easily changed on the fly (which makes for some cool puzzles where you try to figure out what the optimal build is to beat a certain boss or enemy type)
-brutally difficult, even on normal difficulty (I like games that offer enjoyable challenges)

Cons:
-too many badly designed bosses (bosses only had one pattern and many of them felt like an awkward grind; I would've hoped for multi or alternating attack-pattern bosses with weak enemy adds, as that would be more interesting to make use of all the cool skills Ruiner has to offer, for example, some skills depend on you killing a bunch of enemies to proc, while most boss fights were just you vs boss)
-no keyboard remap (I use a dvorak keyboard layout and had to switch to qwerty just to play this game...)
-max game volume too low (compared to the volume of other games and applications)
-no replayability (for such a beautiful and fun to play game, it feels fairly short; honestly, for such a smooth and fun combat system, I would kill for a full on diablo-sized world to keep playing with such satisfying combat)
-no co-op (this game would be really fun if it was an option)

If you liked games like Hyper Light Drifter, Hotline Miami, or Transistor, then you will adore Ruiner.  I'd give Ruiner a 90/100 for being fantastic game, which is high, but just a little more (maybe a DLC for a rogue-like endless dungeon or co-op) or fixing up the cons would make this game near perfect for me.  In any case, I highly recommend you try this game; it's more than worth it!

35274829.review:
So I only played this for an hour before going for that refund, so take what I say with a grain of salt. In that time I was reminded of how elegant and tight in design Hotline Miami and Neon Chrome are - two games which I feel mash together fairly well to form what COULD have been Ruiner.

Where Hotline and Neon are tense, deliberate action-stealth games, Ruiner is a frantic series of combat arenas linked together by moody corridors and a pretty neat hub world. Fans of Hard Games(tm) are going to eat this up because even the tutorial boss - yes, the tutorial - on Normal difficulty was giving me fits. I don't mnd hard games but they must control well...

Ruiner's controls don't feel good. The WASD movement feels awkward. The shooting mechanics and general user feedback is  awful. I couldn't recall any of the early guns having any sense of impact or weight. Aiming is also finnicky and not helped at all by the auto-reload mechanic on the guns. For a game this frenzied I really wished to unload with some satisyfing-feeling weapons but my expectations were quickly destroyed. The wait the mouse aim both rotates your player and shifts the overhead camera is jarring as heck. Feels unnecessary.

I'll hang on to Satellite Reign as my cyberpunk game show piece. And replay Hotline Miami because that has both style and tight gameplay in spades. Ruiner turned out to be a big disapointment. Great cyberpunk atmosphere but rough gameplay and controls.

35272547.review:
RUINER
I would recommend this game, it might be a bit hard to get into first, but after a little while you quickly get the hang of it, but it will still kick your ass at points. I went into this game with no expectations whatsoever, the only thing i really knew is that it was a twin stick shooter and had a cyberpunk setting. Thankfully it proved a very enjoyable experience even if it falls a bit short some places. 

The cyberpunk setting is oozing out of every crack and it is wonderful, it captures that feel like very few other games do, the atmosphere is thick and the soundtrack is incredibly enjoyable. It nails it down incredibly well aesthetically, like I said, it oozes cyberpunk. Each level has its own theme and style to it and getting back to Rengkok South always feels nice.

Gameplay wise it can be a bit cluncky. At times it feels like hits dont register or that you lose health for no reason because the depth can be a little confusing at times and hitting enemies three to four times can be a bit strange at first, especially if you come right from Hotline Miami. Guns dont have a super impactful feel, unless you have something that has incindiary shots, generally it's best to go melee, guns are your back up.

Bosses all have their unique flavour and fit the area they're placed in, most often its a healthy mix between ranged and melee bosses each with their own weakness, some more obvious than others. The first boss you meet for example can easily be defeated if you go up close with melee, the second boss is easier if you go ranged. Not all bosses feel good to fight though, some can be quite annoying or just boring to fight in length because of the extended health bar.

Sadly the Hubworld Rengkok South and its characters are also underused. The games hubworld shines and is very intriguing on the surface, but when you delve down into it you discover that there is not a lot too it, the characters that inhabit this place could be used more and have some more interactions. It's especially sad since you only really visit this area twice, it would seem that the developers planned to have more stuff thrown in here, but maybe had to cut it due to time constraints. Rengkok South could atleast have been used better.

overall it could need some polish here and there, but it's a good game and can scratch your cyberpunk itch. Although do not go in expecting a Hotline Miami clone even though it takes inspiration from it.

35271989.review:
Отличная игра. Очень понравилась.
Драйв, адреналин, мясо, кровища... KILLER COMBO!
Бои динамичны, быстры и требуют реакции - зевать нельзя совсем.

Сеттинг киберпанка передан отлично (так же в дизайне видно влияние аниме), тоталитаризм, мегакорпорации, киберимпланты, провода, разъемы, high tech - low life, блестящие небоскребы для элиты и грязные трущобы для остальных, продажа людей на органы и использование мозгов в качестве вычислительных мощностей. Все тут есть.

Графика очень притяная и аккуратная - и в самой игре и в диалоговых окнах. Персонажи нарисованы очень стильно и запоминаются.

Немного о минусах. 
Первое - русская локализация. Кое-где в тексте встречались ошибки уровня простых опечаток. Пару раз в глаза бросилось. Адаптация некоторых названий и терминов вызывает удивление. На примере городской банды "Creeps" - в русском из обозвали "Калеки". *facepalm*
Видимо кто-то перепутал английские слова "creepy" и "crippled".
В остальном перевод хороший. Переведено все - даже реплики массовки. Можно прсото постоять в городе и почитать ради интереса что говорят прохожие.
Второе - игра хардкорна. Реально хардкорна. Спорный минус, кто-то любит челлендж, и преодолевать трудности, но для такого пиздарукого казуала как я, проходить было чертовски тяжело.
Ну и еще субъективный минусок - игра на мой взгляд коротковата. Хочу еще!

В целом игру настоятельно рекомендую. Она стоит того чтобы её пройти.

35271869.review: Amazing game. Music, gameplay, style - everything is just fantastic.

35271720.review:
[b][i]tl;dr RUINER is an amazing cyberpunk game, with a great soundtrack, fast paced gameplay, and a passable story.[/i][/b]

RUINER captivates you with it's cyberpunk aesthetics from the get-go, while also mesmerising you with it's amazing soundtrack. All important mechanics are presented in the very first level: high stakes, high reflex combat, shoot to kill, dodge to survive. You're also introduced to this world's story, a rather forgetable story, but that's not what everybody's interested in such a game anyway.

[b]The combat[/b] is a great take on the Hotline Miami formula. However, enemies don't outright die in 1 hit, and neither do you (under certain circumstances anyway). There's no shortage of fights, each level presents you with rooms that dish out all sorts of enemies your way (ala 2016 DOOM) that drop weapons and karma, the game's XP system. 
Karma allows you to level up, unlocking new skills or skill upgrades. You can switch skill points on the fly, be it before or during an encounter, at no cost whatsoever, allowing you to approach each encounter in a unique way if you want.
[b]The bosses[/b] are unique, each with a different set of skills, each can be (and should be) approached in different ways.
[b]The gunplay[/b] is smooth and responsive, hitting an enemy with a melee weapon feels satisfying and looks gruesome.
[b]The controls[/b] require some getting used to, especially on M+KB; going "UP" on your keyboard is more "UP-RIGHT" in-game, quick-dodging is directional (if you're going "LEFT" then you quick-dodge "LEFT"). Not a big deal, you should get the hang of it post-tutorial.

Overall, game gets a solid [b]YES[/b], it's got everything you need for a [spoiler]fun[/spoiler] afternoon, while also offering replayability to those that wish to S+ each level.

35268773.review:
[h1] "Если выживешь, увидимся там, где небо встречается с землей"	[/h1]

    Добро пожаловать в 2091 год. Вы некий киборг, который [strike] изойдет на гoвнo	[/strike] сделает все, лишь бы спасти брата. И вот вы отправляетесь в жестокое приключение по миру будущего...
Пройдя эту игру, я получил незабываемые эмоции. Порой мне хотелось кричать, а порой у меня бегали мурашки по коже. Эта игра не для всех, но многим она будет по душе.

[b] Плюсы:	[/b]
[list]
    [*]Геймплей.
Вас встречает большое количество врагов и оружия, только вам решать, как вы будете с ними расправляться.
    [*]Музыка.
Это просто нечто. Она подобрана идеально и дополняет атмосферу. Чего только стоит [u] Sidewalks and Skeletons – Memory	[/u] (Я просто влюбился в этот трек (*~*) )
    [*]Скиллы. 
Огромное количество способностей, которые можно настроить под себя прямо во время боя [strike] , если хватит поинтов	[/strike].
    [*]Сложность.
Я заметил некоторое количество [strike] пусичек	[/strike] казуальщиков в обзорах, для которых игра показалась слишком сложной. Местами в моей комнате пахло гарью, но как я считаю, что на нормальном уровне сложности, затупы бывают только во время боссов (и ближе к концу игры с;).
    [*]Боссы.
Они словно вишенки на торте. Хочу отметить, что к каждому из них нужен свой подход, и порой приходится умереть ни один раз, чтобы их одолеть. [spoiler] Привет от Матери и Киборга.	[/spoiler]
[/list]

[b] Минусы:	[/b]
[u] Из разряда: "Разрешите докопаться и идеальных игор не бывает."	[/u]
[list]
    [*]Мелкие баги.
Встречались всего пару раз за игру, но ничего критично из себя не представляют, а иногда даже помогают ;>. 
[/list]

[b] Под вопросом:	[/b]
[list]
    [*]Продолжительность.
На нормальном уровне сложности прохождение заняло у меня около 8 часов. Вроде не плохо, все таки это не ААА-проект за 2к рубчанских, а обычная индюшка за 419р. Но чего-то не хватает, еще бы 1-2 главы и было бы идеально.
    [*]Сюжет.
Ну тут все совсем неоднозначно. Обещали [b] Мощный сюжет	[/b], а дали достаточно заурядную историю. Сюжет не плохой, но и мощным его назвать нельзя. Вы спросите, [i] "А чо эт тогда он под вопросом, скидывай в минусы игры!!11"
 [/i], но нет, это не минус игры. Сюжет для подобных игр обычно делают для галочки, а тут он тебя ведет по всему пути повествования, жаль что полностью не раскрывает главного героя ;С.
[/list]
    
    [b] Вывод:	[/b]
    Если вы проникнитесь этой игрой, то у вас в голове еще долго будет звучать [i] Её	[/i] голос, вы захотите переслушать саунды и, скорее всего, вернуться в игру снова, чтобы вновь залить Ренгкок кровью.
   
    [h1] 9,8 Puppy из 10	[/h1]

[url=http://iksm-pasta.hatenablog.com/entry/2017/09/29/012601] 詳しいレビューはブログで やってます。 [/url]

[h1] サイバーパンク[/h1]
世界観・音楽ともに良し、街の雰囲気も大変よくできており 街が"生きています"。
ゲーム中に拾う武器も「エネルギー弾」「冷凍銃」「敵を粉々にするレーザー」などなどSFチックなものが多く、ローカライズも違和感ないですし、サイバーパンク作品として申し分ないです。

[h1] 難易度や 操作について[/h1]
このへんは かなり評価が分かれてますが、このゲーム 他の見下ろしSTGと比べて 遮蔽物が少なめな上に戦闘のテンポが早いです。なので「バリア」や「ダッシュ」などのアビリティを駆使して戦うのですが、慣れないうちは苦戦すると思います。（死んでも その地点から すぐ復活できるので そこは心配無用）
私の場合、コツを掴んだ途端、100回やっても倒せなかったボスが 1回で倒せるぐらいには 劇的に成長できたので、"いかにRUINERの戦い方に慣れるか" が重要かと。

「苦手だけど 世界観を楽しみたいんだー！」って人は 難易度イージーがかなり簡単なのでオススメ。

Я понимаю тех, кто ставит палец вниз за жутко неудобное управление, пьющее кровь. Я едва не бросила игру по этой причине. Однако в нём, как и механике схваток, можно разобраться со временем. 

Игре не хватает полировки, встречаются досадные баги, не всегда удачно расставлены точки сохранения. Сюжет - коротенькое эссе на тему интриг, хакеров и мрачного будущего без намёка на оригинальность. Мир игры явно заслуживает большего.

В остальном - очень годно. Ввизуальный стиль и стилистика в целом - на достойном уровне. Саундтрек идеально подходит к происходящему на экране, хотя ничего особенного из себя не представляет.

35264999.review:
Ruiner est un excellent jeu, pas pour tout le monde de part certains choix bien tranchés, mais si vous vous retrouvez dans ce que je vais décrire, vous allez adorer :

- Vous aimez la difficulté. Vous avez fait Hotline Miami une main dans le dos, et vous êtes prêt pour le niveau supérieur. Ruiner est vraiment tendu du slip et mettra vos nerfs à l'épreuve. Le jeu m'a rappelé aussi FURI (les passages en vue de dessus) mais en bien plus speed, bordélique, et vénère.
- Vous aimez les univers dystopiques. Parce que là, celui de Ruiner compte dans les univers Cyberpunk les pires jamais crées. Le scénario est assez classique mais néanmoins réussi.
- Le design global (décors, persos, illustrations...) Cyberpunk est MAGNIFIQUE. Si vous aimez le genre, Ruiner est un must.
- La BO est tout aussi fabuleuse dans un genre industriel électro.

Fini en normal en 5h, je suis bien heureux et ne compte pas refaire un run en difficile (certains passages m'ont bien mis la pression déjà, c'est cool, je suis pas maso !). La BO tournera longtemps chez moi, et je garderais le souvenir de l'un des jeux les plus classes et léché auquel j'ai pu jouer ces dernières années.

NB : Le jeu ne laisse pas encore la possibilité de binder ses touches... Donc si vous avez un clavier AZERTY pensez à prendre un pad. De toutes façons, je pense que le jeu a été crée avec le Pad en tête... Enfin, à vous de voir. Peu importe le controlleur tant que vous vous amusez.

35264149.review:

The controls can be clunky at first, the pace of combat overwhelming, but all in all the style is so well delivered and aesthetically pleasing i don't even care.

35261596.review:
这游戏实在太尼玛好玩啦！画面和音乐不用说，任何一个赛朋粉丝看了都会非常满意，从中能看到《阿基拉》《攻壳机动队》甚至《银翼杀手》的影子。
游戏氛围塑造一级棒：昏暗的未来都市，无处不在打汉字招牌和霓虹灯，各种人机结合的角色，光是这些就够值回票价！而作为一款动作游戏，人物有等级，有技能树（还能无限免费洗点！），各种近战武器和远程武器；打击感不能说非常棒，但是绝对合格！
如果要说不足那就是难度有点大，差不多普通难度就相当于同类游戏困难难度了，如果怕卡关，可以从简单难度玩起；另外手柄操作起来需要一段时间习惯，还有控制射击方向的右摇杆又是子弹时间的技能释放键，经常开枪的时候一不小心就子弹时间了，有点烦。

PS：看到评论有人说游戏中间充满汉字，地名又是东南亚风格，而人物又有很多日本名字，另外人物语音是汉语，韩语，粤语混搭，感觉不太尊重亚洲人民。
这个我想说，首先本来就是赛博朋克风的科幻背景游戏，未来亚洲民族、文化发生融合这不是很正常嘛，本来每个名族的语言都有很多外来借词。而且波兰人做的游戏，能做成这样不错了，你指望别人把中日韩越泰等文化关系分那么清楚，中国又有多少人能把波兰、捷克、白俄罗斯、乌克兰这些国家关系、文化分那么清楚呢？不要说欧洲那么远，估计同为黄种人的东南亚各国文化都没几个人能分的很清楚吧！

35261525.review:
Тащемта, спустя 20 минут распрощался с этой игрой и запросил возврат средств, ибо сложность игры несоразмерна такому кривому управлению и коряво работающим скилам, в том же хотлайне сложность была хотя бы органична. И нет, это не я тормознутое казуалище, это факты - работай всё как следует, возможно игра очень даже и зашла бы. Система активных скилов и отбитый навык перемещения немного не в тему.

Специально для детей, которые налетят и будут забрызгивать всё слюной, аки их мамы прошлым вечером у меня дома (а такие 100% будут) - это моё мнение и коли стим дал мне такую возможность - я его выражаю, если ты с ним не согласен - всегда можешь пройти мимо.
