35259681.review:
Вот и вышла игра, которую я так долго ждал. Главный конкурент вышедшего в сентябре отечественного REDEEMER (так-то обе игры имеют один и тот же движок и в целом похожую механику) Итак, у нас тут (начнем с плюсов, как всегда)
- Шикраная атмосфера темного будущего в стиле киберпанк, где высокотехнологичные небоскребы соседствуют с трущебами, всюду социальное расслоение, а миром правят могущественные корпорации. 
- Просто подтясающий саундтрек. 
- Отличная графика, анимации и дизайн уровней. 
- Широкий арсенал взрывчатки, холодного, огнестрельного и энергетического оружия. Все перечислять смысла нет, одних дробовиков штуки три точно будет (первый- обычный, второй - плазменный, который поджигает врага и третий - стреляющий особой картечью, взрывающейся при контакте с целью). Тоже самое и с автоматами, и с прочими пушками/мечами и т.д. В общем, одинаковых нет, и даже личный пистолет главгероя, тот самый "Ruiner", можно улучшить. 
- Главный герой. Молчаливый наемный убийца-социопат в маске, которую он носит 24/7. Однако, его действия не лишены смысла, так как он хочет спасти брата (а брат за брата, как известно - за основу взято)
- Прокачка персонажа. Причем весьма гибкая. Все получие навыки можно перетасовать в любой момент, в зависимости от ситуации. 
- По-настоящему СТИЛЬНЫЕ противники и МОЩНЫЕ (и не менее стильные) боссы, последние могут здорово надрать задницу главному герою. 
- Так как игра сделана на UE4 (движок-таки для олдскульных, корридорных шутанов) - никаких лагов и фризов. Пойдет даже на средненьком компе. 
- Внутриигровой глоссарий. Про каждый уровень, персонажа, оружие и противников можно почитать в меню паузы.  
Минусы: 
- Я люблю игры с видом сверху (или с изометрической перспективой), но все это действо смотрелось бы невероятно круто с видом от первого лица, но, понятное дело, для маленькой студии, даже состоящих из профессионалов, это почти непосильная задача (или бы мы ждали RUINER лет 5, наверное) 
Вердикт: однозначно брать ! 10 киберрывков из 10.
P.S. Многие говорили, что RUINER это "Hotline Miami с графёном HATRED). Нет, игра куда более интересная с точки зрения тактики, в отличие от Хотлайна и куда более интресная и динамичная, чем черно-белый симулятор маньяка убийцы. Надеюсь, грядущий JUDJE от 10tons (разрабы легендарного Crimsonland и божественной Neon Chrome) так же нас не разочарует. 
P.P.S. Удачи и творческих успехов разработчикам данной игры, спасибо за столь качественный проект.

35259017.review:
EDIT:  Upon completion

The type of game that makes a 10 second fight feel like 10 minute with all the shit that going on at once.

Too all the people who complain about story / repetitive level design I think I can say that this game is probably not for you, but for a Hotline Miami fan who knows what to expect from this type of games, then this is for you.

Good art direction, good OST, story was ok but the meat of this games is the gameplay.
I think the mechanics are solid but could use a bit more polish on some aspects.
Its great that you can respec your character depending on the situation.

My only issues are:
-The gun play felt a bit weightless , I do believe that Hotline Miami did it better or was accurate.
-Bosses need more variations in patterns. I think with the expection of 2 boss fights, everyone was the same. And this becomes a problem in the later levels of the game as you unlock all the skills and can do any boss using only 2 moves. That felt kinda cheap and broke the immersion, so I think some rebalancing or different Ruiner skill setups could have been revised by QA to keep the tension of the game going.

Do Recommend it, and waiting for a Ruiner 2.

35255679.review:
Excellent game so far!

First off, beware of some negative reviews with < 1hr playtimes.  Make sure to look at the reviewer's playtime before taking anything into consideration.  The game opens up early on and some complaints aren't legitimate, or are remedied when you reach a certain point in the game.

-= The good =-

Game runs smooth and no crashes yet.  Amazing art design, atmosphere, sound and music.  The characters ooze cyberpunk.  Story so far is pretty simple, but might open up as time goes on.  The combat is fun, addicting, and rewarding.  There is a feeling of weight to characters and hits.  Once the game truly begins and you reach the skills tutorial, you'll see how the game and gameplay opens up.

The game is very challenging and it's proud of it.  I've found the difficulty (so far) relatable to Hotline Miami.  Yes, you will die a lot at various parts, but I've hit no roadblocks yet and haven't been frustrated.  Example, one boss killed me 15 or so times, then I swapped out my skills and tried a new approach, then beat him the first try.  Beating a difficult area is satisfying and you have enough tools to overcome the obstacles.  The load times are super quick and you're back in action in seconds.  It's meant to be a tough game, which I personally like as I'm not a fan of games that are too easy or hold your hand.  This is an adrenaline fueled game with challenge and fast-pacing.  Keep that in mind.

-= The bad =-

Okay, the keyboard and mouse control is difficult at the moment, and not being able to rebind is unfortunate.  But this will be patched I'm hoping.  I switched to an XBOX360 controller and haven't had any issues.  Controls well, although it does take a good hour to get a feel for it.  I had the same learning curve playing Hotline Miami.  Saying that I'm still having issues aiming guns, but that might be because I don't play many dual-stick games.  The more I play the better I get, but there is a tendency to rely on melee weapons more than guns.  I think this is because 1) it's easier to control and aim the melee weapons and 2) the guns are a bit underpowered.

35255641.review:
很不錯的動作游戲，音樂、動作、環境渲染都是上佳，有些小缺點，瑕不掩瑜。個人評分8/10。

[h1]優點[/h1]
+動作流暢，各種閃現、子彈時間夠炫。
+音樂，不能說抓耳，但是和游戲本身氛圍相當契合。
+賽博朋客的環境渲染得不錯，[strike] 想起了前幾年玩過的shadowrun系列， [/strike]角色立繪也有相當水準。
+故事有好好講，男女主的人格魅力也夠，對於一款動作游戲就足夠了。
+難度適中，嗯，適中，個人覺得至少普通難度并沒有真的很難。基本上每次戰鬥之前都會有自動存檔，死亡也完全沒有懲罰，可以隨便洗點，多試幾次總會打過去的。總不能指望一個這樣氣質的游戲讓玩家一路平砍過去嘛。順帶一提投射護盾或者帶盾撞人必學，能很大的降低難度。
+中文化有用心做。

[h1]缺點[/h1]
-不能自定義按鍵，子彈時間默認是F鍵讓人很難按。
-打擊感不夠，6小時的通關時間，大約有一多半時間都在用近戰武器，但是感覺像是在削空氣，缺少反饋。講真對於動作游戲來説這個問題其實蠻嚴重的。
-游戲開局主角用的是物理學聖劍，擊敗第一個boss之後會換成刀，但是之後所有的過場動畫裏主角拿的還是聖劍，話説既然是劇情送的武器，過場動畫能換過來嘛...强迫症心很痛啊。
[strike] -女主聲音能再萌一點就好了。 [/strike]

35255286.review:
Right up until the final boss, I was tempted to rate this game as "Recommended", even though I had been very inbetween for the vast majority of the game. The final boss, though, just solidified how awful this game handles actual boss battles and shows a shockingly flawed grasp on what makes a boss enjoyable. If I could give a numbered rating, I'd give it a solid 4/10 at best, surely not higher. I'll start with a list before giving any more personal opinions. 

Pros: 
-Base Mechanics are fun
-Melee hits feel heavy
-Gun gameplay gets more satisfying as you play
-Decent abilities to choose from
-Hub area is interesting and lively; bustling with quirky activity

Cons:
-Awful plot that tries way too hard to throw "twists", especially at the end
-The gameplay never changes past the first level
-The Bosses are some of the most boring, worst designed enemies you could hope to never have
-Music often sounds like what one could call "Baby's First Techno"
-Last Boss is the apex of what makes certain video games absolutely horrible, especially when there is an even worse bit of plot to follow
-Only 3 unique bosses, every other one is a copy-paste, carbon copy of the others just with different guns 
-Only 3 changes of scenery; highly repetitive in both looks and gameplay
-Lacks an overall sense of what makes games like this fun(?)
-Heavily uninspired gameplay and abilities, even with the amount of choices

Okay, so with all that out of the way, I want to get into some things that just sadden me about this game. 

   The core gameplay is fun, very basic and nothing new, but fun. Hitting people with a sword or even just your pipe feels solid, a bit forced, but it's still a good feeling to hit someone in the gut and watch the body fly a bit. The guns start off weak with almost no ammo and seem pointless, but gradually get beter as you rank up. The bodies get bloody and it's just a fun bit of killing. The bosses as a whole, which were mentioned a lot in the cons, were what truly killed the game for me. 

   I played the game on hard, but it wasn't the difficulty that made the bosses cancerous, it was the way that after the first real boss, not mini boss, there isn't a single original fight. You have fought every single mini boss, the only changing factor ends up being the guns they weild. By the time you've beaten the first full level, you have seen everything the mini bosses have to offer, along with the grunts. The gameplay no longer changes outside of what abilities you get to spice things up. The game takes this as an excuse to just throw more enemies at you instead of putting in the effort to actually develop new ones. If they don't just shoot, they shield, and if they don't just shoot and shield, they dash. 

   The more I fought bosses, the more my initial euphoria wore off. The game starts you off in an amazing little hub once you're out of  the tutorial, and it is bustling with lively activity! The npcs talk to one another and have actual little stories you can read that progress as you finish levels. It's a fun way of keeping players interested in the world inbetween the killing, and I loved seeing some characters just vanish and watching as their friends/lovers talk about missing them. It's a small set of details that help immerse the player into this fascinating cyberpunk world that you want to know more about...but then you get back to the action, and a mini boss appears. 

MILD SPOILERS AHEAD- NOT PLOT, JUST MECHANICS

   I'm truly stunned at how Devolver, a group that has been around for quite some time, could fail so heavily at grasping the concept, let alone importance of a good boss battle. The first real boss was the only one that was in any way decent, the second, involves quite literally no fighting. You run, then shoot 4 generators to trap the boss, then you just hit him for 5 seconds, rinse and repeat until you kill him. The last boss is by FAR the worst boss I've ever fought in a video game for some of the most absurdly obscene reasons I could have never expected. Angels are enemies that you kill throughout the final level, they take almost no damage to destroy and then just explode. They also, however, spawn enemies, so you want to kill them.

   The game says "Fuck you, player" and makes them invincible simply so that the last boss battle is a pain the ass of tedious repetition with infinitely spawning enemies. It doesn't make the battle dramatic, it doesn't make it a challenge that requires skill to over come, it makes it one of the biggest pain in the ass battles I've experienced in 20 years of playing games. You run in circles, shield from a laser, dodge infinite enemies that rarely drop health, and then shoot in the brief 6 seconds you have to damage the tankiest enemy of the game. Every boss fight in this game is poorly designed with no stages that do the same attack over and over until you win. It never changes, it never progresses. 

   I excused the awful bosses for most of the game, because yes, they sucked about as much as you can before you have a free, failed tech demo on your hands, but the core gameplay was fun. The boss just killed the entire mood for me because it was everything wrong with every boss multiplied by 12. After that, you get an unsatisfying, bland and predictable "Twist" that you can tell they were proud of for no reason what so ever. Not going to spoil that cringe for you though, so I digress. 

   One mini-boss in particular made me realize how awful this game's grasp on fun was. It was an enemy with a rocket launcher, that even at 6 bars of health would kill me in 3 hits, and he fired 2 at a time, then threw grenades. One could argue that you have to adapt to the nature of the game, which in this case, with my upgrades at the time, was simply staying in the middle of the map away from walls and dodging as much as I could, then shooting when his AI pathing broke and he got "confused". It was just a man shooting nearly insta-gibbing rockets and grenades with an obscene amount of health. A challenge is welcomed, it is why I started on hard, but this is not a challenge, it's just an abysmal example of what happens when detached individuals design bosses and don't play test them too. 

   More so to it, it's an example of why putting in less effort truly does make the game lesser. Spending 10 days extra on even just one other type of miniboss would have done teirs of good for this game, because you should never, ever fight every type of mini boss, or as this game called them, "Head hunts" before even beating the first real boss. With enough upgrades at the end, it wasn't even about actually fighting the bosses anymore, it became the same simple mix over and over to beat them in the most sane way possible.
Bring up shield
Ram with shield to stun
Shoot
Bring up shield when unstunned
Ram with shield to stun
Shoot
And then rinse and repeat until the boss finally died. 

 I got this game for myself as a gift, because it came out the day after my birthday and I was deeply excited to play. It was beyond a let down, it was just bad. The bosses drained more and more fun from the game with each one I encountered, and the ending was just beyond wretched. The music of a game like this is one of the most important things you can have outside the actual combat; more so than the world I'd dare say. The music was laughable, especially considering how it never stops playing. The only memorable song was in the Hub world, which I will say was interesting, but not something I'd ever listen to alone. The rest of the music I would prefered to have muted and listened to my own. I didn't do that because sadly, I held onto "Hope", which this game deprives one of quickly. 

   Nothing about this game stood out aside from the Hubworld, the character was deeply interesting at first, but just loses your interest the moment you realize what is happening in this highly forseeable plot. I'd say this game is 10 dollars at best, the end.

35254731.review:
Oct 4th 1.01 patch update: Overall great improvements and steam cards, hell yeah! What I want to focus on however is "Fixed stun exploits on bosses." One of the flaws I mentioned in my original review has been addressed, something that had soured my perception of the game's difficulty. I'm excited to take another stab at the game now and see how I fare. Some basic features you'd expect out of a PC game are still missing (as of this update key mapping, not that I needed it personally) but are mentioned as in the works for next patch, very happy to see the game getting support so rapidly. If you're still on the fence, by the time this game hits its first sale it will absolutely be worth grabbing.

---

Very difficult off the bat (pipe?) when you're first learning the game but as you unlock skills in your tree and weapons to fight with the game's difficulty becomes trivial. Because you can freely reassign skill points the game is encouraging you to experiment with your playstyle but I can assure you the basics given to you off the bat are plenty. Managing your energy and learning how to abuse stuns both melee and ranged will solve the game for you, hint, the Electra might be a little too good. Beginning on Hard I went from getting beat into the floor 100 times by Nerve to S+ scores, dying 0-3 times to any checkpoint encounter by the end, if I felt like it I could even go back and mop the floor with Nerve thanks to the persistent EXP/inventory system where I get to keep all of my unlocks. Although I considered dropping the difficulty near the beginning when I was struggling to even come close to clearing each encounter I'm very glad I stuck with it and learned the hard way. 

Outside of gameplay both the setting and style were great and the performance was perfect without very high specs on my end. Some of the story and interactions were a little lacking, between hitting "yes" or "yes" in conversations or rather "nod" or "crack knuckles" it was a way of cramming exposition with no illusion of player agency. (Which might be forgivable as it could go with a theme in the game as if it were a demonstration of the lack of human will, etc, whatever.)  The game also didn't last very long, there's maybe a dozen stages and each one can take you about an hour if you're still struggling. Playing this game on easy and finishing it once will probably leave you disappointed if you're not in the mood to run it again, but maybe the large skill tree and persistent save will keep you hooked. All in all it was an enjoyable little experience and even at full price I'd consider that fair.

35254505.review:
I wanted to like this game. Everything I saw for it made it look like a cyberpunk Hotline Miami. As it turns out, it's just a twin-stick style corridor runner. You run through samey environments and fight the same bosses over and over again.

Pros
- I think the atmosphere and style of the game are great. I thought the world was interesting and I kept wanting to know more about all the different groups and the city.
- The combat looks smooth and the game has great visuals.

Cons
- The game lacks variety in its environments for how long it is. For the first hour or so, you go around different types of areas and fight different kinds of enemies. After that, you end up in the same metal platform littered with gore and bodies, with sparks flying everywhere. They throw you a red fog every once in a while, but it's all the same.
- You fight the same bosses over and over, and they even make a "clever" joke about fighting an enemy again. In that same fight, you fight the enemy for 3 phases, where nothing changes and you just beat on him some more.
- The game feels inconsistent.
- The different gun types are cool, but guns and most of the skills feel weak compared to just using melee attacks on everything.
- The story is weak, and pulls the "your princess is in another castle" trick to drag the game out even longer.

I really wanted to like this game, but I can't even recommend anyone buy it at full price. Maybe pick it up for $10, but I just didn't have fun after a while.

TL;DR - Stylish game, meh everything else

35254285.review:
Hotline Miami + Cyperpunk + Suda 51 =  Ruiner

It really is. I has Hotline Miami's quick twin-stick shooter action with a very short time to kill, with fast paced tactics. Perhaps a little less feeling of a puzzle to the levels compared to Hotline, but more of an Adventure how you traverse the levels and explore. You'll die often but quickly press R to restart to go back to a very recent checkpoint. The story is very mysterious and dream like and plays out great with a great soundtrack to boot.

It's a punishing game as a bit of a learning curve. The time to kill is a tiny bit slower compared to Hotline, as you have a health bar, but it drops very fast. It could get frustrating at first, as it feels a little harder to avoid damage, until you realise how to use your abilities to the fullest. Which is one more thing that sets it apart from Hotline, a skill tree with abilities you can use. You can only equiped so many at a time, but you can swap them out as much as you want and you will need to. Certain areas in the game will need certain abilities to progress, but not always manditory if you are skilled enough.

35254135.review:
游戏的销量已经证明了这个游戏的素质根本不需要去夸，但是这是一个为了提高难度忽略用户体验的典型代表，需要你花费时间熟悉这个游戏的节奏，当你找到窍门的时候这依然是一款非常好的快节奏动作游戏。
 
写给新玩家的一点小建议：
A)当你打不过的时候你可能该洗个点
B)善用减速屏障和闪光弹的组合，但是要随时留意自己的电池
C)这鬼游戏近战比射击猛太多，但是你要会用的你右键
D)打不中敌人？按住右键瞬移到敌人身边，给他一个闪光弹，然后朝着他放一个减速墙，最后掏出
   你的刀乱刀砍死他，不管他是瞬移小怪，精英还是什么人型BOSS保证管用
E)当你觉得被敌人围住群殴不知所措的时候，按住右键能适当减速让你有时间判断局势
F)这鬼游戏可以洗点！这鬼游戏可以洗点！这鬼游戏可以洗点！重要的事情再次说三遍
G)当你没刀用的时候提前洗点用空投刷出一把！然后在洗回去！尤其是工厂这种满地都是枪
   没有好刀的鬼地方！提前拿出一把好刀或者趁手的武器有时候能让你的体验提升一个层次！没错
   我说的是降低难度！

游戏本身绝对是个好游戏，但是需要你有一定的抖M心态，当习惯以后是很不错的快节奏动作游戏。PS：这游戏的剧情和结局有毒，保证你通关后愣在那然后想掀桌

35253532.review:
Saw trailers for it. The setting and tone of the game drew me in from right off the bat. While I loved playing it, I noticed some typos in dialogue and some minor graphical glitches, though nothing that severely detrimented my gameplay experience. A note: dying in this game is pretty much expected. You will die and, and it will probably happen often. The game minimizes any need for "backtracking" when this occurs, and you start at the beginning of the fight where you died. I'm far from the most patient person, but the fact that I managed to get through this game without rage-quitting says a lot about the care in its design, in my opinion.

+Challenging and rewarding gameplay.
+Amazing soundtrack. Mostly.
+Very fun art style.
+An immersive and interesting world. I was thirsty for all the info on Rengkok City as I could get.
+Incredible atmosphere. A real love letter to the Cyberpunk genre.
+Very reasonably priced at 20$. If you love immersion and want to wring every bit of enjoyment out of the game, a full playthrough can take up to 9 hours if you don't replay sections.
+Runs extremely well on my mid-low end 6 year old desktop, with no frame drops or visual stuttering (mileage may vary).
+When you get used to the game, you'll feel really badass.

~Mindscrewy Gainax-style ending (though this is arguably fitting given the genre).
~I feel like the setting and gameplay have a lot more potential than this game seems to have time/budget to explore.
~Replay value is centered on achievements and personal enjoyment of the gameplay - there seem to be no real major mechanics designed to encourage repeat playthroughs.
~Will be supported later with (presumably) paid DLC.

-Unintuitive default control scheme on M+KB. This is the main source of difficulty early on, which is unfortunate. A few hours of practice will get you into it... if you're not left-handed.
-Building on the above: there are no keybinding/button-mapping options (Devs have said this is coming soon, for what it's worth).
-Limited gameplay tweaks (It'd be nice if you could disable the slow-motion effect on kills. I don't mind it, but others do.)
-Mediocre weapon balance. Winning strategies, generally speaking, are melee-focused in my experience (with very few exceptions).
-Occasionally repetitive tunes. 
-Short. If you speed through the game you could beat it in only a few hours, especially true on easy mode.

All and all, I believe Ruiner marvelously achieves its goals of being a fun-to-play cyberpunk action game. It's very reasonably priced and Reikon (the devs) have said they intend to support this game with patches and DLC in the future. Ultimately, Ruiner is a neat game with a tricky learning curve and a lot of love poured into it.

35253403.review:
[h1]Devolver stan here.[/h1]

I went into this game after seeing a few clips of gameplay from PAX thinking that the combat would be similar to that of Hotline (one shoting enemies, peaking corners to avoid getting one shot yourself).

RUINER almost takes that one shot route if you play on [b]HARD[/b], enemies will do a good chunk of damage and you will need to use your abilities to chip them down with swings of your pipe or gun shots from distance.

With the mention of abilities I currently use a few, not the full skill set even though I have abilities bound to each of the keys. RUINER gives you the option to customize your playstyle, personally I took the tank or I know I'm going to get hurt in each stage I need more health/healing abilities. You could change this type of style to a high damage dealing, quick, mind controlling bad boy, but that's just not my style.

You can always change your abilities if you want to by using the ability wheel (mid-combat even).

Gameplay is just as fast as Hotline, you'll be dashing around blowing up dumb nerds with shotguns point blank. Stunning multiple enemies, then calculating a multi-dash slicing through for some sweet combo-murders.

Soundtrack is great, playing into the second area I can hear similarities to the Hotline soundtracks. Is the soundtrack better than Hotline? I don't think so. If you're bummed out just pop in the Hotline soundtrack, lower in-game music volume to 0% and carry on killing.

I think there is a quick learning curve to this game, the tutorial will not get you ready for the gameplay ahead. And that's fine no one wants to get bogged down with a long tutorial. I began the game on HARD and debated a few times changing the difficulty, during the boss battles. Stuck it out and learned that you're meant to [b]ALWAYS BE DASHING[/b], without doing so you'll soak up shots from goobers with shotguns around the corner.

As you progress your enemies get stronger/more dangerous with more abilities they will seem more similar to you and more difficult to kill. However you will also get stronger as time goes on with you skill set. 

I'm interested to see where this game ends.

If you're on the fence I won't push you over, if you're looking for something similar to Hotline I'm drop kicking you to this side.

В общем начну с того, что на следующий день после релиза я проснулся пораньше и побежал в банк, что бы положить денег на карточку для покупки Ruiner. Не сказать, что я ждал эту игру, но взгляните на launch trailer. Всё ещё сомневаетесь в покупке? Тогда опишу вкратце, что вы получите за смехотворную цену.
1. Отличный слэшер с видом сверху в безумно стильном кибер-панк антураже.
Ламповая стилизация кибер-утопии не оставит никого равнодушным, ну по крайней мере если этот кто-то старше лет 16.
2. Бодрый геймплей наполненный кровью, стрельбой, разнообразными орудиями убийства от водопроводной трубы из нержавейки до ваншотящего молота, от простенького пистолета до огнемёта.
3. Музыкальное сопровождение. Здесь оно к месту, навевает атмосферу при прогулках по городу, разгоняет при ловле оплеух от боссов. Да, не такие бодрые треки как в Hotline Miami... но здесь и антураж другой.
4. Внешний вид персонажей. Ладно ГГ (его мы видели почти во всех роликах, так что к нему привыкли) после встречи с парочкой особей женского пола, можно залипнуть в их спрайт на пару минут просто рассматривая детали. А противники, хей, да они нереально круты.
5. Сюжет. Может основной сюжет и прост, но попробуйте сайд-квесты, словите лулзы на взламывании котов.
5 пунктов для "вкратце" вполне хватит, плюс я тут не один распинаюсь о том какая же это годная игра.

Приятным для меня стало открытием под конец 2017 года-это игра руинер.
Замечательнейший топ даун шутер в атмосфере киберпанка.
В целом все хорошо-играется бодренько,есть прокачка,есть как и возможность уворачиваться и отстреливать супостатов так и возможность крошить врагов в ближнем бою- гибкая прокачка вам в руки.Так же по сюжета нам встречаются разные локации и разные противники,которые атакуют как и толпой так и по одному-ловкие противники и танки с крепкой броней и мощным вооружением.Так же время от времени нас по уровню закрывают на так званых аренах-пока не остреляем всех врагов дальше не пойдем,и ожидаемо для таких игр нас в конце ждет босс.
В плане сюжета и атмосферы все очень хорошо- атмосфера киберпанка кругом,киберпространство,виртуальные сети,громилы наемники,ниндзя с ПП в длинных плащах,искусственные интелекты,заговоры. Так же очень радует и очень прорисованная ХАБ локация между уровнями -есть чем себя занять и с кем поговорить.Каждый персонаж личность и колоритный.Сюжет тоже порадовал,заговоры,твисты в конце и многоходовочки.
Субьективные минуса-при всем колорите персонажей у них нет озвучки,а она б тут очень не помешала бы. Второе игра коротковата- хотелось бы поиграть подольше.И третий минус для такой бурной игры-саундтрек-ну никакой-его нельзя назвать плохим но при этом он вообще не запоминается.
(Так же возможно кого то игра будет раздражать изза всего мерцания,яркости и блюра-но такой он киберпанк и мне лично не мешало)
Итого 9 с 10 очень хороший топ даун шутер с очень хорошей атмосферой.Очень надеюсь что у разработчика и издателя все будет хорошо и в скором времени мы увидим как продолжение или дополнения к самой игре,так и другие проекты от этого разработчика

35250129.review:
Des fois on aime un type de jeux, des fois on se renseigne et se tient au courant sur les derniers jeux de ce genre...

...ici je parle de Twin-Stick Shooter....mais pas seulement...je parle aussi de jeux "Dead&Retry"...

Des fois on tombe par hasard sur un truc un peu tappe à l'oeil mais on à pas le temps, pas l'envie...blazé peut-être de ces paquets de jeux nouveaux qui sortent, promettant toujours "révolutions et renouveau" d'un style...

Des fois on à de vieux souvenirs, de vieilles images en tête...de jeux...mais aussi d'Animes et autres grosses oeuvres de la littérature / du cinéma / de la culture cyberpunk.

Puis là...on se laisse aller à notre petite voix qui dit bas dans nos têtes et nos coeurs: "Miam...regarde celui-là...n'est-ce pas la violence du style de jeux que tu aimes...essayons le!!!"

Et on craque...

Mais...que dire en fait...Ruiner...c'est une putain d'ambiance sonore, visuelle et vidéoludique.

Je suis fan de la bonne cyberpunk qui sent le chrome depuis les premières heures...

Des mangas comme Ghost in the shell, Akira ou Apple Seed...puis le visionage de leurs versions animés...

Prenez ce qui s'est fait de mieux dans ces oeuvres, mixez les...saupoudrez d'un zeste de Blade Runner / Cyberpunk (le jeux de rôle papier).

Et bien...rajoutez à ça une ambiance déjantée, une DA (CellShading) à crever les yeux...Et pourquoi s'arrêter là? Tout est fait pour nous éblouir, le scénario semble bien ficelé, la présentation cinématique est bien vue...il est pas mal optimisé du tout pour tout ce qui s'anime pourtant à l'écran sans faire frémir les fps

On déambule dans des complexes industriels et autres parkings désafectés...on croise du punk...chromé, cybernétisé, et on fight à 200 kms / heure. Ca gicle, les lumières sourdes, rouges ou néons renvoient leurs pâles éclats en quelques flashs, on enchaîne combos, meurtres et explosions...un Combo-meter rythme la mesure de nos exploits. On enchaîne entre exploration, combat en arêne et sourire méchant!

On se balade dans des rues avec une ambiance sale, dans des ruelles désuètes, où des âmes étranges et particulières rôdent. On découvre un monde cyberpunk qui s'impose de suite...


...je m'emballe? Probablement mais Ruiner est de loin une très bonne et très grosse surprise...Si vous avez toujours rêvé de laisser la machine à tuer en vous s'exprimer, faites-vous plaisir. Ce jeux va occuper pas mal de mon temps, de mes yeux...de mon envie d'y retourner.

Prenez ce jeux si vous aimez le genre, le gameplay et l'envie de vous faire du bien!! Et c'est édité par Devolver (ce qui pour moi est toujours garrant de bonnes et incroyables surprises)

Et si par hasard à un moment ou un autre vous souriez béatement en défonçant tout ce qui est là autour de vous et qu isemble hostile...ou si vous souriez en plein "hack" de C.H.A.T.S....c'est que vous avez bien fait de prendre ce jeux ;-)

35250044.review:
Video Review > https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=THJCUa2A2bY

Quite some hype has surrounded the style and aesthetic of this game in marketing and trailers, as well as the main character’s now-famous LED screen mask which displays violent messages, video clips or even anime references. And I have to say that the hype here is deserved. 

This game just oozes style. From it’s comic-style cutscenes with wacky character designs, an emoji-abusing hacker girl and anime-like dialogue sequences to the 1980’s dark action movie lighting and set design. Often entire rooms will be soaked in red from a single flood light, silhouetting the player character and enemies in an ominous glow. It really is gorgeous.

You play a cybernetic masked warrior who is mind-controlled early in the game to become a suicide hitman and then left for dead, but something goes wrong and you’re snapped out of it before you can finish the job by a shocking twist and the help of a seeming friend. Your search for who set you up starts a dark and brooding story to find your imprisoned brother that acts as a backdrop to the plentiful and gratuitous action scenes the game puts you in.

Ruiner doesn’t spend too much time detailing the worldbuilding or reasoning behind the game’s universe. With limited but enjoyable text dialogue and virtually no voice acting (a little odd in contrast to the AAA-quality production values), there are minimal dialogue options from your character, instead it’s hyper-focused on what the game does best: Killing. And lots of it.

Gorgeously high-contrast and colorful visuals combined with a soundtrack is something to behold. Whether it’s abstract vocals over ambient pads in the hub areas or dialogue, the music of the game gets your blood pumping with an array of high-energy electronica. Sometimes it will sound like a lost Nine Inch Nails track from the 1990’s, while others will resemble electro-house music thumping as if timed to your slaughter, to occasionally breaking into synthetic tribal beats like you’re taking part in a blood-soaked rain dance of sorts. It’s just sounds and feels so energetic. It’s catchy, high-energy and gruesome all at the same time.

Frenetic battles leave metallic-plated scenes splattered with blood -- and it strongly resembles Japanese cyberpunk fiction like Akira and Ghost in the Shell. It’s a cyberpunk fan’s dream to witness.

Watching Ruiner’s gameplay for even just a few moments should remind you of 2012’s surprise indie hit, Hotline Miami. And it’s a fair comparison.

Both games have overhead fast-paced and deadly combat where you’re regularly switching between melee and guns. Each weapon has but one clip of ammo, so once you’ve expended that clip the weapon’s gone. So you’re on a constant run from weapon to weapon.

Unlike Hotline Miami though, Ruiner offers a much wider variety of weaponry, and allows for more complex combos and mobility. This game also has two weapon slots: one for melee, one for guns. You’ll always have a basic SMG and pipe melee weapon to fall back on, but pickups are always more powerful.

You can blast guys to pieces with powerful shotguns, roast them alive with flamethrowers, perforate them with fast-shooting machine guns and also pick up brutal melee weapons like fiery maces or deadly katanas that break after a handful of hits.

It’s all very fast-paced, with calculated shots, zooming around the battlefield, trying to get out of the line of fire and in a good place to plow through multiple enemies at once. The game supports both controller and keyboard and mouse and both setups are intuitive, but fast and accurate aiming is key here so in the end the mouse was my preferred tool of justice in the streets of Rengkok.

There are two resources in the game: health and energy. You don’t die in one hit, but you are far from invincible. Much of the game is about lightning reflexes, but nearly an equal amount is about resource management. Killing enemies drop health and energy pickups, and at points helpful drones will drop resources for you as well. You’re going to be using dashes a lot to avoid damage, but you can also use energy to activate your shield which deflects and eventually can reflect projectiles back at your enemies.

The game seems pretty easy even on Normal difficulty early on, but Ruiner has a way of throwing challenge at you in waves. I could clear some segments with an easy S+ Rank, whilst others threw a curveball so hard I had to retry a dozen or more times. Mini-boss battles are usually placed after a checkpoint and a few waves of enemies, so you will often have to replay whole set pieces again and again trying to beat them. But Ruiner is designed with the attention-deficit in mind. Every cutscene and death screen has a big red skip button right there waiting to be pressed, so you’re always back in the action sometimes before you realize it yourself.

Not all Ruiner’s depth is apparent at first, but as you level up and start unlocking more advanced techniques. The amount of fighting styles become apparent. You can plot and chain multiple dashes together to quickly get to an enemy, drop a grenade, then get to cover. Or circle strafe with shotgun blasts and SMGs. You can enable shields then dash for a charge attack. Or zip around to hit the vulnerable side of shielded foes.

There’s a lot of variety here which inspires experimentation, especially on Hard mode. The actual boss battles are more akin to Diablo III though, in closed arenas, with AI patterns that switch up after a quota of damage has been met. Though unlike normal combat, these fights seem to prefer one style over others. The charged up melee attacks seem to deliver the damage over whittling them down with bullets.

Due to the more forgiving but still visceral combat mechanics with a slick, modern graphics style and difficulty options, I believe Ruiner could have a much wider appeal than Hotline Miami’s relentless twitch gameplay. It doesn’t have as much of a puzzle game feel as Hotline, but it doesn’t throw as many cheap and instant deaths at you either. Each fight has specific enemies that spawn in specific places each time, so eventually you can learn the pattern and take them all out methodically like a prophetic bad-ass if you replay the segment enough times.

Ruiner has a skill progression system with shield upgrades, ammo boosts, increasing the durability of melee weapons, and active abilities such as stun splash damage, grenades and more. There’s a lot of options to upgrade and unlock, and these upgrades seem like a must to tackle the higher difficulty settings.

There is a between-mission hub world which feels like a really simplified Deus Ex. You’re not going to be doing any complex missions here and despite its interesting and beautifully rendered vistas it’s pretty basic and feels like an afterthought. There are minor objectives during combat missions that finish quests started in the downtown hub, and there are other minor activities like hacking into cats… it’s a long story. A little underdeveloped here, sure. But it doesn’t negatively impact the rest of the game.

Depending on how much you like replaying games or what difficulty you normally play on, a playthrough of all 14 levels of Ruiner could take you about 6-10 hours the first run, and I feel the $20 US price tag is just right for the quality and content you get out of it.

Like Hotline Miami before it, Ruiner is one of those rare games where the tightness of gameplay and controls, the sheer brutality and energy of the hyper-stylized graphics and heart-pumping music just come together in moments perfectly that remind me of why I love video games. It doesn’t have deep roleplaying or Hugo award-winning storyline. But its exciting and engaging fast-paced combat with some interesting world exploration in-between will leave you chomping at the bit for more.

35248553.review: Very Fun and Fast Paced, Action Packed, Hardcore.

35248436.review:
Controls, movement and the difficulty take some serious getting used to, and evidently, it won't be for everyone. 

The gameplay is where RUINER shines the most. The variety of skills (that you can respec at any time) make the game more interesting, not just because you are trying out new styles of play, but I found it almost necessary to change to tackle certain bosses (which in turn made me better at the game). There is a really good array of weapons you can use that drop from enemies, a weapon grinder that drops after you beat a level, and weapon lockers that you can hack. To go along with all these weapons, RUINER has plenty of enemy types that will test you in a multiude of ways. 

RUINER does however fall short in some places that can't be overlooked. Firstly, I felt the lack of voice acting hurt the story a fair amount and prevented me from really caring about the characters. Without it, the story is still fine, but voice acting could have complemented the relentess action that makes up most of the game. 'Rengkok South' which is essentially a mini hub world that looks great, is limited due to how you interact with NPC's. You can't enter the buildings, you just initiate some dialogue. It's a real shame because from a design perspective, the world that's been created looks brilliant, and by that I mean the best cyberpunk world I've ever seen in a game.  

The music was also a bit of a mixed bag for me. There are some great tracks, but other parts just didn't do much for me. The sound effects for weapons and guns were all satisfying however, and it majorly enhances the action, while also making enemies easily identifable while off-screen. 

TL;DR:

Look, if you liked Hotline Miami and/or Hyper Light Drifter, this is right up your alley and you should buy this. It is just worth noting that, yes, the game does look great (no doubt due to being made in UE4) but don't let that fool you. The game is pretty damn hard, and I'm reiterating this for good reason. The price is reasonable, but it doesn't feel like the game has too much to offer in terms of replayability. So, if you're on the fence, I would advise waiting for it to go on sale.

I ended up refunding this.

The game looks great. Though I think it leans towards style over substance. The animation is very floaty and the guns feel and handle like pop toys.

I might pick this up on sale, but for now it just didn't feel like it was worth the asking price.

35244869.review:
사이버 펑크적인 맵의 분위기 좋고, 슬로우모션과 빠른 진행이 교차하는 전투도 마음에 든다.
극초반 튜토리얼 부분을 넘기고나면 스킬포인트를 통해서 캐릭터를 강화시킬 수 있다.
찍을 수 있는 스킬의 양은 많아서 취향껏 찍으면 되며, 노코스트로 자유롭게 바꿀 수 있다.
체크포인트가 대단히 세분화되어있어서 막히는 부분이 있다면 스킬을 이것저것 바꿔보고,
플레이방식에 변화를 주다보면, 어떻게든 깨지더라. 덕분에 난이도는 다른 하드한 종류에 비해서 어렵지는 않은거 같음.
맵도 대단히 선형적인 구조다. 길따라 가기만 하면 몹도, 보스몹도, 필요한 것들도 있다.
숨겨진 것들이 있기는 하지만, 그것을 찾지 않는다고 해서 게임을 즐기는 것에 불편함은 없다.

그렇지만 이 게임이 만족스러운건 아니였다.

터무니없이 부족한 볼륨. 주차장의 크립들 뚜드려팰때까지만 좋았다.
10레벨 가량의 맵들은 매번 똑같은 곳을 반복해서 지나가고 있는 것 같다. 특징이 없음.
중반 이후의 보스몹들은 죄다 돌려막기. 모델링이랑 이름이라도 달리해주면 좋았겠지만,
죄다 천사 천사 천사 헤비사이보그 헤비사이보그 헤비사이보그...
일반몹들도 모델링이랑 수치만 바꿔놓고, 달라지는 특징은 하나도 없다.
이런 류의 게임은 보스건 잡몹이건간에 약점을 알아내고, 그에 맞는 돌파구를 찾아 공략하는 것이 목적이 되어야할텐데,
나는 우클릭대쉬 근접공격 딱 이것들로만 다 뚜드려팻다.
게임을 얼마나 진행하든지, 맵이건, 보스몹이건, 일반몹이건 변화가 없는 덕분에 지루해서 빨리 엔딩보고 끄고 싶었다.

무엇보다 아쉬웠던건 매력적인 배경을 수박 겉핥기 식으로 지나갔다는 것.
보통 이런 종류의 게임은 NPC와의 대화, 그리고 적절한 연출을 통해서 자연스럽게 몰입도를 증가시켜야 하는데
연출은 전혀 없고 NPC와의 대화는...
NPC들과 말을 걸어도 너는 저 말을 해라 나는 이말을 하겠다 식이다.
주인공이 NPC앞에서 고개를 끄덕이건 어깨를 으쓱하건 무시하건, 고개를 돌리건, NPC들은 지 할말만 한다.
이럴거면 선택지를 왜만들었는지 모르겠다.

유일한 마을이라고 할 수 있는 렝콕 남부에서 보여주는 모습은 주인공이 한 일에 따라서 마을에 조금씩 변화가 생긴다.
지나가는 NPC들의 대화가 시간이 지남에 따라 점차 바뀌는데, 이것으론 이 매력적인 배경을 느끼기엔 너무 불충분하다.
나는 이들이 살아가는 모습들을 더욱 알고싶은데, 얘들은 그것들을 설명해주지 않는다.
"너무 우울해... 난 이제 포기했어..." 이런 배경과는 관련없이 단순히 지 기분만 표현하는 대사만 할 뿐이다.
특히나, 배경에서 가장 중요한 '헤븐'과 이들이 만든 '가상현실'에 대한 설명또한 너무도 부족하다.
이것이 배경 속에서 일정 수준 이상의 역할을 맡았고, 때문에 사전에 더 많은 설명이 필요했다.
배경에 등장하는 많은 부분들은 단지 주인공의 일지에 기록되어있고, 플레이어는 그것들을 일일히 읽어봐야한다.
자연스럽게 게임 내에 표현하지 못하면, 몰입도는 떨어질 뿐이다.
분위기가 중요한 이 게임에 몰입도가 떨어지면, 흥미또한 마찬가지로 떨어질 뿐이다.

그리고 대망의 엔딩... 허무할 뿐이다. 이 엔딩을 위해서 여기까지 달려왔나 싶을 정도.

분명히 재밌는 게임이였고, 더 재미있을 수 있는 게임인데, 아쉬움이 더 컸다.
그렇기 때문에 아쉬웠던 점들을 하나둘 모아보니 장문의 글이 되어버렸다.
관심있게 기다렸던 게임인데, 결과물을 보니 실망감은 배로 커진거 같다.

35244766.review: Fun game, very nice art style and cool music!

35244581.review:
If you're looking for a game with a strong cyberpunk theme, this one's right up there with Satellite Reign. The hub and levels are extremely well done--so well, in fact, I'm surprised the game sold for $20 on release.

When it comes to gameplay, I was expecting something like Diablo, but it's more like Hotline Miami. In my old age I prefer turn-based games that don't require twitchy skills, but the cyberpunk theme in this one is so strong that it drew me in.

When I started the game I chose Normal difficulty, and as soon as I realized how fast everything moves I immediately dialed it down to Easy, which is all the difficulty I need. Even on Easy, I rarely clear a room without dying at least once.

I'm not much of a fan of twitchy, fast-moving games, but I have to tip my hat to this one.

35244411.review:

35244294.review:
Update: Wer sich einen Eindruck machen will, darf gern bei mir reinschauen :)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MY1WwCA2Rr0&list=PLio4F_5RbmFzozzsa__uFQI7EFrYdg-ag&index=1
Update²: Ich kann das Spiel leider doch nicht mehr empfehlen, gründe gibt es unten unter cons!


Absolute Spitzenklasse! Für alle Fans von Cyberpunk Settings ein großes muss, denn es wird nicht nur stumpf geballert nein - es gibt eine richtige Story und auch Momente zwischen den Kämpfen, wie beispielweise eine große Stadt die es zu erkunden gilt mit liebevollen Details und ansprechbaren Personen an jeder Ecke. Gerade das gibt dem Spiel den nötigen Charisma um mehr als nur ein Hack'n'Slay / Topdown Shooter zu sein. Wo das ganze hinführt weiß ich natürlich noch nicht aber was ich weiß ist, dass ich jetzt schon wahnsinnig begeistert bin!

Pros
- Super Steuerung mit Maus und Tastatur (WSAD für die Bewegungen, Maus für die Drehungen)
- Gute Performance
- Sehr gute deutsche Übersetzung, bisher nicht nur fehlerfrei sondern auch wirklich gut geschriebene Texte!
- Großartiges Menüdesign. Alles ist klar und simpel und trotzdem schön und charakteristisch

- Schwierigkeitsgrad auf "Hoch" sehr fordernd, wenn man wirklich eine Herausforderung haben will (Ich bin bis ich den ersten Boss erledigt habe 60 mal gestorben *hust*)
- Kampfsystem macht riesigen Spaß und spielt sich sehr dynamisch und flott, vor allem aber technisch absolut ausgreift!
- Es gibt eine Reihe von Skills um seinen Kampfstil zu individualisieren, ohne dabei zu viel zu sein, und es lässt sich jederzeit umskillen, d.h. unnötiges "verskillen und neuanfangen" fällt weg - super!
- Extrem geiler Soundtrack
- Sehr schöner Zeichenstil (Figurenportraits in Dialogen oder Einleitungen)
- Es gibt eine große Stadt die so gesehen die "Basis" zu sein scheint in die man immer wieder wiederkehrt bzw. wo man sich zwischen den Missionen aufhält. Das gibt dem ganzen Spiel viel mehr Tiefe und Charakter, als wenn man sich nur durch Level kloppen würde


Cons
- Manchmal schlechte Savepoints, beispielweise 7 normale Gegner vor einem Boss, wenn man beim Boss stirbt, muss man diese kleinen Gegner jedes mal von vorn erledigen
- Bosse sind am Anfang noch toll und abwechslungsreich, doch dann wirft das Spiel mit Bossen nur um sich und setzt mehr auf Quantität als auf Qualität. Unterscheiden tun die sich dann nicht mehr wirklich voneinander, dafür nervt umso mehr, dass man auch noch manche Bosse mehrfach erledigen muss., weil sie auch recycled werden.
- Ab der Hälfte des Spiels hat man alle Skills mal gesehen und ausprobiert und der Spielspaß vom Kampfsystem fällt etwas zurück, vor allem auch weil die Gegner nicht abwechslungsreicher werden. Hier hätte es dringend neue Gameplay-Elemente (Rätsel usw.) gebraucht, um Abwechslung zu schaffen. 
- Die Story entpuppt sich am Ende als relativ nichtssagend, nicht zuende gedacht und ist ziemlich unbefriedigend. 
- Das Spiel wirkt generell so, als wenn die Entwickler ab der Hälfte die Muse verloren und angefangen haben, diverse Elemente zu recyclen. Es gibt wirklich qualitativ große Unterschied zwischen beiden Spielhälften. 

Daher kann ich nach dem durchspielen das Spiel leider doch nicht weiterempfehlen. :/

期待しすぎると肩透かしを食らうでしょう。

サイバーパンク好きなら絶対おすすめ。
そうでない人にはソコソコのアクションゲーム。
私は後者なのでおすすめはしませんが良いゲームだと思います。

35243482.review:
This game absolutely BLEEDS atmosphere. It is a fantastic contribution to the cyberpunk genre, which I think it's plain to see, is seeing a resurgence. It's also pretty obvious how much inspiration it took from anime of the 80s, like Akira. Well, Akira, Ghost In The Shell, Alien, etc..All of it coming together to form a very beautiful baby, indeed. The kind of baby where you genuinely go "Aww, look at that" without thinking "I mean..It's a baby. They all look the same." Now, I suppose you're wondering to yourself "Hey, this is like a cyberpunk Hotline Miami". Stop right there. Just stop. Gaming journalism CONSISTENTLY writes articles saying "CHECK OUT THIS INCREDIBLE DARK SOULS-TYPE GAME", or "This game has rogue-like elements like FTL". And it's ridiculous.

Ruiner is..As best as I can describe, a twin shooter that is very difficult, and incredibly fast paced. I've honestly haven't experienced such fast paced gameplay since I played Doom. It also has the elements of your typical "bullet-hell" game, but it gives you a plethora of tools at your disposal like dashing, deflecting bullets, super-charged melee strikes, etc to make sure you're not riddled with bullets every three seconds..As well as many fun weapons like a giant flamethrower or freeze cannon. The soundtrack is amazing and it wants to pull you into this beautiful and bleak world where your brain is taken on a joyride, like a character in Ghost In The Shell. My favorite part, however, are the visuals..The style..The grime. The neon. The game does atmosphere well.

My only gripe, which hasn't prevented me from enjoying Ruiner, is that the weapons don't have much "oomph" to them..Which is a shame, considering the weapon variety. I haven't finished it yet, because I chose the hard difficulty, but some people report finishing it in 10 hours? That's kind of a bummer. Only because I do not want to stop living in this world. I really hope Reikon Games adds different modes or expansions.

Just buy it. It's $20. It's the same price as really good takeout pizza, but better. This pizza melts in your mouth.

Also, BUY THE SOUNDTRACK.

35243396.review:
RUINER is brutal, fast and extremely satisfying.

Things I liked a lot:
The visual atmosphere of the game is incredibly beautiful, mixing 3D scenes with 2D sketches and portraits.
The music is as cyberpunk as the graphics and blends well with the gameplay giving a lot of rythm.

Combat is hard but rewarding. The visual effects are very pleasing even if you might lose your character in the profusion of particles.
The variety of weapons and skills allows for good combo and on-the-spot decision making.
Swaping skills from one fight to another is easy and encouraged.

Things I didn't like:
At the moment it is not possible to customize the keybindings.
Some color filters are a bit too bright (some red scenes can hurt your eyes)
The visual feedback when you get hit is pretty hard to see
I was not able to fully understand why my weapons went from tickling the boss to shreding him to pieces and I think the game will need some balancing patches.

35243200.review:
[h1]Ruiner - Recensione [/h1]

Non addolciremo in alcun modo la pillola: [b]Ruiner è un’esperienza frenetica, psichedelica, violenta, coinvolgente e unica. [/b] [i]Reikon Games[/i] ha confezionato un titolo che sa essere intenso, breve e brutale come un giro su una montagna russa sotto gli effetti di sostanze psicotrope. Le viscere di Rengkok sono un labirinto di metallo e sangue che va affrontato e vinto, proiettile dopo proiettile, colpo dopo colpo.
[b]Devolver Digital ci ha portato un’altra piccola perla,[/b] un titolo che va giocato assolutamente da tutti gli amanti del cyberpunk e dei top down shooter più in generale. Peccato per l’assenza di doppiaggio e per la mancata localizzazione italiana; siamo comunque sicuri che questi piccoli ostacoli non fermeranno i più smaliziati fra noi dal godersi un gioco davvero sui generis e sopra le righe. Non possiamo che sperare che Reikon Games abbia già pensato ad un sequel, perché non vediamo l’ora di tornare fra le strade sudice e dai toni cremisi di Rengkok.

Think, cyberpunk hotline miami, with the "puzzle" knob turned down, and the "relentless" knob turned up. I'm only five hours in but I played that all in one sitting and have been having a blast.

35241418.review:
I wanted to love this Game. I love TwinStick action and im a Cyberpunk fan to the death.

Sadly, i cant recommend it to either hardcore Cyberpunk fans OR Twinstick action fans.

Why?

The Cyberpunk:
-It can look gorgeous. The scoring fizzling in over the screen, the fonts all of it feels right. It falls short on the deeper end. There is no real heft to the world, Rengkok is too clean, too lean and not tech enough. It doesnt go beneath the pumped up street trash, corporate thug and cyberpsycho cliché while omitting the sex and the drugs entirely. The ingame cutscenes also are awkard too often.

The TwinStick:
The control scheme feels awful on Keyboard and Gamepad. Your view is fixed into one direction unless you move RS or Mouse, the audioscape is a mushed mess with little to no feedback as is the effects and Interface.

Gameplaywise its pretty apparent that it didnt play out as intended. Slowmo is controlled by the campaign, the almost 180° arc melee swipe is compensating for the obfuse collision and timings. Damage is horrible on Hard and Medium with guns, including Shotguns feeling useless. The powers are way to clunky and awkard to handle.

Make up your own mind, but for the hardcore cyberpunk fan and hardcore twinstick fan i can clearly state: Save yourself another disappointment.

Because they *almost* got it right. :/

35240112.review:
Вот и он- Ruiner!!!! KILL YOU KILL YOU KILL YOU!!!!!

Эдакий Хотлайн Майами в стиле киберпанк с "хабом" и локациями. Хаб- место основного пребывания для квестов и ЛОРа игры- общение с местными, сайд квесты, мир игры. Пусть и небольшая, но проработанная, и очень хочется войти во все здания, пообщаться со всеми, выполнить больше квестов, спасти кого-нибудь, хоть чуть-чуть!!! Жаль большинство служит лишь декором, но красивым и... значимым что ли. Без этого игра бы выглядела безжизненной, а тут- гетто в лучших традициях киберпанка.
Что косательно сюжета- он есть и весьма неплох. Пусть и подается маленькими дозами, начиная с завязки, заканчивая развязкой... но очень сочно. Возможно вы и сами в процессе будете осознавать что к чему и какие карты в рукаве у Ruiner, но оно и неплохо. 

По геймплею... надо сказать о минусах в первую очередь. Это то, что бросится в глаза в первые секунды игры. Игра с камерой помещена диагонально, а управление оставлено вертикально-горизонтальным. То есть ваши движения- это движения по прямым в диагоналях: жмете влево- идет на северо-завпад, вверх- северо-восток... и т.д.  Это жутко неудобно в многих ситуациях и уклоняться становится чуть сложней. Однако из-за непривычки первый этап на нормальной сложности может оказаться непроходим т.к. порог вхождения в игру крайне высок. Я переключил сложность на легкую уже со встречи с Боссом после 10 смертей. Сейчас, уже после прохождения игры, я знаю- я бы сейчас прошел и, возможно, даже не поранился. Однако... игра предоставляет достаточно развлечения и челенджа даже на легком уровне, чтобы вы получали удовольствие и не полыхали в одном месте. 
Что про плюсы? ... Их достаточно много. Начиная с развития способностей (их около 7-10), где каждая улучшается (от 2 до 6... примерно), до разнообразия оружия. Оно делится на холодное и огнестрельное; в свою очередь холодное на двуручное и одноручное- отличие в силе урона, скорости атаки и спец ударе за энергию; огнестрельное же на пули и энергию. В любом случае, все, что вы подбираете, кроме "сюжетных предметов", заканчивается- ломается или просто боеприпасы уходят в тела врагов... ну или в азоновый слой.
Благодаря развитию способностей персонаж действительно преображается из куклы для битья в машину для убийства- замедления, контроль разума, щиты, гранаты, стрейфы... ах... я сильно полюбил рукопашную атаку с стрейфом, мне хотелось продолжать и продолжать. Вообще, я начал играть в нее глубокой ночью после сна и хотел лишь оценить- стоит она 419р, которые я вернул за Tooth and tails (вроде так называется) и... осознал спустя 4+ часа, что время уже 7 утра, а я остановился примерно посреди этапа... Ну ладно, продолжу потом. И игра заботливо поместила моего персонажа на ближайший чекпоинт- не пришлось после перепроходить этап полностью.  И да, я заметил лишь пару- тройку багов, которые не сильно сказываются на игре (на достижении может сказаться баг с пропажей HUD, где все индикаторы пропадают или когда не сработал скрипт в финальной битве и враги не появились), но это решается перезапуском этапа или смертью.
Что хочу сказать- приятная графика, изобилие спецефектов, к которым привыкаешь спустя минут 20 игры и начинаешь понимать- где твой персонаж, а где вражеские пули; сочный геймплей; достойный для подобного слешера сюжет и низкая цена. За подобный проект кто-то мог запросить 800+ рублей и он бы того стоил! Однако предупредить будет не лишним- порой будет бесить выскакивающие "скримеры" с приказами, оповещением во весь экран- то и дело моргают, что действует чуть ли не как эпилепсически- и это перебор. Но благо пропадает уже после прохождения обучения и все становится плавным и приятным. Также это объяснится ЛОРом сразу после обучения.
Я игру настоятельно рекомендую, особенно любителям Хотлайн М; но уверен, что и среди других найдутся поклонники.
P.S. Что бы я хотел в этой игре?... Во-первых ей бы не помешало больше персонажей и квестов внутри хаба; во-вторых- кастомизация одежды, хотя бы по цвету... ибо ее нет от слова СОВСЕМ (но не критично, перс выглядит стильно). В-третьих- еще больше сюжета и всяких книжец, плакатов и разговоров с нпс (да, нпс есть и они часто болтают, но хотелось бы более сильного погружения в их мир). В-четвертых... как бы это странно не читалось... ДЛЦ. Я. ХОЧУ. ДЛЦ.
Игра это позволяет и это пошло бы на пользу, и... я бы точно его купил.
P.P.S. Совсем забыл о музыке- да, она играет на фоне и задает ритм, но я ни разу не ловил себя на мысле, что она мне нравится или нет, что я вслушиваюсь в нее или что-то такое. Да есть и не раздражает- и на том спасибо ;)

35239758.review:
아직 초반부 진행했을 뿐이지만 충분히 좋은 게임인 것 같아 추천해봅니다. 

우선 일러나 영상에서 볼 수 있듯 스타일에서 굉장히 강점을 보이는 게임입니다. 장르계 스타일 끝판왕이라 볼 수 있는 사이버펑크를 차용한데서 알 수 있듯이 색감, 분위기, 음악 어디 하나 빠지는 구석이 없으며 게임플레이에서 조차도 스타일리쉬함을 느낄 수 있었습니다. 

게임 내용이나 설정 측면에서 보자면 역시나 장르를 충실히 따르고 있으며 현재 제가 플레이중인 초반부에서 음모를 쫓는 스토리가 진행되는데 제법 흥미를 자아내는 편입니다.

가장 중요한 게임플레이에 대해서는 먼저 제가 요런 시점의 게임(탑 다운 액션 슈터?)을 엄청 못한다는 걸 말씀 드리며 같은 배급사에서 출시한 게임 엔터 더 건전과 비교해보겠습니다. 엔터 더 건전은 상하좌우 이동, 구르기, 쏘기 등의 간단한 조작을 요구하며 이런 기본 조작만 숙달하면 게임을 클리어(가능한가?) 할 수 있습니다. 루이너는 거기에 더해 기절 폭탄, 방어막, 대쉬등의 스킬 시스템이 추가되어 좀 더 다양한 플레이를 할 수 있다는게 차이점이죠. 두 게임 모두 저한테는 어려워서 클리어 하기 힘든건 마찬가지지만 엔터 더 건전은 플레이하다가 캐릭터가 죽을때 "나는 왜 저런것도 못피하지" 하는 좌절감이 드는 반면, 루이너는 겜하다가 막히더라도 다른 방법을 시도해 볼 수 있고 혹은 자신에게 맞는 방법을 찾아 게임을 능히 클리어 할 수도 있다고 생각됩니다. 피지컬이 딸려 대쉬로 적들의 총탄을 피하는데 힘이 부치더라도 방어막으로 비벼볼 수 있는 것이죠. 절대 제가 엔터 더 건젼 진행이 전혀 안돼서 이런 글을 쓰는게 아닙니다. (ㅂㄷㅂㄷ)

보다 더 게임플레이에 대해 알고 싶으시다면 관련 영상들을 찾아보시면 좋을 것 같습니다.

주의할 점은 게임 가격으로 보나 현재 게임의 스토리 진행 페이스를 보나 게임 플레이 시간이 조금 짧을 것으로 예상되는 점과, 게임이 어렵다는(제 기준으로) 점입니다.

아무튼 대충 결론은 블레이드 런너 같은 sf영화의 비쥬얼이나 아키라와 같은 세기말 배경의 일본 만화의 팬(틀딱)이신 분들에게 어필할 수 있는 게임이지 않을까 생각합니다. 아이고 글 쓰기 힘들다

35238138.review:
Прошел на легом уровне сложности. Заняло все примерно 7 часов. Теперь запилю краткий отчет.

[h1] Плюсы: [/h1]

1. Дизайн и стиль. Дух киберпанка присутствует здесь. Неоновые огни, корпорации, шпионаж, секреты, импланты, люди-расходники, гигантские заводы, наемники, у которых от человека осталось всего ничего... 

2. Музыка. Музон просто чумовой, позволяет окунуться в атмосферу и является неотъемлимой частью самой игры! Саундтрек, на мой взгляд, строго рекомендован к покупке! 

3. Геймплей. Экшн. Злой, динамичный, не прощающий ошибок. В углу не отсидеться, аптечек нет(на самом деле есть, но их ооочень мало), кемперить негде, только вперед! Убей их всех, пока не убили тебя! Принцип игры: небольшие/большие арены, на которые вываливают пачки врагов разной степени прочности. Зачистил, отправился дальше.
Игра поощряет за внимательность дополнительными бонусами ввиде помощи в бою, оружием, опытом. Разнообразного огнестрельного оружия примерно 20-25 наименований, и десяток холодного. Довольно развитое дерево различных скиллов, есть, где развернуться. 

Все изучить не дадут, на счет НГ+ не знаю, еще не пробовал, но при первом прохождении смог полностью прокачать только 3,5 ветки. Весомое достоинство в том, что скилы можно мгновенно обнулить и вкачать в другую ветку при необходимости. Куча разных боссов, различных врагов, что приводит к необходимости менять тактику на лету. 
Также хочу отметить, что чекпоинты расставленны щедро, максимальное наказание за ошибку - снижение рейтинга и зачстка комнаты заново. 

Вот еще! Есть небольшая энциклопедия с Лором!

4. Русский язык сразу. Считаю, что для маленькой компании это однозначно плюс. О нас позаботились, приятно.

5. Цена. 400р - по божески, а 170р за саундтрек не жалко абсолютно.

6. Оптимизацию завезли. Почему-то последнее время редко какая игра "из коробки" работает без тормозов и багов. Но это не про RUINER! Все летает на максимуме, и пофиг на взрывы и количество персонажей!

[h1] Минусы: [/h1]

1. Сюжет. Обычно, сюжет в произведениях является клеем, собирающим повествование и происходящее на экране в красивый монолит, здесь он скорее как жидкая кашица. Причем уже кем-то перевареная.
За кого играем? - А X3, за чушку немую. 
Чего хочет ГГ? - А X3, [spoiler] Братишку типа спасти, что уже было в других играх сотни раз, предсказуемо.[/spoiler]
Кто эти Боссы, какая у них мотивация? - А X3, их задача рявкнуть пару строк и быстренько полечь.
А кто эти герои, которые помогают ГГ? - А X3, пара картинок и пара строчек.
Может есть относительная свобода, выборы там моральные и тд? - Не-а, строго по рельсам. Так победим!
Может развязка эпичная? - Не-а, пресно, банально и предсказуемо.
А на вопросы по игре в конце ответят? - Так, сотрите этому зануде память! Ответы ему...

2. Геймплей. Собственно, разрабы прямо носом тыкают в тактику Blink-to-Win, что является диким таким косяком. Потому что выбирая иную тактику/умения ты неизбежно будешь сливать. Или по здоровью, или сперва по энергии, а затем по здоровью и гейм овер! Убивают быстро, при неверной тактике буквально за пару секунд. Кроме того многие умения вообще не понравились, особенно необходимость их переключать в бою. Считаю, что нужен ребаланс! 
Игра абсолютно недружелюбна к новичкам и медленно соображающим (мне даже пришлось в прологе снизить сложность), зевнул, применил не то умение - заново! Когда сливаешь раз 30, причем в течении 10 секунд, это начинает выбешивать. 
Уважаемые Разработчики! В 2017 году делать героя мгновенно смертным от одного удара некоторых противников, в частности боссов - дурной тон. Особенно на фоне периодического непонимания, что конкретно нужно делать. [spoiler] Чушку с лазерным лучом люто возненавидел после 40+ попыток [/spoiler]

3. Управление. Собственно, к перемещению ГГ привык сразу, но так и не смог привыкнуть к необходимости играть на кавиатуре как на рояле. Три умения, каждое надо зажимать, указывать и тд. Громоздко, неудобно и раздражает. Механика того же Блинка интересна, но реализация кривая. Вместо наслаждения экшеном нон-стоп, выцеливаешь точку куда тебе разрешат прыгнуть. А тебя в это время шинкуют. Бред.

4. Ачивки вообще позорные. Особенно из серии "соверши действие 100000 раз".

[h1] ИТОГ: [/h1]

Не смотря на мое старческое брюзжание, игра понравилась, Не уверен, что буду проходить еще раз, но свою порцию удовольствия я получил. Если не требуется сюжет и хочется экшона (пусть и с оговорками), это ваш выбор!

Всем спасибо!

35237103.review:
Let me start off saying RUINER is not a type of game I would normally play. Twin stick shooters generally are really simple and not often too fast. Ruiner decides to throw away both of those normal twin stick gameplay styles, and creates a very fast game with lots of abilities to vary up combat.

RUINER is also made to be pretty challenging, and so far it has been. Starting out, you will most likely die a bunch until you get used to the controls/handling and flow of combat. Which speaking of, the flow of the game is generally go through a really pretty/atmospheric area and then into a combat arena, and this repeats through most of the game. Although, it did suprise me to see a hub level within the game as well as simple dialogue within it. Even with that, the level design still seems a bit lazy, and could have been fleshes out a bit more into something along the lines of exploring multiple different paths to get the means with which to open another path or area.

But besides the super satisfying combat, it also has both a phenominal atmosphere and soundtrack, some of the best I have seen in a game in a while. The dialogue itself is generally a mix of hit or miss lines (and a decent, but heavy accented voice line occasionally), which is the only really glaring issue I have seen so far. But all of the character designs are great, with the main character being one of my all time favorites nearly instantly. The helmet light images shown and silent body language he conveys during dialogue are great, and really make him pull off the silent badass character stereotype well.

Overall, I would say it is definitely worth the full price if you are willing to overlook the eh dialogue and somewhat lazy level design for a game with astoundingly fun and fast paced twitchy combat drenched in atmosphere.

剧情方面方面可以让人感受出独立游戏作者没钱的无奈，结局感觉很仓促还很突兀，虽然场景中有些铺垫，但感觉还是很突然。角色方面NPC设定很“赛博朋克”，很喜欢，但是设定很深表现很浅，估计也是因为没钱。场景方面，拥挤杂乱的道路，性、暴力、烟酒，堕落感十足，战斗流畅，技能丰富，就是部分技能过强，应该让持续性技能的消耗随难度增加上涨，不然最高难度下只要有时间减慢这技能大部分战斗还是很简单，配合“手雷”技能清场太快，技能太强导致武器显得有些鸡肋，习惯操作后完全能不用枪械。总之我觉得是款非常不错的赛博朋克类俯视角动作游戏，这款游戏的“世界”应该继续延续下去

35236913.review:
RUINER is a little bit on the short side. I've never played a game like it and I can say I enjoyed it quite a bit. Just wish it was a little bit longer. For the price though it's worth it.

The game has some flaws. Other than the main storyline there's not much else to do. It would have been nice to have a few extra modes to kill some enemies or maybe some interesting side quests given there's a hub in the game.

The characters in the hub do give you some extra tasks to accomplish but it doesn't really move the game forward much and the game doesn't really make it clear how to go back and get some of those tasks done, or why you would want to. Most of them you accomplish in the main story anyway so it seems a little pointless. Maybe the developers ran out of time while fleshing out the hub. 

Storywise, once you've finished the game there really is no reason to go back and play RUINER again, unless maybe there's a different ending that I didn't get.

The enemies are for the most part similar to each other. One of the bosses is recycled three or four times. Even though every enemy in the game gets its own introduction, they vary very little in actual gameplay mechanics. The game can be very tough but once you get a certain moveset it's easy to figure out how to cheese the game. The harder difficulty modes are definitely tougher but I didn't find them more fun, just more frustrating. 

I think the developers should have foregone with the difficulty notches and instead make the first playthrough at a tough difficulty (normal) and then added a new game plus with a very tough difficulty (hard) and completely have gotten rid of easy. I think this would have not only stretched out the longetivity of the game but also provided players with a little bit more reason to go back and explore the game.

I would say the game is highly style over substance. The presentation is flawless but the game itself is lacking a bit. That being said it was a hell of a lot of fun and I enjoyed my time playing it.

『血肉と労働が企業に利益をもたらし、暴力が再分配する』～『寡占後の社会』(1989年・イギリス)

2091年、レンゴク・シティにようこそ。君は兄を救うため、たった一人で強力な私兵を抱えるメガコーポ相手に立ち向かわなくてはならない。胡散臭いガラクタ銃からレールガンをぶっ放し、昔懐かしの鉄パイプやらレーザーブレードを振るって哀れな特殊自営業員を撲殺しよう。

HotlineMiamiめいて骨太な難易度と死んでもRを押せばリセット系見下ろし型のアクションゲーム。数多くあるスキルを活用し、敵を翻弄しつつ虐殺しましょう。また、技術の進歩が人類の大多数を搾取するようになったサイバーパンク世界をグラフィック・音楽・文章(・翻訳)で無機質かつ血なま臭く描いているのも魅力的です。

35236669.review:
RUINER destaca por su estilo Cyberpunk y ambientación neon. Podría decirse que es una mezcla entre NexMachina (mundo y personaje) y HotlineMiami (gameplay). Al igual que este último, es violento y se presenta como tal desde el primer momento, intenta ofrecer placer a traves de la violencia y la convierte en su principal medio narrativo. Cabe destacar que a diferencia de los triple A a los que estamos acostumbrados, el juego tiene una personalidad que lo hace diferente y una compra a tener en cuenta.

Pros.:
- Ambientación: Un mundo precioso y detallado para todo amante del cyberpunk y glow.
- Gameplay: Rápido, satisfactorio y bien elaborado.
- El personaje es un factor a tener en cuenta. RUINER no sería sin su protagonista.
- Música bien escogida.
- Precio.

Conts.:
- El soundtrack encaja con el juego pero deberían aprovechar y darle más importancia.
- Desearás encerrarte en tu cuarto hasta terminar el juego :D


Neutr.:
+ Dificultad: Exige un mínimo de habilidad, concentración y paciencia.
+ Personajes mudos.

En resumen, audio visual y técnicamente es una obra maestra que opta por convertir la matanza en arte y no provocar ningún tipo de remordimiento, como hizo Hotline.

一款比较亲民的Hardcore俯视角干架游戏（共产主义铁管比你们什么垃圾枪牛逼多了，一棍子一个还能发波）（啊。。除了Boss和霰弹兵之外）
画风很踏实，并没有极力突出科幻感，不会有很脱节的感觉。
背景和剧情上属于反乌托邦式的典型赛博朋客，大型企业用喵星人洗脑全世界人民x 男主挖出幕后秘密什么的

整体的气氛并不沉闷，有一种颓废和轻松的感觉，尤其是过完教学在贫民窟乱逛的时候，混乱，嘈杂，肮脏不堪的环境，五颜六色的灯光和不时会有哼歌声，平稳的背景音乐形成了强烈的反差，虽然大多数居民只会重复对话，但是对话还是蛮有趣的，比如地图最右下角，坐在游戏店门口的兜帽小哥。

GaymePlay上还好，战斗属于分段式的，很传统的丢到封闭空间里然后靠神经反射和共产主义铁棒来解决问题（一枪打不死人的枪都是Nerf）键鼠操作起来很流畅，游戏的初始技能也很有趣，单从游戏性的方面讲，战斗系统很简洁，就像看爽片一样的感觉，也许在之后解锁大部分技能之后游戏会变得更有趣。

剧情对话框人物的立绘很棒,有神韵的

为什么做满100个俯卧撑没有成就，狗屎

现在来看的话水平还算很不错的了。等通关之后再追加评价
谢谢看完~

35234412.review:
"Ruiner? I hardly know 'er!"

I really wanted to like this game.
The setting is cool, the visuals are neat, the soundtrack is solid...

But mechanically this game is a few mistakes away from being a total trash fire.

Probably my biggest gripe is that the gameplay in the trailers makes the game seem like Hotline Miami, in which you're dropped into a level & are free to dispose of enemies as you see fit when you come across them. In actuality, it's quite the other way around- you walk down some form of linear corridor before reaching a slightly more open area that you will inevitably be walled into while enemies spawn in around you & you're forced to survive them in small waves, like some kind of half-arsed top-down Killing Floor.

Past that, certain key mappings are very awkward, & they are all seemingly hard-coded so you cannot remap them to be more convenient.
Many "cover" objects/obstacles in maps are flat-out broken, allowing you/your enemies to press up to them & become completely damage-proof from one side, yet still shoot at enemies in any direction without being impeded whatsoever. I could forgive it if we were talking about thin barricades & walls, but most of the objects I'm referring to are more along the lines of solid rectangular shipping containers.
Guns are underpowered while a charged melee attack has nearly as much range, far greater & more accurate spread, & doesn't break or run out of ammo while being a one-hit-kill for most enemies; saving you from having to expose yourself long enough to put multiple shots into a gun-wielding enemy & effectively making a majority of guns useless. While I'm sure there are plenty more options that open up to the player the further they progress & upgrade their abilities, for the first few levels that's the single most effective strategy & it makes the gameplay go stale almost instantly.

In all, it could be a lot worse for the price tag, but the issues I've listed just flat-out make the game frustrating & boring to play. I can't recommend it in good conscience.

35233917.review:
[h1]Hello, darkness.[/h1]
[b]I came into ruiner expecting a Hotline Miami-esque game with a very pretty cyberpunk aesthetic that I could oogle over whilst smashing in the heads of anyone who was unlucky enough to get in my way. I had this game in my mind for weeks, if not months, about reliving the pleasure I got of playing Hotline Miami for the very first time. What I got was part of what I wanted, and part of what I wasn't expecting, resulting in an extremely satisfying and fun game.[/b]

[h1]Gameplay.[/h1]
[b]To touch upon what I had said prior, I was expecting this to be Hotline Miami with a health bar. While it is similar in theory, in practice it is not. The game feels a lot like a twin stick shooter at times, or it can feel like Hotline's very fast melee oriented combat with emphasis on dodging and using abilities. There is many ways to play RUINER, from the use of your dash skills and skills to enhance your already potent weapons, such as the RUINER itself, or you can max out your shield and dash to become a very aggressive melee player. There is no wrong way to play RUINER, although there is certain situations that require certain playstyles to advance easier. Very rarely are you forced to play a certain way, and I believe that is one of the game's strongest feats. You can play how you want and at whatever pace you want. Just make sure you kill the boss.[/b]

[h1]Story.[/h1]
[b]I wasn't expecting much. I expected this to be some tale of a man on the run from a misfortune brought upon him from the trailer. I got a revenge and savior plot wrapped into one, with genuine mystery and some very dark scenes that prey upon your morality. While things are often forced and linear, you can still make some choice within the game. However, the story as it presents itself is very nicely done with interesting dialogue and likable characters, even some of the characters with little to no lines can manage to be of interest to you.

[h1]VIsuals.[/h1]
[b]The game features a very muted colour scheme most of the time. Grays, dark blues and blacks with bright whites to break the darkness and blind you. Red flashes and glitches in the screen, subliminal messages reminding you of objectives. There's tons to see and it is all thrown at you in very rapid succession, something that I personally love. However, not everything in the game is breakneck in pace. The hub world you visit between missions is also very aesthetically pleasing, with various times of day being displayed throughout the game, such as night or a very orange dusk that looms over the temporary sanctuary.[/b]

[h1]Overall.[/h1]
[b]RUINER is every aesthetic lover's dream. It has style, great music and a very charming gameplay flow. If you are a fan of Hotline Miami like myself, you will find yourself pleasantly delighted by familiar controls in an entirely different setting and pace. The game is extremely fast paced at times, and during others it allows you to slow down and pick off enemies. The way, and the speed, of the game is yours to pick and choose. RUINER is an absolutely amazing display of what a small developer can make a very enjoyable game with love and effort put within its gameplay and story. A must buy, if you ask me, and at $20 the game is a steal. Go get 'em, Puppy. ⊂(＾▽＾)つ[/b]

[h1]9/10[/h1]

35233764.review:
This game is fucking amazing. 

Great atmosphere, extremely satysfying gameplay, fluid and unforgiving combat, lots of usefull shit like weapons and switchable skills - they define your way of killing hordes of enemies or bosses; dialogues while being brief - are on point. The girl that guides you is <3, it's hard to imagine a better companion for cyberpunk.

Game played on HARD is HARD, although I wouldn't tell that the first half of the game is as hard as many say, it was quite easy for me after hours of playing other twin sticks, but the second part of the game is where things are becoming really hardcore and fun. Fights are super challenging, but doable and fair, it's not all cheese as in some other hardcore games.

All in all this is hell of a good rare gem that is NOT FOR EVERYONE, even if you love cyberpunk I wouldn't recommend you this game if you give up after few tries and don't like the challenge crazy concentrated game sessions (well, you still could play on easy and enjoy the glorious visuals and atmosphere of the game).


But If you like hardcore twinstick shooters - you will LOVE this one and I cannot recommend this game enough.

If you don't like - don't bother. Shit happens, puppy.

PS. You probably want to play this one on a gamepad.

35233405.review:
KILL BOSS

Evveeett !! Sonunda 1 yıldır beklediğim oyunu deneme fırsatı buldum. Oyunu 52 dakika deneyimledim henüz. Türkler'den ilk inceleyen olmak güzel bir his oldu bu arada. Bu süreçte size şunları söylemek isterim ki oyun muazzam bir prologue bölümüyle açılıyor. Gerek müzik gerekse atmosfer ve tasarımlar olarak hem retro hem cyberpunk öğeleri mükemmel harmanlanmış, daha ilk girişte bunu hissedebiliyorsunuz. Gelgelelim combat mekaniklerine; oyuna girdiğinizde sizi 2 tane yetenek bekliyor biri savunma biri atak amaçlı, yavaş yavaş sayıları artan düşmanlara karşı becerilerinizi göstermelisiniz ki emin olun hiç o kadar kolay değil. Prologue'nin sonunda ki ilk boss'a geldiğinizde bunu anlayacaksınız, gerçekten aşırı denebilecek bir zorluğu var,  fakat bu oyuna daha çok bağlıyor. Rage quit atmadan bekleyin, defalarca ölün (ki bende öldüm), Mouseun sağ sol tuşlarına asıla asıla ilk bölümü geçerseniz mantığı kavrıyorsunuz. Oyun Hotline Miami'nin açık dünya versiyonu, evet oyun açık dünya, çok büyük olduğunu düşünmüyorum daha başlarındayım fakat Rengkok'ta daha ilk 1 saatimde çok çeşitli insanlarla ve yan görevlerle tanıştım. Bu da demektir ki düz git ilerle bölümü bitir mantığı güdülmemiş, yani oyun süremiz, çevreyi araştırmamıza ve insanlarla iletişim kurmamıza göre epey uzun olabilir. Toparlayacak olursak; Hotline Miami vari eğlenceli bir zorluğa hasretseniz ve çok fazla diyalog içerdiği için İngilizcenize'de güveniyorsanız bu yılın en farklı oyunlarından birini denemelisiniz.

3.Saat sonunda gelen edit:

-Oyunun grafik ve optimizasyonuna değinmediğimin farkına vardım, grafikleri izometrik bir oyuna göre gayet yeterli. Işıklandırmalar süperötesi iyi çalışılmış. Optimizasyonu da harikulade en ufak bir fps düşüşü yaşamadım şahsen, zaten fazla sistem isteyen bir oyun değil çoğumuzun bilgisayarında rahatlıkla çalışır. 

-Bu süreçte şehri daha çok gezme imkanı buldum, evet Rengkok City biraz küçük, ama içi gerçekten çok hoş detaylarla ve sevimli yan görevlerle doldurulmuş, her NPC'nin bir hikayesi var, çoğuyla iletişime geçebiliyorsunuz fakat geçemediklerinizin bile yanında durursanız ayaküstü anlatacak çok şeyleri oluyor ^^

-Sanırım ilk başta dediğim aşırı zor kısmı oyunun kontrollerine alışana kadarmış, şu an gayet rahat ve fazla zorlanmadan oynayabiliyorum. Skill ve silah çeşitliliği bolca var, gerek bosslardan gerekse öldürülen düşmanlardan yeni yeni silahlarla oynama şansı buluyorsunuz, fakat tıpkı Hotline Miami'de ki gibi mermi sınırlaması var, aldığınız silahta ki mermi veya damage süresi bitince ana silahlara dönüş yapıyor.

-Yapay zeka illet derecesinde iyi ve de güçlü, sakın ha durup şunu öldüreyim mantığı aramayın, durursanız biletiniz kesilir. Fakat save noktaları çok iyi hemen öldüğünüz yerden vakit kaybetmeden başlatıyor. Hızlı oyun, olabildiğince hızlı olmalısınız. Bu arada boss çeşitliliği fazla.

-Oyunda belirli yerlere girmek ve punklardan saygı görmek için Karma puanlarını toplamalısınız, bu yüzden yan görevlerde çok önemli.

-Son olarakta her bölümün kendine ait sağlam/gaza getiren müzikleri var, kulaklıkla son ses oynamanızı tavsiye ediyorum. İyi eğlenceler !
